SourceText: Remind yourself that “Everything is ok”.
text: Zikhumbuze ukuthi “Konke kuhamba kahle”.

SourceText: Give Yourself A Hug
text: Zange wena

SourceText: Bella mama, bella mama hey.
text: Bella mama, bella mama hey.

SourceText: Hey there! How are you feeling today? Do you feel great?!
text: Sawubona lapho! Uzizwa kanjani namuhla? Ngabe uzizwa ukahle?!

SourceText: Maybe not. Maybe you shouted again at your children today? Maybe you got angry and said something you don't feel proud of? It’s ok. It’s super stressful right now.
text: Mhlawumbe akunjalo. Mhlawumbe uke waphinde wathethisa izingane zakho namuhla? Mhlawumbe udiniwe washo into ozisolayo ngayo? Kulungile. Njengamanje unengcindezi enkulu.

SourceText: Take a deep breath and think of one thing you did today that you do feel proud of. It doesn't have to be big. And wrap your arms around your body and give yourself a hug. And now think of one thing you did today that you don't feel proud of. What can you do differently tomorrow? And wrap your arms around your body and give yourself a hug.
text: Phefumula kakhulu bese ucabanga into eyodwa enhle oyenzile namuhla oziqhenyayo ngayo. Akudingeki kube yizinto ezinkulu. Zibambe ngezingalo zakho emzimbeni bese uyazanga. Njengamanje cabanga into eyodwa oyenzile namuhla ongaziqhenyi ngayo.  Yini ongayenza ngokwehlukile kusasa? Zibambe ngezingalo zakho emzimbeni bese uyazanga.

SourceText: Bella mama, bella mama, bella mama, bella mama, bella mama, bella mama hey”.
text: Bella mama, bella mama, bella mama, bella mama, bella mama, bella mama hey”.

SourceText: Hello @fields.user_name! Did you know that 3 is a magical number? Breathe in to the count of three and breathe out to the count of three. How do you feel now? Do you feel any different?
text: Sawubona @fields.user_name! Ngabe bewazi ukuthi unombolo 3 yinombolo yemilingo? Donsa umoya ubale kathathu bese uyawukhipha futhi ubala kathathu. Uzizwa kanjani? Ingabe ukhona umehluko owuzwayo?
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated. @results.count is a number (counter for list)

SourceText: Hello! Did you know that 3 is a magical number? Breathe in to the count of three and breathe out to the count of three. How do you feel now? Do you feel any different?
text: Sawubona! Ngabe bewazi ukuthi unombolo 3 yinombolo yemilingo? Donsa umoya ubale kathathu bese uyawukhipha futhi ubala kathathu. Uzizwa kanjani? Ingabe ukhona umehluko owuzwayo?

SourceText: What are your three favourite foods? Can you name three things you can see right now? Can you hear three sounds you can hear right now? What are three things you are grateful for right now?
text: Yisho ukudla okuthathu okuthanda kakhulu? Ungazisho izinto ezintathu ozibonayo manje? Ikhona imisindo emithathu oyizwayo manje? Yiziphi izinto ezintathu ozijabulelayo njengamanje?

SourceText: Breathe in to the count of three and breathe out to the count of three? How do you feel now? Do you feel any different? Three is a magical number!
text: Donsa umoya ubale kathathu bese uyawukhipha futhi ubale kathathu. Uzizwa kanjani? Ingabe ukhona umehluko owuzwayo? Inombolo 3 yinimbolo yemilingo!

SourceText: Release Some Energy
text: Khulula Umzimba Kancane

SourceText: Baba da bi da ba da baaa! Pause Power!
text: Baba da bi da ba da baaa! Amandla Ekhefu!

SourceText: What’s Pause Power I hear you say? It’s the ability to transform from a grumpy, angry person into a calm, clear one.
text: Yini amandla ekhefu okhuluma ngawo? Yikhono lokushintsha ukudinwa nolaka, uphole futhi uthobeke.

SourceText: When I’m feeling frustrated I plant my feet firmly on the ground and I breathe in and out three times as slowly as I can. Sometimes I imagine I’m smelling a flower and blowing out a candle.
text: Uma ngizizwa ngidiniwe ngiyama ngizimelele bese ngiphefumula ngidonse umoya kathathu ngiwukhiphe futhi kathathu. Ngesinye isikhathi ngiye ngizicabange sengathi ngihogela izimbali bese ngiphephetha ikhandlela

SourceText: Da ta! Pause Power! My transformation from grumpy to calm is complete!
text: Da ta! Amandla Ekhefu! Ngisuke sengishintshile ukudinwa sengipholile!

SourceText: Taking care of yourself
text: Zinakekele

SourceText: Recognise what is happening for you in this moment. What are you thinking? Are your thoughts positive or negative. How do you feel? Do you feel pleasant or unpleasant? How does your body feel? Do you feel tense or relaxed?
text: Qaphela lokho okwenzekayo kuwe njengamanje. Yini oyicabangayo? Ingabe imicabango yakho mihle noma mibi. Uzizwa kanjani? Ingabe uzizwa ujabule noma ungajabule? Umzimba wakho uzizwa kanjani? Ingabe uzizwa ubophekile noma ukhululekile?

SourceText: Connect to your heart in a kind and gentle way. You may want to place one hand on your heart or chest.
text: Xhumana nenhliziyo yakho ngendlela enomusa nemnene. Ungase ufune ukubeka isandla esisodwa enhliziyweni yakho noma esifubeni.

SourceText: You can then say the following words silently to yourself:
text: Buthule yisho la mazwi alandelayo kuwe:

SourceText: Take a moment to reflect on your experience. Remember that you can do this activity at any time whenever you feel like you need extra support.
text: Zinike isikhathi sokucabanga ngokwenzeke kuwe. Khumbula ukuthi lokhu ungakwenza noma nini uma uzizwa sengathi udinga ukwesekwa okuthe xaxa.

SourceText: Cooking together
text: Ukupheka ndawonye

SourceText: Children love to do what you do!
text: Izingane ziyathanda ukwenza lokho okwenzayo!

SourceText: Let your baby play with pots and spoons while you are making dinner.
text: Vumela ingane idlale ngamabhodwe nezipunu ngesikhathi wena ulungisa ukudla.

SourceText: Dance Party
text: Iphathi yokudansa

SourceText: Put on your favourite music or sing your favourite song and dance around the room with your toddler. If you have a baby hold them while you dance.
text: Faka umculo owukhonzile noma ucule iculo olithandayo bese niyadansa endlini kanye nengane yakho.  Uma unengane yibambe ngesikhathi udansa.

SourceText: Dance in different ways or with different parts of your body.
text: Dansa ngezindlela ezahlukene noma ngezingxenye ezahlukene zomzimba wakho.

SourceText: For example, “Dance like a monkey”, “Dance like a chicken” or “Let’s dance with our knees and hips.”
text: Isibonelo, “Dansa njengenkawu”, “Dansa njengenkukhu” noma “Asidanse ngamadolo namaqolo ethu.”

SourceText: Think up different instructions. Be seriously playful!
text: Cabanga ezinye izinto ongazisho. Zimisele ngokudlala!

SourceText: When the music stops, everyone does a funny freeze.
text: Uma kuphela umculo, wonke umuntu kumele ame ngendlela ehlekisayo.

SourceText: Notice what rhythms or movements they like!
text: Qaphela ukuthi yikuphi ukudansa nzingoma abakuthandayo!

SourceText: Down in a ditch!
text: Khasa phansi!

SourceText: Sit on a chair and put your toddler on your lap facing you. Hold them firmly under the arms.
text: Hlala esihlalweni bese ubeka ingane yakho emathangeni ibheke ngakuwena. Babambe ubaqinise ngaphansi kwezingalo.

SourceText: Gently bounce your legs and say in a soft voice “Baby horse, baby horse, baby horse, baby horse”
text: Nyakazisa kancane imilenze bese usho ngezwi eliphansi “Ngane yehhashi, ngane yehhashi, ngane yehhashi, ngane yehhashi”

SourceText: Bounce your legs a bit more and say a bit louder “Little horse, little horse, little horse, little horse”
text: Gxumisa imilenze kakhudlwana bese usho kakhudlwana ukuthi “Hhashi elincane, hhashi elincane, hhashi elincane, hhashi elincane”

SourceText: Bounce your legs more and say louder “Big horse, big horse, big horse, big horse”
text: Gxumisa imilenze kakhulu bese usho kakhulu “Hhashi elikhulu, hhashi elikhulu, hhashi elikhulu, hhashi elikhulu”

SourceText: When you call out “Down in a ditch!” open your knees and let your child drop down between them. Make sure you hold them so they don’t fall far!
text: Uma usumemeza uthi “Shona phansi!” vula imilenze yakho bese wenza ingane yakho iwele phakathi kwayo. Qinisekisa ukuthi uyayibamba ukuze ingaweli kude!

SourceText: Funny Faces
text: Ubuso obuhlekisayo

SourceText: Look at your baby in the eyes and make different funny faces.
text: Bheka ingane yakho emehlweni bese wenza ubuso obuhlekisayo obehlukahlukene.

SourceText: Make a big face. Make a small face. Make a happy face. Make a surprised face.
text: Yenza ubuso obukhulu. Yenza ubuso obuncane. Yenza ubuso obujabule. Yenza ubuso obumangele.

SourceText: Which ones make your baby smile or laugh? Do them again, even bigger this time!
text: Ibuphi obenza ingane yakho imoyizele noma ihleke? Yenza futhi, wenze kakhudlwana kulokhu!

SourceText: Play with different feelings and add sounds.
text: Dlala ngemizwa ehlukene wengeze nemisindo.

SourceText: Copy their facial expressions too. Exaggerate them to make them funny.
text: Kopela indlela nabo abenza ngayo ebusweni babo. Kwenze kube yihaba ukuze kuhlekise.

SourceText: Always end on a positive expression!
text: Gcina njalo ngokwenza ubuso ababuthandayo.

SourceText: Mirror Game
text: Umdlalo wesibuko

SourceText: • Get to your baby's level so they can see you and hear you.
text: • Zama ukulingana nengane yakho khona izokwazi ukukubona nokukuzwa.

SourceText: • Copy their facial expressions and sounds.
text: • Kopela ubuso babo nemisindo abayenzayo.

SourceText: • It is simple and helps create a strong bond between you and your baby!
text: • Kulula futhi kuyasiza ukwenza kube nobudlelwane obuqinile kuwena nengane yakho.

SourceText: Musical Toes
text: Ukudansisa izinzwane

SourceText: Put your baby on their back.
text: Lalisa ingane yakho ngomhlane.

SourceText: Wiggle their toe and say, “This little toe goes [funny sound].”
text: Kitaza izinzwane zayo bese uthi, “Lolu zwane oluncane luthi [bese wenza umsindo ohlekisayo].”

SourceText: Make a funny sound for each toe.
text: Yenza umsindo ohlekisayo wozwane ngalunye.

SourceText: Play with different sounds. For example, animal sounds, popping sounds, squeaky sounds, fart sounds.
text: Dlala ngemisindo ehlukahlukene. Isibonelo, imisindo yezilwane, imisindo eqhumayo, imisindo etswininizayo, nemisindo esuzayo.

SourceText: Repeat this for all ten toes.
text: Kuphinde lokhu kuzona zonke izinzwane eziyishumi.

SourceText: Try to make the last toe the biggest and funniest sound!
text: Zama ukwenza ukuthi uzwane lokugcina lwenze umsindo omkhulu futhi ohlekisa kakhulu!

SourceText: Peek-a-Boo!
text: Peek-a-Boo!

SourceText: • Cover your face with your hands.
text: • Vala ubuso bakho ngezandla zakho.

SourceText: • Quickly show your face and say "Peek-a-Boo!" or "Hello!" Babies love it!
text: • Veza ubuso bakho ngokushesha bese uthi “Peek-a-Boo!” noma “Sawubona!” Izingane ziyakuthanda lokho!

SourceText: See It Be It
text: Ziphendule into oyibonayo

SourceText: Look around you and name something that you can see. For example, a tree or a cup.
text: Qalaza okuseduzane bese usho into okwazi ukuyibona. Isibonelo, isihlahla noma inkomishi.

SourceText: Say to your child “I see a tree, let’s be it”.
text: Yithi enganeni yakho “Ngibona isihlahla, asibeni yisona”.

SourceText: Countdown from 5 and make the shape of a tree with your bodies. Be as big and silly as possible.
text: Bala usukele ku-5 wehle njalo bese wenza isimo sesihlahla ngomzimba wakho. Zama ukuba mkhulu ngayo yonke indlela.

SourceText: Now let your child have a turn. What can they see?
text: Manje-ke nika ingane yakho ithuba lokwenza. Yini bona abayibonayo?

SourceText: If you can, go outside and be in nature. If you can’t, play it inside.
text: Uma ungakwazi, phumela phandle ube sendaweni enezinto eziyimvelo. Uma ungakwazi lo mdlalo wudlalele endlini.

SourceText: When you’ve done it a few times, add moves and sounds!
text: Uma usuwenze izikhashana ezimbalwa, yengeza ngeminyakazo nemisindo!

SourceText: Shakers
text: Ukuxukuza

SourceText: Find an empty, clean plastic bottle or pot with a lid that closes tight.
text: Thola ibhodlela noma ibhodwe elingenalutho, elihlanzekile elinesivalo esivaleka siqine.

SourceText: Fill it with sand, stones, uncooked rice, beans or any small objects that make an interesting sound.
text: Ligcwalise ngenhlabathi, amatshe, irayisi elingaphekiwe, ubhontshisi nanoma yini enye eyizinhlamvu ezincane eyenza umsindo omnandi.

SourceText: Move your body as you shake it in front of your baby.
text: Nyakazisa umzimba wakho ngesikhathi uyixukuza phambi kwengane.

SourceText: If it is safe, give it to your baby to shake!
text: Uma kuphephile, nika ingane yakho nayo ixukuze!

SourceText: Get creative! Can you find something colourful or try it with water?
text: Qhamuka namanye amacebo! Kukhona ongakuthola okunombala ogqamile noma uzame ngamanzi?

SourceText: What sounds does your baby like?
text: Yimuphi umsindo othandwa yingane yakho?

SourceText: The Sun is Coming!
text: Ilanga Liyeza!

SourceText: Lie your baby on their back after washing them or changing their diaper.
text: Lalisa ingane yakho ngomhlane uma uqeda ukuyigeza noma ukuyishintsha inabukeni.

SourceText: Tell them the sun is coming! Wiggle your fingers like sun rays above their head and make your face a big smiling sun.
text: Itshele ukuthi liyeza ilanga! Nyakazisa iminwe yakho njengemisebe yelanga ekhanda layo bese wenza ubuso bakho bube bukhulu futhi bumoyizele njengelanga.

SourceText: Tell them the wind is coming! Blow softly over their body.
text: Itshele ukuthi uyeza umoya! Phephetha kancane emzimbeni wayo.

SourceText: Tell them the rain is coming! Use your fingers to gently pat over their whole body like light raindrops.
text: batshele ukuthi iyeza imvula! Sebenzisa iminwe yakho ukuyithinta emzimbeni wonke njengamathonsi emvula.

SourceText: Tell them the clouds are coming! Wrap the towel or cloth around them like a blanket and cuddle them.
text: batshele ukuthi ayeza amafu! Goqa ithawula noma indwangu emzimbeni wayo njengengubo bese uyayigona.

SourceText: Play with different weathers. Which one does your baby like best?
text: Dlala ngezinhlobo ezahlukene zesimo sezulu. Ngabe iyona yiphi ethandwa yingane yakho kakhulu?

SourceText: Add sound effects or make it into a little song. Use the tune of another song you know!
text: Yengeza imisindo noma wenze iculo elincane. Sebenzisa umnkenenezo wenye ingoma oyaziyo!

SourceText: At the End of the Day
text: Ekupheleni Kosuku

SourceText: At the end of each day, take a minute to think about the day.
text: Ekupheleni kosuku ngalunye, thatha umzuzu wokucabanga ngosuku.

SourceText: Talk to your child about one positive or fun thing they did.
text: Khuluma nengane yakho ngento eyodwa enhle noma emnandi eyenzile

SourceText: Praise yourself for one thing you did well today.
text: Zincome ngento eyodwa oyenze kahle namuhla.

SourceText: Think of one thing that you are grateful for.
text: Cabanga into eyodwa obongayo ngayo.

SourceText: You are a star!
text: Uyiqhawe!

SourceText: Lullaby
text: Ukuthuthuzela

SourceText: When your baby or toddler cries, sing a soft song to calm you both down.
text: Uma ingane yakho noma udado wakho ekhala, cula icula ukwehlisa umoya kinina nobabili.

SourceText: Sing a soothing song you know or make up your own with a simple melody and some soothing words.
text: Cula iculo elithuthuzelayo olaziyo noma uzakhele lakho ngomnkenenezo omnandi noma amazwi amnandi.

SourceText: Repeat it over and over in a rhythmical way. For example, “My little one, oh little one”.
text: Lokhu uliphindaphinda ngendlela ewumnkenenezo. Isibonelo, “umancane wami, oh mancane”.

SourceText: Sing the same song regularly so your child gets used to it!
text: Cula iculo elifanayo njalo ukuze ingane igcine isilijwayele!

SourceText: Shake your left hands in the air 8 times while counting to 8
text: Nyakazisa isandla sakho sobunxele emoyeni izikhathi ziwu-8 ngesikhathi ubala uze ufika ku-8

SourceText: Repeat with your other hand. Repeat with each foot.
text: Yenza futhi nangesinye isandla  Phinda futhi ngonyawo ngalunye.

SourceText: Do it 7 times, then 6 times and continue until you get to 1.
text: Yenza izikhathi eziwu-7, bese wenza izikhathi eziwu-6 uqhubeke njalo uze ufike ku-1.

SourceText: Everyone calls out “Crazy chicken” and does their best crazy chicken dance!
text: Wonke umuntu umemeza athi “Inkukhu ehlanyayo” bese nonke neza umdanso wenkukhu ehlanyayo!

SourceText: Dance choreography
text: Ukufundisa isitayela sokudansa

SourceText: Create a dance choreography to your children’s favorite songs.
text: Qala isitayela sokudansela ingoma ethandwa yizingane zakho.

SourceText: First person does a dance move and everyone else copies.
text: Umuntu wokuqala wenza isitayela somdanso bese bonke abanye bayamlandela.

SourceText: Everyone takes turns being the leader.
text: Bonke bayashintshana ngokuzihola phambili.

SourceText: Perform it for the household!
text: Danselani wonke umuntu ekhaya!

SourceText: Play or sing your favourite music and dance around the room.
text: Dlala noma ucule ingoma emnandi bese niyadansa indlu yonke.

SourceText: For example, “Dance like a monkey”, “Dance like a chicken” or “Dance with just our knees and hips”.
text: Isibonelo, “Dansa njengenkawu”, “Dansa njengenkukhu” noma “Dansa ngamadolo neqolo”.

SourceText: When the music stops, everyone does a funny freeze.
text: Uma kuphela umculo, wonke umuntu kumele ame ngendlela ehlekisayo.

SourceText: Give your child a chance to be the one to stop the music!
text: Nika ingane yakho ithuba lokuthi kube yiyona emisa iculo!

SourceText: Freeze dance
text: Umdanso wokuma unganyakazi

SourceText: Play music or someone sings a song, and everyone dances.
text: Dlala umculo noma omunye akacule iculo, bese wonke umuntu uyadansa.

SourceText: When the music stops, everyone must freeze.
text: Uma umculo uphela, wonke umuntu kumele ame anganyakazi.

SourceText: Last person still dancing becomes the judge for the next round.
text: Umuntu wokugcina ukuma ukudansa nguyena oba yijaji uma sekuphindwa futhi.

SourceText: A variation to Freeze Dance is Animal Dance: It’s the same as Freeze Dance but when the music stops, one member of the family calls out the name of an animal, and everyone has to become that animal.
text: Okunye okufana nomdanso wokuma wuMdanso Wezilwane. Uyafana nomdanso Wokuma unganyakazi uma umculo unqamuka, ilungu elilodwa lomndeni lisho igama lesilwane, bese wonke umuntu eba yileso silwane.

SourceText: Mirror
text: Isibuko

SourceText: This game can be played in pairs or even as a group.
text: Lo mdlalo ungadlalwa ngababili noma niyiqoqo.

SourceText: Stand facing each other or in a circle.
text: Qalani ngokubhekana noma nime isikokela.

SourceText: One person leads first while everyone else must copy, trying to move exactly at the same time as the leader.
text: Umuntu oyedwa uhamba phambili bese abanye beyamlingisela, bezama ukwenzisa okwakhe.

SourceText: Make sure the leader moves slowly enough for everyone to follow! Explore moving different body parts and in different levels.
text: Qiniseka ukuthi ohamba phambili akasheshisi ukuze nabanye bakwazi ukumlandela! Zama ukunyakazisa izingxenye ezahlukene zomzimba emazingeni angefani.

SourceText: After a while, switch who is leading. Give everyone a chance to lead.
text: Ngemuva kwesikhathi, shintsha umuntu ozohola phambili. Nika wonke umuntu ithuba lokuhola phambili.

SourceText: Try it with no leaders!
text: Zamani kungekho muntu ohola phambili!

SourceText: Here's a video to help you support your child's learning.
text: Nayi i-video ezokusiza ulekelele izingane zakho uma zifunda.

SourceText: Here's an audio message to help you support your child's learning.
text: Nawu umyalezo ozokusiza weseke izingane zakho uma zifunda.

SourceText: Here are 5 steps that you can do to help your children continue learning during this time:
text: Nazi izigaba ezingu-5 ezizosiza ingane yakho iqhubeke nokufunda ngalesi sikhathi:

SourceText: 1. Create a routine around learning and schoolwork
text: 1. Yenza uhlelo oluqondile lokufunda nomsebenzi wesikole

SourceText: 2. Make learning fun and playful
text: 2. Yenza ukufunda kube mnandi kuthi kuhambisane nokudlala

SourceText: 3. Remember that you are a parent NOT a substitute teacher
text: 3. Khumbula ukuthi awuyena ungumzali awumele uthisha

SourceText: 4. Stay connected with your child's school and teachers
text: 4. Hlale njalo uxhumana nesikole nothisha bengane yakho

SourceText: 5. Support your child when they return to school
text: 5. Yeseka izingane zakho uma sezibuyela esikoleni

SourceText: Type "1" to "5" to learn more about each tip. Type "N" to stop this tip.
text: Bhala “1” kuye ku “5” ukufunda kabanzi ngethiphu ngayinye. Bhala u “N” ukumisa le thiphu.

SourceText: Please select another number if you want to learn more about how to support your child's learning:
text: Khetha enye inombolo uma ufuna ukufunda kabanzi ngokuthi ungayeseka kanjani ingane yakho emfundweni:

SourceText: Step 5. Support your child when they go back to school
text: Isinyathelo 5. Yeseka ingane yakho uma ibuyela esikoleni

SourceText: Tell @fields.child_nickname that it is okay to feel scared or worried about going back to school. Allow your child to share how they are feeling. It is also normal if your child behaves differently to their usual behaviour. Discuss how going to school might be different and how they can protect themselves from COVID-19. Ask them how their day went and support them if they experienced any difficulties.
text: Itshele @fields.child_nickname ukuthi akukubi ukuzizwa unovalo noma ukhathazekile ngokubuyela esikoleni. Vumela ingane yakho ukuba ikutshele ukuthi izizwa kanjani Akunankinga futhi uma ingane yakho yenza ngokwehlukile kunalokhu okwaziyo. Khuluma ukuthi ukuya esikoleni kungehluka kanjani nokuthi zingazivikela kanjani kwiCOVID-19 Babuze ukuthi usuku luhambe kanjani bese uyabeseka uma behlangana nezingqinamba.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Tell your child that it is okay to feel scared or worried about going back to school. Allow your child to share how they are feeling. It is also normal if your child behaves differently to their usual behaviour. Discuss how going to school might be different and how they can protect themselves from COVID-19. Ask them how their day went and support them if they experienced any difficulties.
text: Tshela ingane yakho ukuthi kulungile ukuzizwa wethukile noma ukhathazekile ngokubuyela esikoleni. Vumela ingane yakho ukuba ikutshele ukuthi izizwa kanjani Akunankinga futhi uma ingane yakho yenza ngokwehlukile kunalokhu okwaziyo. Khuluma ukuthi ukuya esikoleni kungehluka kanjani nokuthi zingazivikela kanjani kwiCOVID-19 Babuze ukuthi usuku luhambe kanjani bese uyabeseka uma behlangana nezingqinamba.

SourceText: Step 2. Make learning fun and playful
text: Isinyathelo 2. Yenza ukufunda kube mnandi kuthi kuhambisane nokudlala

SourceText: Children learn best when learning is fun! Try to find ways to make learning playful to keep @fields.child_nickname interested and engaged. Type "Help" if you ever need any fun ideas!
text: Izingane zifunda kangcono uma ukufunda kumnandi Zama ukuthola izindlela zokwenza ukufunda kube samdlalo ukuze @fields.child_nickname behlale bejabule futhi bekuthanda. Zama “Usizo” uma udinga noma yimaphi amacebo amnandi!
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Children learn best when learning is fun! Try to find ways to make learning playful to keep your child interested and engaged. Type "Help" if you ever need any fun ideas!
text: Izingane zifunda kangcono uma ukufunda kumnandi Zama ukuthola izindlela zokwenza ukufunda kube samdlalo ukuze ingane ihlale ikuthanda futhi izinikele.  Zama “Usizo” uma udinga noma yimaphi amacebo amnandi!

SourceText: Step 3. Remember that you are a father NOT a substitute teacher!
text: Isinyathelo 3. Khumbula ukuthi ungubaba HHAYI obambele uthisha!

SourceText: Your role is to support your child by creating a space to learn. You do not need to know all the answers. Help them explore their interests and ask questions. Go at @fields.child_nickname's pace and be patient with yourself.
text: Iqhaza lakho wukweseka ingane yakho nokuyinika ithuba lokuba ifunde. Akumele uze ube nazo zonke izimpendulo. Basize ukuthi benze izinto abazithandayo futhi babuze imibuzo. Ngena endaweni ka @fields.child_nickname bese uzinika isikhathi.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Step 3. Remember that you are a mother NOT a substitute teacher!
text: Isinyathelo 3. Khumbula ukuthi ungumama HHAYI obambele uthisha!

SourceText: Step 3. Remember that you are a parent NOT a substitute teacher!
text: Isinyathelo 3. Khumbula ukuthi ungumzali HHAYI obambele uthisha!

SourceText: Your role is to support your child by creating a space to learn. You do not need to know all the answers. Help them explore their interests and ask questions. Go at your child's pace and be patient with yourself.
text: Iqhaza lakho wukweseka ingane yakho nokuyinika ithuba lokuba ifunde. Akumele uze ube nazo zonke izimpendulo. Basize ukuthi benze izinto abazithandayo futhi babuze imibuzo. Ngena endaweni yengane yakho bese uzinika isikhathi.

SourceText: Step 1. Create a routine around learning and schoolwork
text: Isinyathelo 1. Yenza uhlelo oluqondile lokufunda nomsebenzi wesikole

SourceText: Make a daily plan with @fields.child_nickname for when they can spend time doing educational activities. This can include structured schoolwork and other activities online, reading, writing, or arts. Allow flexibility and time for play and relaxation too.
text: Yenza uhlelo lwezinto ezizokwenziwa osukwini no @fields.child_nickname lapho bezochitha khona isikhathi ngezinto ezithinta ukufunda. Lokhu kungabandakanya umsebenzi ohleliwe wesikole nezinye izinto ezitholakala online, ngokufunda, ngokubhala, noma ngobuciko. Vumela ukwenziwa kwanoma yini nesikhathi sokudlala nokuphumula.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Make a daily plan with your child for when they can spend time doing educational activities. This can include structured schoolwork and other activities online, reading, writing, or arts. Allow flexibility and time for play and relaxation too.
text: Yenza ipulani yosuku nengane yakho uma izokwazi ukuchitha isikhathi nawe yenze imisebenzi yezemfundo. Lokhu kungabandakanya umsebenzi ohleliwe wesikole nezinye izinto ezitholakala online, ngokufunda, ngokubhala, noma ngobuciko. Vumela ukwenziwa kwanoma yini nesikhathi sokudlala nokuphumula.

SourceText: Step 4. Stay connected with your child's school and teachers
text: Isinyathelo 4. Hlale njalo uxhumana nesikole nothisha bengane yakho

SourceText: Find out how to stay in touch with @fields.child_nickname’s teacher or school to stay informed, ask questions and get more guidance. If you are struggling or know someone who is struggling with school work or the home situation, please discuss this with a teacher that you feel close to. Parent groups or community groups can also be a good way to support each other with your home schooling.
text: Thola ukuthi ungaxhumana kanjani nothisha ka @fields.child_nickname noma nesikole ukuze uhlale unolwazi, ubuza imibuzo nokuthola okunye ukwelulekwa.  Uma kunzima noma wazi umuntu okunzima kuye ngomsebenzi wesikole noma ekhaya, sicela ukhulume nothisha osondelene naye. Amaqoqo abazali noma omphakathi angaba yindawo enhle yokwesekana ngokufundisa kwenu izingane emakhaya.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Find out how to stay in touch with your children’s teacher or school to stay informed, ask questions and get more guidance. If you are struggling or know someone who is struggling with school work or the home situation, please discuss this with a teacher that you feel close to. Parent groups or community groups can also be a good way to support each other with your home schooling.
text: Thola ukuthi ungaxhumana kanjani nothisha bezingane zakho noma isikole ukuze uhlale unolwazi, ubuze imibuzo futhi uthole nokunye ukwelulekwa.  Uma kunzima noma wazi umuntu okunzima kuye ngomsebenzi wesikole noma ekhaya, sicela ukhulume nothisha osondelene naye. Amaqoqo abazali noma omphakathi angaba yindawo enhle yokwesekana ngokufundisa kwenu izingane emakhaya.

SourceText: Well done for adding another skill to your Parenting Toolkit! Over the next few days, try creating a learning plan with your child that includes both fun and focused educational activities. Helping your child continue learning during this difficult time is so important. Your best efforts will make a difference!
text: Siyakubongela ngokwengeza elinye ikhono emgodleni wakho wokuba ngumzali! Ezinsukwini ezimbalwa ezizayo, zama ukuqala uhlelo lokufunda nengane yakho olubandakanya izinto ezimnandi futhi ezigxile ekufundeni. Ukusiza ingane yakho iqhubeke nokufunda ngalesi sikhathi esinzima kubalulekile kakhulu. Ukuzama kwakho kuzowuletha umehluko!

SourceText: Well done for adding another layer to your House of Support! Over the next few days, try creating a learning plan with your child that includes both fun and focused educational activities. Helping your child continue learning during this difficult time is so important. Your best efforts will make a difference!
text: Siyabonga ngokwengeza okunye okusha emgodleni wakho wokweseka ingane ekhaya! Ezinsukwini ezimbalwa ezizayo, zama ukuqala uhlelo lokufunda nengane yakho olubandakanya izinto ezimnandi futhi ezigxile ekufundeni. Ukusiza ingane yakho iqhubeke nokufunda ngalesi sikhathi esinzima kubalulekile kakhulu. Ukuzama kwakho kuzowuletha umehluko!

SourceText: We understand that these times can be really difficult. Please type "Help" if you want any extra support or guidance. Chat to you later @fields.user_name!
text: Siyazi ukuthi lezi zikhathi zingaba nzima kakhulu. Siyacela ubhale “Usizo” uma ufuna ukuthola okunye ukwesekwa noma ukwelulekwa. Siyobuye sikhulume @fields.user_name!
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: We understand that these times can be really difficult. Please type "Help" if you want any extra support or guidance. Chat to you later!
text: Siyazi ukuthi lezi zikhathi zingaba nzima kakhulu. Siyacela ubhale “Usizo” uma ufuna ukuthola okunye ukwesekwa noma ukwelulekwa. Sobuye sikhulume!

SourceText: Rain on the Mountain
text: Imvula ezintabeni

SourceText: Call out, “There’s rain on the mountain”.
text: Memeza, “Kunemvula ezintabeni”.

SourceText: Everyone else replies “Run, run, run” while running around the space.
text: Bonke abanye baphendula bathi “Baleka, baleka, baleka” ngesikhathi bebaleka endaweni enikuyona.

SourceText: Call out different instructions. For example, touch something red or hop like a frog.
text: Yisho imiyalelo ehlukahlukene. Isibonelo, thinta into ebomvu noma ugxumise okwexoxo.

SourceText: Keep playing and change the instructions each time.
text: Qhubeka udlale bese ushintsha umyalelo isikhathi ngasinye.

SourceText: You can use this as a fun way to learn colours or even tidy up!
text: Ungasebenzisa lokhu njengendlela emnandi yokufunda imibala noma yokuhlanza!

SourceText: Run Around and Do This
text: Gijima bese Wenza Lokhu

SourceText: Everyone runs around the room or garden.  Make sure the space is large enough and safe.
text: Wonke umuntu uyagijima endlini noma engadini.  Qinisekisa ukuthi indawo inkulu ngokwanele futhi iphephile.

SourceText: At any time, someone can stop somewhere and say, “When you get over here, you do this!”
text: Noma nini, omunye angama noma kuphi bese ethi, “Uma ufika la wenza ukuthi!”

SourceText: What you do can be anything: push-ups, singing a song, crying, jumping…
text: Ungenza noma yini: amaphushaphu, ukucula iculo, ukukhala, ukugxuma…

SourceText: The more you play, the more there are things to do in more and more places.
text: Uma uqhubeka nokudlala, ziyanda izinto ongazenza kanye nezindawo.

SourceText: Each person can decide where to go and when.
text: Umuntu ngamunye anganquma ukuthi uzoya kuphi futhi nini.

SourceText: It’s fun to interact with other people who are doing the same thing as you!
text: Kumnandi ukuxhumana nabanye abantu abenza into efana neyakho!

SourceText: Say to your child “I see a tree, let’s be it!”
text: Yithi enganeni yakho “Ngibona isihlahla, asibeni yisona!”

SourceText: Ship to Shore
text: Ukugwedlela Osebeni

SourceText: A fun active game where children learn different parts of a boat. Everyone must go to the place or activity that you call out.
text: Kunemidlalo emnandi lapho izingane zingakwazi khona ukufunda ngezingxenye ezahlukene zesikebhe. Wonke umuntu kumele aye endaweni noma enze umsebenzi owushoyo.

SourceText: “Bow” means run to the front of the boat (room).
text: “Gwedla” kusho ukuthi gijima uye phambi kwesikebhe (endlini)

SourceText: “Stern” means run to the back of the boat.
text: “Shayela” kusho ukuthi gijima uye emuva esikebheni.

SourceText: “Starboard” means run to the right side and “Port” means run to the left side.
text: “Tshekisa” kusho ukuthi gijima uye kwesokudla kanti ukuthi “Paka” kusho ukuthi gijima uye kwesobunxele.

SourceText: “Climb the rigging”: pretend to climb.
text: “Gibela entanjeni” kusho ukulingisa ukugibela.

SourceText: “Clean the deck”: pretend to clean the floor.
text: “Hlanza igumbi” kusho ukulingisa ukuhlanza iphansi.

SourceText: “Lifeboat, [number] people!”: hold hands in a circle with that many people and do knee bends.
text: “Isikebhe sokuhlenga, abantu [abayisibalo]: bambanani ngezandla nenze isikokela nibe baningi bese nilokhu nigobisa amadolo.

SourceText: Everyone not in a lifeboat must swim!
text: Wonke umuntu ongekho esikebheni sokuhlela kumele abhukude!

SourceText: Stage Directions
text: Ukulawula isiteji

SourceText: This is the same as Ship to Shore but with Stage Directions. This can be done in an elevated and safe area. The director gives the instructions.
text: Lokhu kuyefana nokuGwedlela Osebeni kodwa kuhambisana nokulawula isiteji. Lokhu kungenzelwa endaweni ethe ukuphakama futhi ephephile. Umqondisi kumele akhiphe imiyalelo.

SourceText: “Stage Right” means you go to the right.
text: “Esokudla sesiteji” kusho ukuthi uya kwesokudla.

SourceText: “Stage Left” means you go to the left.
text: “Esobunxele sesiteji” kusho ukuthi uya kwesobunxele.

SourceText: “Downstage” means you go down.
text: “Ukwehla esiteji” kusho ukuthi kumele wehle.

SourceText: “Upstage” means you go up.
text: “Ukugibela esiteji” kusho ukuthi kumele ugibele.

SourceText: “Centre Stage” means you go to the centre of the stage.”
text: “Phakathi nesiteji” kusho ukuthi uya phakathi nesiteji.”

SourceText: You can have fun actions like “Dramatic Death, Take a Bow, Open the Curtain, Clean the Floor,” etc.
text: Ungasho imiyalelo emnandi efana nokuthi “Ukuzifisa, Khothama, Vula ikhethini, Hlanza iphansi,” njll.

SourceText: Instead of “Lifeboat” you make “Cast of Actors.” Those not in the cast become the director!
text: Esikhundleni “sesikebhe sokuhlenga” wenza “Uhlu Lwabalingisi.” Labo abangekho ohlwini lwabalingisi baba ngabaqondisi!

SourceText: Superpowers
text: Amandla angaphezu kwavamile

SourceText: Think of a superpower. For example, going anywhere instantly, travelling in time, reading minds.
text: Cabanga ngokuba namandla angaphezu kwavamile. Isibonelo, ukusuka uye kwenye indawo ngokushesha, ukuya esikhathini esizayo/esedlule, ukufunda imiqondo yabantu.”

SourceText: Ask your child “If you had the superpower to […] how would you use it?
text: Buza ingane yakho “Ukuthi inawo yini amandla angandile oku […] nokuthi ingawasebenzisa kanjani?

SourceText: Encourage them to give themselves a superhero name and act it out.
text: Bakhuthaze ukuba baziqambe amagama okuba ngamaqhawe bese beyakulingisa lokho.

SourceText: Now let them choose a super power for you!
text: Manje bacele ukuba nawe basho amandla angandile onawo.

SourceText: Make sure you act it out too!
text: Nawe futhi kumele ulingise ukuba nalawo mandla.

SourceText: Transform the object
text: Shintsha izinto

SourceText: Everyday household items like brooms, mops, or scarfs can become fun props for games
text: Izinto ezisetshenziswa nsuku zonke ekhaya ezinjengemishanelo, amamophu, noma izikhafu kungaba yizinto zokuzijabulisa zemidlalo.

SourceText: Place an object in the center of the room and whenever someone has an idea, they jump in and show the rest what the object can be
text: Beka into phakathi negumbi nomshanelo futhi uma kukhona onombono, agxumele phakathi ese ebonisa wonke umuntu ukuthi leyonto kungaba yini.

SourceText: For example, a broom might be ridden as a horse or a microphone or a guitar!
text: Izibonelo, umshanelo ungagitshelwa njengehhashi noma umbhobho wokucula noma isiginci.

SourceText: What Are You Doing?
text: Wenzani?

SourceText: This game is best when more than 2 people play
text: Lo mdlalo umnandi uma udlalwa ngabantu abangaphezu kwababili.

SourceText: One person pretends to be doing something – for example, combing hair or making dinner
text: Umuntu oyedwa ushaya sengathi wenza okuthile – isibonelo, ukukama izinwele noma ukwenza ukudla

SourceText: Another person asks, “What are you doing?”
text: Omunye umuntu uyabuza, “Wenzani?”

SourceText: The first person needs to say something that has nothing to do with combing hair, for example, “Tying my shoes.”
text: Umuntu wokuqala kumele asho okuthile okungekhona ukukama izinwele, isibonelo nje, “Ngifaza izicathulo.”

SourceText: The second person then starts pretending to tie their shoes until a new person asks, “What are you doing?”
text: Umuntu wesibili ube eselingisa ukufasa izicathulo zakhe kuze kube khona obuzayo ukuthi, “Wenzani?”

SourceText: The answer must always be something different than what you are actually doing!
text: Impendulo kumele ihluke njalo kulokho osuke ukwenza ngempela!

SourceText: Worms Go Home
text: Imisundu Iyagoduka

SourceText: Lie on your tummies and pretend your index fingers are a wiggly worm.
text: Lalani ngezisu bese nilingisa imisundu ngeminwe yenu yokukhomba.

SourceText: With your other hand make a worm house by making a circle with your fingers and thumb and place it on the floor.
text: Ngesinye isandla yenza indlu yomsundu ngokwenza indilinga ngeminwe yakho nesithupha bese usibeka phansi.

SourceText: Call out an instruction for your finger to touch, like “Worms on noses” or “Worms on ears”
text: Yisho umyalelo emunweni wakho okumele ikuthinte, njengokuthi “Umsundu ekhaleni” noma” Umsundu endlebeni”

SourceText: When you call out “Worms go home”, your wiggly worm has to find a worm house as quickly as possible.
text: Uma usuthi “Imisundu iyagoduka”, umsundu wakho ofequzayo kumele uthole indlu yawo ngokushesha.

SourceText: The last worm to find a home calls out the instructions next.
text: Umsundu wokugcina ukufika ekhaya yiwona ozobe ususho imiyalelo ngokulandelayo.

SourceText: Keep playing until you feel rejuvenated from lying down.
text: Qhubeka udlale kuze kube usukhathele ukulala phansi.

SourceText: Blind Dragon
text: Inkanyamba Engaboni

SourceText: This game is great if you have at least 4 people
text: Lo mdlalo omnandi uma udlalwa ngabantu okungenani abane

SourceText: Tell the story about a ferocious dragon who lived near a village. He would sneak into the village at night and steal people’s treasures – anything they loved.  Anybody who tried to take their treasure back would be eaten alive.  This continued for many years until the dragon became old, fat, and blind from sitting on his treasure and gazing at the glare of the gold coins. Then the townspeople could try and sneak into his lair and steal back their relatives’ treasure.
text: Xoxa indaba ngenkanyamba esabekayo ehlala eduze nemizi yabantu. Yayikwazi ukuya emzini yabantu ebusuku iyontshontsha umcebo wabo – nanoma yini abayithandayo.  Noma ngubani ozama ukulanda umcebo wakhe yayimudla ephila.  Lokhu kwaqhubeka iminyaka eminingi kwaze kwaba inkanyamba iyaguga, iyakhuluphala futhi ingasaboni emehlweni ngenxa yokuphila ngomcebo futhi ilokhu ixhoshwa ukubenyezela kwegolide. Ngemuva kwalokho abantu esigodini babezama ukungena emgedeni wayo beyontshontsha umcebo wabo nowezihlobo zabo.

SourceText: One person plays the dragon. Dragon sits blindfolded or with eyes closed surrounded by a pile of treasure.
text: Umuntu oyedwa uba yinkanyamba. Inkanyamba iyahlala ivalwe amehlo izungezwe yizingqumbe zomcebo.

SourceText: Everyone has one piece of treasure that they must steal back.
text: Wonke umuntu kumele ayontshontsha okukodwa komcebo abuye nakho.

SourceText: If the dragon hears you and points at you, you must go back to the starting place.
text: Uma inkanyamba ikuzwa bese iyakukhomba kumele ubuyele emuva uyoqala phansi.

SourceText: Only one person can try to get the treasure at a time.
text: Ngumuntu oyedwa kuphela ngesikhathi okumele azame ukuyolanda umcebo

SourceText: Dancing with Angels
text: Ukudansa Nezingelosi

SourceText: This activity helps children learn how to lead. It also builds trust between you and your child.
text: Lo mdlalo usiza izingane ukuba zikwazi ukufunda ukuhola phambili. Uphinde wakhe ukwethembana phakathi kwakho nengane yakho.

SourceText: Play a piece of music that is gentle and relaxed to encourage smooth and calming movement.
text: Dlala umucwi womculo opholile ukwenzela ukuthi kunyakazwe kancane kungajahwa.

SourceText: One person goes first and closes their eyes while the other person is the guardian angel or protector.
text: Kuqala umuntu oyedwa avale amehlo akhe bese omunye abe yingelosi ezomgada noma imvikele.

SourceText: The guardian angel must protect the person with their eyes closed from harm while gently dancing together.
text: Ingelosi egadile kumele ivikele umuntu amehlo akhe evaliwe ukuba angathinteki ngesikhathi bedansa ndawonye kanye kanye.

SourceText: When the music ends, the dancer can open their eyes before switching roles.
text: Uma kuphela umculo, umdansi uyawavula emhlo akhe ngaphambi kokushintsha izindawo.

SourceText: Drawing
text: Ukudweba

SourceText: Children love to draw! It helps build creativity.
text: Izingane ziyakuthanda ukudweba! Kusiza ukwakha ikhono lobuciko.

SourceText: Get some pens or crayons and a piece of paper or cardboard.
text: Thola amapheni noma amakhrayoni nephepha noma ikhalibhothi.

SourceText: Let your children freely draw whatever they want.
text: Yekela izingane zakho zidwebe ngokukhululeka noma ngabe yini.

SourceText: While your child is drawing, use words to describe what they are doing: “I see you are drawing a person” or “I see you are making lines with the red crayon.”
text: Uma ingane yakho idweba, sebenzisa amagama ukuchaza ukuthi yenzani: “Ngiyabona udweba umuntu” noma “Ngiyabona uweba imigqa ngekhrayoni elibomvu”.

SourceText: You can also have fun drawing next to them.
text: Nawe futhi ungenza kube mnandi ngokudweba eduze kwabo.

SourceText: Put their drawings up on the wall, refrigerator, or outside to decorate the house – it will make your children feel appreciated!
text: Nameka imidwebo yabo odongeni, efrijini, noma ngaphandle ukuhlobisa indlu – lokho kuzokwenza ingane yakho ibone ukuthi iyanconywa!

SourceText: Listening to Sounds
text: Ukulalela Imisindo

SourceText: Sit down and close your eyes
text: Hlala phansi bese uvala amehlo akho.

SourceText: How many sounds can you hear? Listen to the sounds inside and outside the room. Count them on your fingers
text: Mingaki imisindo okwazi ukuyizwa? Lalela imisindo engaphakathi nengaphandle kwegumbi. Yibale ngeminywe yakho.

SourceText: After ten seconds, how many fingers do you have up? What sounds did you hear?
text: Ngemva kwemizuzwana eyishumi, mingaki iminwe ephakeme? Yimiphi imisindo oyizwile?

SourceText: Try again for another ten seconds.
text: Phinde uzame futhi eminye imizuzwana eyishumi.

SourceText: Can you hear any new sounds? Can you hear any sounds inside your own body?
text: Ingabe ikhona eminye imisindo emisha oyizwile? Ingabe ikhona imisindo oyizwayo emzimbeni wakho?

SourceText: Notice how you feel and ask your child how they are feeling.
text: Qaphela ukuthi uzizwa kanjani bese ubuza ingane yakho ukuthi yona izizwa kanjani.

SourceText: Memory game – “When COVID-19 ends…”
text: Umdlalo wokukhumbula – “Uma kuphela iCOVID-19…”

SourceText: First person says, “When COVID-19 ends, I am going to… (e.g., go to the park)”
text: Umuntu wokuqala uthi, “Uma i-COVID-19 iphela, ngizo..." (isib, ngizoya epaki).

SourceText: Second person adds to the first person’s plan, “When COVID-19 ends, I am going to the park and… (e.g., visit my best friend)”
text: Umuntu wesibili uzokwengeza kowokuqala, "Uma i-COVID-19 iphela, ngizoya epaki futhi...(isib., ngivakashele umngane wami omkhulu)".

SourceText: Each person adds to the previous list of plans, trying to think of all of the fun things to do when COVID-19 ends.
text: Umuntu ngamunye wengeza kokudlule ezama ukucabanga ngezinto ezijabulisayo angazenza uma kuphela i-COVID-19.

SourceText: Self-portrait
text: Ukuzidweba

SourceText: Here’s how your children can draw a picture of themselves!
text: Lalela ukuthi ingane yakho ingasidweba kanjani isithombe sayo!

SourceText: Find a big piece of paper or cardboard. It needs to be the same length or slightly longer than the height of your child
text: Thola isiqephu esikhulu sephepha noma sekhalibhothi. Kumele libe ngangengane yakho noma libe ngaphezudlwana ukuphakama.

SourceText: Ask your child to lie down on the paper. Carefully draw the outline of your child.
text: Cela ingane yakho ilale phansi ephepheni. Dweba ngokucophelela umugqa osungeza umzimba wengane.

SourceText: Now let your child fill in the outline: face, hair, clothes, shoes, or anything they want!
text: Emuva kwalokho yeka ingane igcwalise izinto ezisemzimbeni: ubuso, izinwele, izingubo, izicathulo, nanoma yini abayithandayo!

SourceText: Ask your child to draw things that they like and do not like outside of the outline
text: Cela ingane yakho ukudweba izinto ezizithandayo nezingazithandi eceleni kodwebo.

SourceText: Have a conversation with your child about these things. You may learn something about your child!
text: Khuluma nengane yakho ngalezi zinto. Ungafunda okuthile ngengane yakho!

SourceText: You can put their outline up in their room or anywhere in the house – it will make your children feel appreciated!
text: Ungabeka isithombe sabo egumbini labo nanoma yikuphi endlini – kuzokwenza bazizwe bejabulelwa!

SourceText: Story time
text: Isikhathi senganekwane

SourceText: Start the story with “Once upon a time there was a…”
text: Qala indaba ngokuthi “Kwasukasukela, kwakukhona…”

SourceText: Let your child make up the next sentence
text: Yeka ingane yakho iqhubeke nomusho

SourceText: Then you make up a sentence
text: Bese nawe usho umusho wakho

SourceText: Take turns until you have a wonderful new story
text: Shintshanani kuze kube nakha indaba emnandi entsha.

SourceText: Make sure to end the story on a positive note.
text: Qinisekisa ukuthi inganekwane yenu iba nesiphetho esihle.

SourceText: Ask your child what was their favourite part of the story!
text: Buza ingane yakho ukuthi iyiphi ingxenye eyithandile enganekwaneni!

SourceText: The Interrupter
text: Umphazamisi

SourceText: Choose a storyteller to start making up a story.
text: Khetha umxoxi wendaba ozoqala asungule indaba.

SourceText: Story listeners can interrupt with a word at any time.
text: Abalalele indaba bangaphazamisa ngegama noma yinini.

SourceText: The storyteller needs to fit that word in their story.
text: Umxoxi wendaba kumele alifake lelo gama endabeni.

SourceText: Try with a different storyteller!
text: Zamani umxoxi wendaba ohlukene!

SourceText: Three options
text: Khetha kwezintathu

SourceText: Think of three different situations. For example, driving a car, sailing a boat or flying a plane
text: Cabanga ngezimo ezintathu ezihlukahlukene. Isibonelo, ukushayela imoto, ukutshuza ngesikebhe noma ukundiza ngebhanoyi

SourceText: Say them to your child and ask, “Which would you prefer?”
text: Tshela ingane yakho ngazo bese uyibuza ukuthi “Ikhetha yiphi?”

SourceText: Ask them why?
text: babuze ukuthi kungani?

SourceText: Now think of three more situations or ask your child to do it for you
text: Manje cabanga futhi ngezinye izimo ezintathu noma ucele ingane yakho ukuba ikwenzele

SourceText: When I Was Younger
text: Ngesikhathi ngisemncane

SourceText: Children love to hear stories about your own life!
text: Izingane ziyathanda ukuzwa izindaba ngempilo yakho!

SourceText: Think of a time when you were younger when something BIG happened to you
text: Cabanga isikhathi lapho wawusemncane wehlakalelwa yinto enkulu

SourceText: It can be an adventure, happy memory, or challenge that you experienced
text: Kungaba wuhambo, izikhathi ezimnandi noma inselelo owabhekana nayo

SourceText: Share it with your child and notice how they listen!
text: Xoxela ingane yakho bese uyaqaphela ukuthi ilalela kanjani

SourceText: Co-chef
text: Umsizi wompheki

SourceText: Ask your teen what kind of meal they would like to eat.
text: Buza ingane yakho esikhulile ukuthi kudla kuni ezothanda ukukudla.

SourceText: Prepare it together! The first time, you may need to guide them.
text: Yenzani ukudla ikanye kanye! Uma nikwenza okokuqala, kungadingeka ukuthi umkhalime.

SourceText: Once your teen knows how to prepare the meal, let them take the lead and follow their instructions.
text: Uma ingane yakho esikhulile isikwazi ukwenza ukudla, iyeke yenze yona bese ulandela imiyalelo yayo.

SourceText: Let each child and teen in the house have a turn at being the head chef.
text: Izingane zakho encane nendala ziyeke zishintshane ukuba ngabapheki.

SourceText: You can even help them make a budget for ingredients!
text: Ungabasiza futhi ekutheni bahlele imali yokuthenga izinongo!

SourceText: Shake your left hands in the air 8 times while counting to 8.
text: Nyakazisa isandla sakho sokunxele izikhathi ezingu-8 emoyeni ngesikhathi ubala kawu-8

SourceText: Do it as fast and loud as you can.
text: Kwenze ngokushesha futhi kuzwakale kakhulu.

SourceText: Repeat with your other hand. Then do it for each foot.
text: Yenza futhi nangesinye isandla  Phinda futhi ukwenze ngonyawo ngalunye.

SourceText: Everyone calls out “Crazy chicken” when you’re finished and does their best crazy chicken dance!
text: Wonke umuntu umemeza athi “Inkukhu ehlanyayo” uma usuqedile bese benza umdanso wenkukhu obhedayo!

SourceText: Create a dance choreography to your teen's favorite songs.
text: Yenza indlela yokudansela ingoma ethandwa kakhulu yingane yakho endala.

SourceText: Get active!
text: Yiba matasa!

SourceText: Come up with three types of exercise together. For example, walking, jogging, soccer or dancing
text: Khethani ndawonye izinhlobo ezintathu zokuzivocavoca. Isibonelo, ukuhamba, ukugijima kancane, ibhola noma umdanso

SourceText: Pick one together and try it out.
text: Khethani okukodwa bese nikuzama.

SourceText: If you both like it, decide how often you are going to do it. Once or twice a week? Every morning?
text: Uma nobabili nikuthanda, nqumani ukuthi nizokwenza kangaki. Kanye noma kabili ngesonto? Njalo ekuseni?

SourceText: Together think of ways to make it even more fun. Can you jog to a certain point? Take turns in being the coach? Motivate each other with a small free reward?
text: Ndawonye cabangani ngezindlela zokuyenza ibe mnandi nakakhulu. Ungakwazi yini ukugijima uye endaweni ethile? Shintshanani ekubeni abaqeqeshi? Khuthazanani ngomklomelo omncane wamahhala?

SourceText: When we are able to have peaceful and loving relationships, our children feel more secure and loved. Today's tip is about how we can support positive family relationships at home.
text: Uma siveza ubudlelwano obunokuthula nobunothando, izingane zethu zizizwa zivikelekile futhi zithandwa kakhudlwana. Ithiphu yanamuhla ithi singabeseka kanjani ubudlelwane obuhle emndenini.

SourceText: Everyone else must guess the name of the tune (to make it harder, they can guess the singer).
text: Wonke umuntu kumele aqagele igama lengoma (ukuze kube nzima, bangaqagela umculi).

SourceText: The first one to guess it right becomes the next leader who will choose or sing the next song.
text: Owokuqala ozoqagela kahle kuba nguyena olandelayo ukuhola futhi ozokhetha noma acule iculo elilandelayo.

SourceText: Pass the Snap
text: Dlulisa i-Snap

SourceText: This game is best with at least 3 people.
text: Lo mdlalo udlaleka kangcono uma kunabantu okungenani abawu-3.

SourceText: Start in a circle and pass one snap around the circle (or clap if you cannot snap).
text: Qalani isikokela bese niphaqaza iminwe kuzungeze isikokela (ushaye ihlombe uma ungakwazi ukuphaqaza iminwe).

SourceText: You snap once to throw the snap.
text: Uphaqaza iminwe kube kanye kudlulele kolandelayo.

SourceText: You can bounce the snap, throw it in the air, and catch it a few times before passing it.
text: Ungaphaqaza iminwe, sakuphosa phezulu emoyeni, bese wenza sakukukunqaka izikhathi ezimbalwa ngaphambi kokudlulisela kolandelayo.

SourceText: The direction (up, down, straight, curved, rolling the ground) and force (hard, soft, medium) that you throw the snap should affect how the person catches it.
text: Izinhlangothi (iphezulu, phansi, uqonde, ugwegwise, noma kube sakuginqa phansi) kanti amandla (ungaqinisa isandla, ungenza kancane, noma phakathi nendawo) ukwenza ukuthi olandelayo akwemukele ngendlela okudlulise ngayo.

SourceText: Look at the person you are throwing the snap to.
text: Mbheke umuntu ophaqaza iminwe udlulisela kuyena.

SourceText: The person who will catch it has to snap once to catch it.
text: Umuntu owemukela ukuphaqazwa kweminwe kumele naye ayiphaqaze kanye ukwemukela.

SourceText: When everyone gets good at this, you can start moving around the room, still passing around the snap.
text: Uma wonke umuntu esewubambile lo mdlalo, ningaqala ninyakaze nizungeze endlini, nisakhubeka nokuphaqaza iminwe nidluliselana.

SourceText: Can you throw under the leg?  Behind the back?  Through your head?  Intercept a pass? Have fun with the snap!
text: Ungaphosa ngaphansi komlenze?  Ngemuva komhlane?  Kujikeleze ikhanda?  Uvimbe okuya komunye umuntu? Kujabuleleni ukudlala nge-”snap”!

SourceText: This game is best when more than 2 people play.
text: Lo mdlalo umnandi uma udlalwa ngabantu abangaphezu kuka-2.

SourceText: One person pretends to be doing something – for example, combing hair.
text: Umuntu oyedwa ulingisa ukwenza okuthile – isibonelo, ukukama izinwele.

SourceText: A second person asks, “What are you doing?”
text: Umuntu wesibili uyabuza, “Wenzani?”

SourceText: The second person’s answer must always be something different from what they are actually doing!
text: Impendulo yomuntu wesibili kumele njalo kube yinto ehlukile kulokho akwenzayo!

SourceText: The next person should act out the second person’s answer and when someone asks what they are doing, their answer must be different from what they are actually doing!
text: Umuntu olandelayo kumele enze okwehlukile empendulweni yomuntu wesibili futhi uma esebuzwa ukuthi wenzani, kumele asho into ehlukile kuleyo ayenzayo!

SourceText: What’s new?
text: Yini entsha?

SourceText: Think of a new skill you could learn together with your teen. For example, keeping a ball in the air or your foot, juggling, learning a new language, or playing an instrument?
text: Cabanga ngekhono elisha eningalifunda ndawonye nengane yakho eyevile eminyakeni eyishumi nambili. Isibonelo, ukubamba ibhola emoyeni noma unyawo lwakho, ukugxumagxuma, ukufunda ulimi olusha, noma ukudlala insimbi yomculo?

SourceText: Take turns in trying the new skill out.
text: Shintshanani ukuzama ikhono elisha.

SourceText: Make sure to praise each other, and try to learn and play together!
text: Qinisekisani ukuthi niyancomana, nizame ukufunda nokudlala ndawonye!

SourceText: It might help to think of wishes, dreams, experiences at school, likes or dislikes. For example, I hate bananas, my favourite subject is science, and I really wish I could sing.
text: Kungasiza ukucabanga izifiso, amaphupho, enikubona esikoleni, enikuthandayo neningakuthandi. Isibonelo, ngiyawuzonda ubhanana, isifundo engisithandayo yisayensi, ngiyafisa ukube ngingakwazi ukucula.

SourceText: Say them to your teenager. Ask them to guess which one is a lie.
text: Yishoni kanyekanye nengane yakho esikhulile. Bacele baqagele ukuthi yikuphi okungamanga.

SourceText: Now ask them to do the same. Did you learn something new about each other?
text: Nawe bacele ukuba benze okufanayo. Ingabe kukhona okusha enikufundile ngomunye nomunye?

SourceText: Talk to your teen about one positive or fun thing they did.
text: Khuluma nengane yakho endala ngento eyodwa enhle noma emnandi eyenzile.

SourceText: Dream Travel
text: Iphupho Lohambo

SourceText: You can’t travel but you can dream! Ask your teen these questions.
text: Awukwazi ukuthatha uhambo kodwa ungaba nephupho! Buza ingane yakho esikhulile le mibuzo.

SourceText: Where do you want to travel? How long will you be away? What will you pack? What will you do? What will you see?
text: Ufuna ukuvakashela kuphi? Uzohamba isikhathi esingakanani? Uzopakisha ini? Uzokwenzani? Uzobonani?

SourceText: Look at a map together if you have one.
text: Bhekani imephu ndawonye uma ninayo.

SourceText: Choose a country that they’ve never heard of and look it up together online.
text: Khetha izwe abangakaze baliswe bese liyalibheka kwi-inthanethi.

SourceText: How was your day?
text: Belunjani usuku lwakho?

SourceText: Ask each other, “What made you happy today?”
text: Buzanani, “Yini ekujabulisile namuhla?”

SourceText: Ask each other, “What was difficult today?”
text: Buzanani, “Yini ebe nzima namuhla?”

SourceText: Ask each other, “How can we help you?”
text: Buzanani, “Singakusiza kanjani?”

SourceText: Try to do this together every day, when you are eating together or before bed
text: Zamani ukukwenza ndawonye lokhu nsuku zonke, uma nidla ndawonye noma ngaphambi kokulala.

SourceText: Just a friendly chat
text: Izingxoxo zobungane

SourceText: Have a conversation with your teen about something they like.
text: Xoxa nengane yakho eyevile eminyakeni eyishumi nambili ngokuthile ekuthandayo.

SourceText: It can be about anything they choose to talk about: sports, friends, music, celebrities…
text: Kungaba yinoma yini abakhetha ukukhuluma ngayo: ezemidlalo, abangani, umculo, osaziwayo…

SourceText: Try to listen to your teen and give them space to talk.
text: Zama ukukhuluma nengane yakho ekhulile ubanike ithuba lokukhuluma.

SourceText: What new thing did you learn about your teen from your chat?
text: Yini entsha oyifundile ngengane yakho endala enkulumweni yenu?

SourceText: Make up a story!
text: Qamba indatshana

SourceText: Let your teen make up the next sentence.
text: Yekela ingane yakho yakhe imisho.

SourceText: Then you make up a sentence.
text: Nawe yakha umusho.

SourceText: Take turns until you have a wonderful new story.
text: Shintshanani ukwakha indatshana emnandi entsha.

SourceText: Ask your teen what was their favourite part of the story!
text: Buza ingane yakho ukuthi iyiphi ingxenye abayithandile endatshaneni!

SourceText: Ask your teen “If you had the superpower to […] how would you use it?”
text: Buza ingane yakho ukuthi “Ukube ubunamandla angandile oku […] ubungawasebenzisa kanjani?”

SourceText: Encourage them to give themselves a superhero name and act like a superhero.
text: Bakhuthaze ukuba baziqambele amagama likasomandla noma benzise okukasomandla.

SourceText: Now let them choose a super power for you.
text: Manje bayeke bakukhethele nawe amandla angandile akho.

SourceText: Make sure you act it out too!
text: Nawe futhi kumele ulingise ukuba nalawo mandla.

SourceText: Think of three different situations. For example, driving a car, sailing a boat, or flying a plane.
text: Cabanga ngezimo ezintathu ezihlukahlukene. Isibonelo, ukushayela imoto, ukutshuza ngesikebhe, noma ukushayela ibhanoyi.

SourceText: Say them to your teen and ask, “Which would you prefer?”
text: Tshela lokhu ingane yakho bese uyayibuza ukuthi “Yikuphi wena okukhethayo?”

SourceText: Now think of three more situations or ask your teen to do it for you.
text: Cabanga manje ezinye izimo ezintathu noma ucele ingane yakho ikucabangele.

SourceText: Second person adds to first person’s plan, “When COVID-19 ends, I am going to the park and… (e.g., visit my best friend)”
text: Umuntu wesibili uzokwengeza kowokuqala, "Uma i-COVID-19 iphela, ngizoya epaki futhi...(isib., ngivakashele umngane wami omkhulu)".

SourceText: Yes, No or Maybe
text: Yebo, Cha noma Mhlawumbe

SourceText: Ask each other questions. They can be any questions about things you like or what you did today.
text: Buzanani imibuzo. Kungaba yinoma imiphi imibuzo ngezinto ozithandayo noma ozenzile namuhla.

SourceText: The only rule is that you can’t answer Yes, No or Maybe
text: Umthetho owodwa okhona owokuthi angeke uphendule ngo Yebo, Cha noma Mhlawumbe

SourceText: How long can you last? How creative can you get with your answers?
text: Ungakwenza isikhathi esingakanani lokhu? Ungaqhamuka kanjani nezimpendulo ezinhle?

SourceText: Swap over and play again!
text: Shintshanani bese niphinde niyadlala futhi!

SourceText: There are no bad children...only difficult behaviours! All children misbehave but these tips can help.
text: Azikho izingane ezimbi…kuphela zingaziphatha ngendlela ebucayi! Zonke izingane ziyawenza amaphutha kodwa lawa mathiphu angakusiza.

SourceText: Which child do you want tips for?
text: Lawa mathiphu uwafunela yiphi ingane?

SourceText: Please select the age of your child:
text: Khetha iminyaka yobudala yengane yakho:

SourceText: A. Under 1 month
text: A. Ngaphansi kwenyanga eyodwa

SourceText: B. 1-2 months
text: B. 1-2 wezinyanga

SourceText: C. 3-5 months
text: C. 3-5 wezinyanga

SourceText: D. 6-9 months
text: D. 6-9 wezinyanga

SourceText: E. 10 -14 months
text: E. 10-14 wezinyanga

SourceText: F. 15-18 months
text: F. 15-18 wezinyanga

SourceText: G. 19-23 months
text: G. 19-23 wezinyanga

SourceText: Which behaviour is most like the one you want support for?
text: Yikuphi ukuziphatha okuyikhona okungaba udinga ukusizwa kukhona?

SourceText: Here are 8 simple tips to help you with your teen:
text: Nawa amathiphu awu-8 alula okukusiza ngengane yakho esikhulile:

SourceText: 1. Keep it positive
text: 1. Hlala njalo unethemba

SourceText: 2. Invest in time
text: 2. Chitha nayo isikhathi

SourceText: 3. Create routines
text: 3. Yenza izinqubo enizozilandela

SourceText: 4. Be open to your children
text: 4. Vuleleka enganeni yakho

SourceText: 5. Use reasonable consequences
text: 5. Yijezise ngendlela eyamukelekayo

SourceText: 6. Solve problems with your teen
text: 6. Xazulula izinkinga nengane yakho esikhulile

SourceText: 7. Keeping your teen safe online
text: 7. Ukugcina ingane yakho iphephile kwi-inthanethi

SourceText: 8. Resolving crises when they happen
text: 8. Xazulula izinkinga uma zenzeka

SourceText: Type "1" to "8" if you want to learn more about a specific strategy.
text: Bhala “1” kuya ku “8” uma ufuna ukufunda kabanzi ngamasu athile.

SourceText: Here are 5 simple tips to help you with your babies:
text: Nawa amathiphu ayisihlanu alula okukusiza ngengane yakho encane:

SourceText: 1. Play with your baby
text: 1. Dlala nengane yakho

SourceText: 2. Create routines
text: 2. Yenza izinqubo enizozilandela

SourceText: 3. Share books with your baby
text: 3. Funda izincwadi nengane yakho

SourceText: 4. Cope with crying
text: 4. Bekezelela ukukhala

SourceText: 5. Redirect them to positive behaviours
text: 5. Benze bajwayele ukuziphatha ngendlela eyamukelekile

SourceText: Type "1" to "5" if you want to learn more about a specific strategy.
text: Bhala “1” kuya ku “5” uma ufuna ukufunda kabanzi ngamasu athile.

SourceText: Here are 9 simple tips to help you with your children:
text: Nawa amathiphu awu-9 alula okukusiza ngengane yakho:

SourceText: 6. Ignore attention seeking and demanding behaviours
text: 6. Yizibe uma ifuna ukunakwa noma ifuna izinto ngenkani

SourceText: 7. Use reasonable consequences
text: 7. Yijezise ngendlela eyamukelekayo

SourceText: 8. Solving problems with your child
text: 8. Xazulula izinkinga nengane yakho

SourceText: 9. Keeping your child safe online
text: 9. Phephisa ingane yakho kwi-inthanethi

SourceText: Type "1" to "9" if you want to learn more about a specific strategy.
text: Bhala “1” kuya ku “9” uma ufuna ukufunda kabanzi ngamasu athile.

SourceText: Remember that you’re in charge of what they eat, but not how much. Newborns have stomach the size of a grape! They need to eat often (sometimes in the middle of the night.
text: Khumbula ukuthi nguwena olawula ukuthi badlani, kodwa hhayi ukuthi kangakanani. Izingane ezisanda kuzalwa ziba nesisu esingangegrebhisi! Zidinga ukudla njalo (kwesinye isikhathi nasezinzulwini zobusuku).

SourceText: It’s important to build trust around eating, especially as your baby starts on solid food. Let them know you are listening to their wishes in the eating department. They’ll be ravenous again soon!
text: Kubalulekile ukwakha ukwethembana uma kuziwa ekudleni, ikakhulukazi uma ingane yakho iqala ukudla okuqinile. Benze baqonde ukuthi uyazilalela izifiso zabo uma kuziwa ekudleni. Bazophinde babe nolaka futhi ngokushesha!

SourceText: Would you like suggestions for active and calm things to do with @fields.child_nickname?
text: Ungafisa ukuthola imibono ngezinto ongazenza noma zokwehlisa ulaka ku @fields.child_nickname?
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: When your children ask you about COVID-19, be willing to talk. They will already have heard something. Silence and secrets do not protect our children. Honesty and openness do. Think about how much they will understand. You know them best.
text: Uma izingane zakho zokubuza ngeCOVID-19, khombisa intshisekelo yokukhuluma. Vele kuzobe sekukhona ezikwaziyo. Ukuthula nezimfihlo akuzivikeli izingane zethu. Ukuvuleleka nokwethembeka yikhona okuzivikelayo. Cabanga ukuthi kungakanani abazokuqonda. Nguwena obazi kangcono.

SourceText: Here's a video to help you talk about COVID-19 with your children!
text: Nayi i-video ezokusiza ukhulume ngeCOVID-19 nezingane zakho!

SourceText: Here's an audio message to help you talk about COVID-19 with your children!
text: Nawu umyalezo olalelwayo ozokusiza ukhulume ngeCOVID-19 nezingane zakho!

SourceText: That's okay! You can always type "Help" if you want to learn more about how to talk about COVID-19 with your child. Chat to you later!
text: Kulungile! Ngabhala uthi “Usizo” njalo uma ufuna ukufunda kabanzi ngokuthi ukhuluma kanjani ngeCOVID-19 nengane yakho. Sobuye sikhulume!

SourceText: Here are 4 simple steps that you can do when talking about COVID-19 with your children:
text: Nawa amagxathu awu-4 alula angakusiza ukhulume ngeCOVID-19 nezingane zakho:

SourceText: 1. Be open, honest, and supportive
text: 1. Vuleleka, yethembeka futhi uzeseke

SourceText: 2. It is okay not to know the answers
text: 2. Kulungile uma ungenazo izimpendulo

SourceText: 3. Be a hero not a bully
text: 3. Yiba yiqhawe hhayi umhlukumezi

SourceText: 4. End on a good note
text: 4. Yibani nesiphetho esihle

SourceText: Type "1" to "4" to learn more about each tip. Type "N" to stop this tip.
text: Bhala “1” kuya ku “4” uma ufuna ukufunda kabanzi ngamathiphu ngayinye. Bhala u “N” ukumisa le thiphu.

SourceText: Step 3. Be a hero not a bully
text: Isinyathelo 3. Yiba yiqhawe hhayi umhlukumezi

SourceText: Explain that COVID-19 has nothing to do with the way someone looks, where they are from, or what language they speak.
text: Chaza ukuthi iCOVID-19 ayiyi ngokuthi umuntu ubukeka kanjani, usukaphi, noma ukhuluma luphi ulimi.

SourceText: Here is a comic on how to talk to your child about COVID-19.
text: Nayi indlela enamahlaya ongakhuluma ngayo nengane yakho mayelana neCOVID-19.

SourceText: Child: “Am I going to get coronavirus?”
text: Ingane: “Ngabe ngizoyithola nami i-corona?”

SourceText: Parent: “It is very possible that we will all get coronavirus. But younger people do not normally get very sick.”
text: Umzali: “Maningi amathuba okuthi sonke siyogcina sibe nayo i-corona.” “Kodwa abantu abancane imvamisa kabaguli kakhulu.”

SourceText: Child: “I am scared…”
text: Ingane: “Ngiyesaba…”

SourceText: Parent: “It is okay to be afraid. We are all a bit scared about this. But we have each other and can do our best to keep ourselves and other people safe and healthy.”
text: Umzali: “Akunayo inkinga ukwesaba. Sonke sinakho ukwesaba ngale nto. Kodwa-ke siyanakekelana futhi singenza konke okusemandleni ukuzivikela nokuhlale siphilile, thina nabanye abantu.”

SourceText: Child: “How can we keep safe?”
text: Ingane: “Singaziphephisa kanjani?”

SourceText: Parent: “We can wash our hands regularly for 20 seconds. We can also keep a good physical distance away from people. We also need to try to avoid touching our faces as much as possible.”
text: Umzali: “Singageza izandla zethu njalo imizuzwana engu-20. Zingaphinde sishiye igebe elifanele phakathi kwethu nabanye abantu singasondelani. Kumele siphinde sizame ukugwema ukuthinta ubuso bethu ngayo yonke indlela.”

SourceText: Child, “Okay…”
text: Ingane, “Kulungile…”

SourceText: Child: “What happens to your body when you get coronavirus?”
text: Ingane: Kwenzekani emzimbeni wakho uma ungenwa yi-corona?”

SourceText: Parent: “To tell you the truth, I don’t know exactly. How about we look on the UNICEF website together?”
text: Umzali: “Ukukutshela iqiniso, angazi name kahle. Kunganjani sibheke kwi-webhusayithi ye-UNICEF kanyekanye?”

SourceText: WHO: https://www.who.int/emergencies/diseases/novel-coronavirus-2019/advice-for-public
text:
WHO:
 https://www.who.int/emergencies/diseases/novel-coronavirus-2019

SourceText: UNICEF: https://www.unicef.org/coronavirus/covid-19
text: UNICEF: https://www.unicef.org/coronavirus/covid-19

SourceText: Please select another number if you want to learn more about how to talk about COVID-19 with your children:
text: Khetha enye inombolo uma ufuna ukufunda ukukhuluma nezingane zakho ngeCOVID-19:

SourceText: Step 1. Be open, honest, and supportive
text: Isinyathelo 1. Vuleleka, yethembeka futhi uzeseke

SourceText: Allow @fields.child_nickname to talk freely. Ask them open questions and find out how much they already know.
text: Vumela u@fields.child_nickname ukukhuluma ngokukhululeka. Babuze imibuzo evulelekile ukuthola ukuthi bazi kangakanani.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Allow your child to talk freely. Ask them open questions and find out how much they already know.
text: Vumela ingane yakho ikhulume ngokukhululeka. Babuze imibuzo evulelekile ukuthola ukuthi bazi kangakanani.

SourceText: Always answer their questions truthfully. Think about how old @fields.child_nickname is and how much they can understand.
text: Njalo phendula imibuzo ngokuyiqiniso. Cabanga ukuthi u@fields.child_nickname uneminyaka emingaki yobudala nokuthi kungakanani angakuqonda.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: @fields.child_nickname may be scared or confused. Give them space to share how they are feeling and let them know you are there for them.
text: U{1) kungenzeka ethuke noma adideke. Mnikeze ithuba lokusho ukuthi uzizwa kanjani bese uyaqinisekisa ukuthi uzoba khona umbheke.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Always answer their questions truthfully. Think about how old your child is and how much they can understand.
text: Njalo phendula imibuzo ngokuyiqiniso. Cabanga ukuthi ingane yakho ingakanani nokuthi kungakanani engakuqonda.

SourceText: Your child may be scared or confused. Give them space to share how they are feeling and let them know you are there for them.
text: Ingane yakho kungenzeka yethuke noma idideke. Mnikeze ithuba lokusho ukuthi uzizwa kanjani bese uyaqinisekisa ukuthi uzoba khona umbheke.

SourceText: Step 4. End on a good note
text: Isinyathelo 4. Yibani nesiphetho esihle

SourceText: Check to see if @fields.child_nickname is okay. Remind them that you care and that they can talk to you anytime. Then do something fun together!
text: Bheka ukuthi u@fields.child_nickname akanankinga. Bakhumbuze ukuthi unendaba futhi bangakhuluma nawe noma kunini. Emuva kwalokho yenzani into emnandi ndawonye!
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Check to see if your child is okay. Remind them that you care and that they can talk to you anytime. Then do something fun together!
text: Bheka ukuthi ingane yakho ayinankinga yini. Bakhumbuze ukuthi unendaba futhi bangakhuluma nawe noma kunini. Emuva kwalokho yenzani into emnandi ndawonye!

SourceText: Step 2. It is OK not to know the answers.
text: Isinyathelo 2. Kulungile ukungazazi izimpendulo.

SourceText: It is fine to say “We don’t know, but we are working on it; or we don’t know, ‘but we think’.”  Use this as an opportunity to learn something new with @fields.child_nickname. The WHO and UNICEF websites are great first steps to learn.
text: Kulungile ukuthi “Kasazi, kodwa sizakubheka; noma asazi, kodwa sicabanga ukuthi’.”   Lokhu kusebenzise njengethuba lokufunda into entsha no@fields.child_nickname. amawebhusayithi eWHO ne-UNICEF ayizindawo ezinhle zokuqala kuzo ukufunda.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: It is fine to say “We don’t know, but we are working on it; or we don’t know, ‘but we think’.”  Use this as an opportunity to learn something new with your child. The WHO and UNICEF websites are great first steps to learn.
text: Kulungile ukuthi “Kasazi, kodwa sizakubheka; noma asazi, kodwa sicabanga ukuthi’.”   Lokhu kusebenzise njengethuba lokufunda into entsha nengane yakho. Amawebhusayithi eWHO ne-UNICEF ayizindawo ezinhle zokuqala kuzo ukufunda.

SourceText: Tell @fields.child_nickname that we can be compassionate to people who are sick and those who are caring for them.
text: Tshela u@fields.child_nickname ukuthi kumele sizwelane nabantu abagulayo nalabo ababanakekelayo.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Tell your child that we can be compassionate to people who are sick and those who are caring for them.
text: Tshela ingane yakho singazwelana nabantu abagulayo nalabo ababanakekelayo.

SourceText: Well done for adding another skill to your Parenting Toolkit! Over the next few days, try to talk about COVID-19 with your child in a supportive way. It will make them feel loved and safe. You are the hero of this story!
text: Siyakubongela ngokwengeza elinye ikhono emgodleni wakho wokuba ngumzali! Ezinsukwini ezimbalwa ezilandelayo, zama ukukhuluma ngeCOVID-19 nengane yakho ngendlela enokuyeseka. Lokhu kuzobenza bazizwe bethandwa futhi bephephile. Nguwena iqhawe lale ndaba!

SourceText: Well done for adding another layer to your House of Support! Over the next few days, try to talk about COVID-19 with your child in a supportive way. It will make them feel loved and safe. You are the hero of this story!
text: Siyabonga ngokwengeza okunye okusha emgodleni wakho wokweseka ingane ekhaya! Ezinsukwini ezimbalwa ezilandelayo, zama ukukhuluma ngeCOVID-19 nengane yakho ngendlela enokuyeseka. Lokhu kuzobenza bazizwe bethandwa futhi bephephile. Nguwena iqhawe lale ndaba!

SourceText: I understand that these times can be really difficult.  Please type "Help" if you want any extra support or guidance. Chat to you later!
text: Ngiyazi ukuthi lezi kungaba yizikhathi ezinzima impela.  Siyacela ubhale “Usizo” uma ufuna ukuthola okunye ukwesekwa noma ukwelulekwa. Sobuye sikhulume!

SourceText: Sometimes we feel frustrated with our children because we expect them to behave in ways that they are not yet developmentally ready for.
text: Ngesinye isikhathi siyadinwa yizingane zethu ngenxa yokuthi silindele ukuthi ziziphathe ngendlela ethile kodwa ezingakakhuli ngokwanele ukuziphatha ngayo.

SourceText: Learning about child development means we can have realistic expectations and also to spot any problems with their growth and development.
text: Ukufunda ngokukhula kwengane kusho ukuthi singaba nezinto eziyiqiniso okungamele sizilindele nokuthi sikwazi ukubona izinkinga ngokukhula nokuthuthuka kwazo.

SourceText: All children develop at different rates. Here's a video to help you understand what to expect from your children.
text: Zonke izingane zikhula ngamazinga angefani. Nansi i-video ezokusiza uqonde ukuthi yini ongayilindela enganeni yakho.

SourceText: All children develop at different rates. Here's an audio message to help you understand what to expect from your children.
text: Zonke izingane zikhula ngamazinga angefani. Nawu umyalezo olalelwayo ozokusiza uqonde ukuthi yini ongayilindela enganeni yakho.

SourceText: That's okay! You can always type "Help" if you want to learn more about child development.
text: Kulungile! Ungabhala “Usizo” noma kunini uma ufuna ukufunda kabanzi ngokukhula kwengane yakho.

SourceText: All children develop at different rates. But there are some things that we expect children to be able to do at an age. These are called ‘development’ milestones.
text: Zonke izingane zikhula ngamazinga angefani. Kodwa kunezinto esiyaye silindele ukuthi izingane zibe sezikwazi ukuzenza esigabeni esithile sokukhula. Lokhu kubizwa ngezigaba “zokukhula”.

SourceText: Many things affect our children's development. For example, development is helped by eating healthy food, having immunisations, and parents or caregivers who talk to them a lot.
text: Kuningi okuthikameza ukukhula kwezingane zethu. Isibonelo, ukukhula kulekelelwa wukuba ingane idle ukudla okunempilo, igome, futhi ibe nabazali nababheki abakhuluma nayo kakhulu?

SourceText: Which child development milestones do you want to learn about?
text: Yisiphi isigaba sokukhula kwengane ofuna ukufunda ngaso?

SourceText: Sorry I don't understand what you mean.
text: Ngiyaxolisa angizwa ukuthi uqonde ukuthini.

SourceText: Young children have similar needs as toddlers.  Here's an audio message to help you understand your child's developmental needs better.
text: Izingane zincane zinezidingo ezifanayo nezojahidada.  Nawu umyalezo oqoshiwe ozokusiza ukuqonda ngezidingo zokukhula kwengane yakho kangcono.

SourceText: Babies from 0 to 1 year need lots of play and attention. Here's a video to help you understand your child's developmental needs better.
text: Izingane ezisukela ku 0 kuya ku 1 weminyaka sifuna ukunakwa nokudlaliswa kakhulu. Nansi i-video ezokusiza uqonde kangcono ngezidingo zokukhula kwengane yakho.

SourceText: Babies from 0 to 1 year need lots of play and attention. Here's an audio message to help you understand your child's developmental needs better.
text: Izingane ezisukela ku 0 kuya ku 1 weminyaka sifuna ukunakwa nokudlaliswa kakhulu. Nawu umyalezo oqoshiwe ozokusiza ukuqonda ngezidingo zokukhula kwengane yakho kangcono.

SourceText: Young children have similar needs as toddlers.  Here's a video to help you understand your child's developmental needs better.
text: Izingane zincane zinezidingo ezifanayo nezojahidada.  Nansi i-video ezokusiza uqonde kangcono ngezidingo zokukhula kwengane yakho.

SourceText: Young children (4-6 years):
text: Izingane ezincane (iminyaka engu-4-6):

SourceText: • Same as toddlers, but also...
text: • Ngendlela efanayo neyojahidada, kodwa futhi…

SourceText: • Learn through actions and play.
text: • Zifunda ngokwenza nokudlala.

SourceText: • Develop friendships with other children
text: • Zakha ubungani nezinye izingane

SourceText: • Find it difficult to separate make-believe from reality. Still express feelings in dramatic ways!
