text: • Zikuthola kunzima ukuhlukanisa into eyiqiniso newukukhohlisa. Zikhombisa imizwa yazo ngendlela enehaba!

SourceText: Young teenagers (10-12 years)
text: Izingane esezikhulakhulile (10-12 weminyaka)

SourceText: • More interested in learning in school.
text: •  Zithanda kakhulu ukufunda esikoleni.

SourceText: • Start to want independence and trust.
text: • Ziyaqala ukufuna ukuzimela nokwethemba.

SourceText: • Want to spend time with other children and young teenagers.
text: • Zifuna ukuchitha isikhathi esiningi nontanga noma nezinye izingane.

SourceText: • May be interested in religion or spirituality
text: • Zingathanda ukusonta noma izinto ezingokomoya.

SourceText: • May answer back to adults to show that they “know”.
text: • Zingaphendula kubantu abadala ukukhombisa ukuthi “ziyazi”.

SourceText: • Can be very self-conscious and sensitive
text: • Zingaqaphela kakhulu ubuzona futhi zizwele.

SourceText: • Can learn to better manage anger and tolerate frustration.
text: • Zingafunda ukulawula ukudinwa nokubekezelela ingcindezi.

SourceText: Infant (0–1 year) needs:
text: Usana (0-1 weminyaka) ludinga:

SourceText: • Us to provide food, sleep, cleaning, comfort and safety.
text: • Ukunikwa ukudla, ukulaliswa, ukugezwa, ukuthokomala nokuphepha.

SourceText: • A strong bond with parent/ caregiver.
text: • Ukuxhumana okunamandla nomzali/nombheki.

SourceText: • Lots of play and attention - the most active time of brain development is during the first 1000 days of life!
text: • Ukudlaliswa nokunakwa okuningi – isikhathi okuyisona esibalulekile sokukhula komqondo yisezinsukwini ezingu-1000 zokuzalwa!

SourceText: Middle teenagers (13-14 years)
text: Izingane esezikhulile (13-14 weminyaka)

SourceText: • Begin to challenge adult rules
text: • Ziyaqala ukuphosela inselelo imithetho yabantu abadala.

SourceText: • Are often insecure and confused.
text: • Imvamisa azizethembi futhi ziyadideka.

SourceText: • Feelings get hurt easily and have mood swings
text: • Ziyashesha ukuzwela futhi ziyashintshashintsha

SourceText: • Try to be the boss and are unhappy if they lose.
text: • Ziyazama ukulawula futhi azikuthandi ukwehlulwa.

SourceText: Infants (0-1):
text: Usana (0-1):

SourceText: • 0–6 months: Smile, babble and cry to attract your attention. We should provide care, cuddling and protection.
text: • 0-6 wezinyanga: Moyizela, bhabhazelisa umlomo futhi ukhale ukuze bezokunaka. Kumele sibanakekele, sibagone futhi sibavikele.

SourceText: • 6–11 months: Cling to you, especially when feeling insecure or frightened.
text: • 6-11 wezinyanga: Ubambelela kuwena, ikakhulukazi uma ezizwa engaphephile noma ethukile.

SourceText: • 12–23 months: Start to walk, talk and explore things around them!
text: • 12-23 wezinyanga: Uqala ukuhamba, ukukhuluma nokufuna ukwazi izinto ezibazungezile!

SourceText: • Their friends are important and affect their choices
text: • Abangani babo babalulekile futhi baba nesadla kwabakukhethayo

SourceText: • Need some freedom but also reliable rules that don't change
text: • Ufuna inkululeka kodwa futhi nemithetho ethembekile engashintshi

SourceText: • Need affection, reassurance, self-esteem, encouragement to believe in their abilities
text: • Bafuna ukuthandwa, ukuqinisekiswa, ukuzethemba, ukukhuthazwa ekukholelweni kulokho abakwazi ukukwenza

SourceText: Toddlers (2-3 years):
text: Ojahidada (2-3 weminyaka)

SourceText: • Become a curious little explorer - watch out for climbing!
text: • Bayaqala bathande ukubheka izinto – qaphela uthando lokugibela ezintweni!

SourceText: • Learn through play and trying things out
text: • Bafunda ngokudlala nokuzama izinto

SourceText: • Want to learn how to do new things (like getting dressed) and make their own decisions.
text: • Bafuna ukufunda ukwenza izinto ezintsha (njengokuzigqokisa) nokuzithathela izinqumo.

SourceText: • Want your praise and your approval
text: • Bafuna ukunconywa nemvume yakho.

SourceText: • May talk a lot; ask many questions. We should be honest when we reply! Our child may ask again if they don't understand or want to know more
text: • Bakhuluma kakhulu, babuze nemibuzo eminingi. Kumele siphendule ngokuyiqiniso! Ingane ingaphinde ibuze futhi uma ingaqondi noma ifuna ukwazi okunye okungaphezulu

SourceText: • Does not like to lose, share or take turns, but losing and taking turns can be taught.
text: • Azithandi ukwehlulwa, ukubokelaka noma ukushintshana, kodwa ukuhlulwa ngokushintsha kungafundiswa.

SourceText: Older teenagers (15–19 years)
text: Izingane esezindala (15-19 weminyaka)

SourceText: • The teen years are the second most active time of brain development!
text: • Iminyaka yezingane esezindala yisikhathi sesibili ngokubaluleka kakhulu ekukhuleni komqondo wengane.

SourceText: • Your child is almost an adult, they are able to communicate with you about
text: • Ingane yakho isuke isizokuba ngumuntu omdala, isuke isikwazi ukukhuluma nawe

SourceText: almost anything.
text: Nganoma yini.

SourceText: • They can think about new ideas, develop their own ideals and set their own course.
text: • Zingabuza ngamasu amasha, ziqhamuke nawazo amasu futhi ziziqalele zona ezifuna ukukwenza.

SourceText: • Start speaking in sentences and  learning new words.
text: • Qala ukhulume ngemisho futhi nifunde amagama amasha.

SourceText: • Does not like to lose or take turns, but sharing can be taught.
text: • Abathandi ukwehlulwa noma ukushintshana, kodwa ukubolekana kungafundiswa.

SourceText: • May express feelings in dramatic ways (like screaming on the floor!). Can start to learn how to manage their feelings.
text: • Zingaveza imizwa yazo ngendlela enehaba (njengokukhala bazibhuquze phansi!). Zingakwazi ukufunda ukulawula imizwa yazo.

SourceText: Older children (7-9 years)
text: Izingane ezikhulakhulile (7-9 weminyaka)

SourceText: • Same early childhood, but also…
text: • Kuyefana ubungane, kodwa futhi…

SourceText: • Interested in learning at school.
text: • Zithanda ukufunda esikoleni.

SourceText: • Starts to want independence and trust.
text: • Ziyaqala ukufuna ukuzimela nokwethenjwa.

SourceText: • Wants to spend time with other children.
text: • Zifuna ukuchitha isikhathi nezinye izingane.

SourceText: • They are forming their own identity and have a growing sense of their
text: • Ziyaziqokela ukuthi zifuna ukuba njani futhi ziqale zikuqende kangcono

SourceText: sexuality
text: Ubulili bazo

SourceText: • They may prefer being with peers more than with you
text: • Zincamela ukuba nontanga yazo ukunokuba nawe

SourceText: • They may show risk-taking behaviours, frequent mood swings, and rebellious
text: • Zingaqala zikhombise ukuthi ziyakwazi ukuthatha amashansi, ukushintsha njalo komoya nokuphikisa

SourceText: attitudes. They can also have exciting new ideas!
text: okungukuziphatha. Zingaba nemibono emihle emisha!

SourceText: • May start to ask questions about religion
text: • Zingaqala ukubuza imibuzo ngenkolo

SourceText: • Can be very self-conscious and sensitive. May be very active. By now they should be getting better at managing anger and frustration.
text: • Zingaqala zifunde ukuziqaphela kanye nozwelo. Zingakhuthala kakhulu. Ngalesi sikhathi zisuke sezingcono ekulawuleni ukudinwa nengcindezi.

SourceText: • Be patient and accepting of the person they are becoming - even if it is not what you had imagined
text: • Bekezela wamukele lo muntu abasuke sebezoba nguyena – ngisho noma ngabe akukhona lokho obukulindele

SourceText: • Encourage them to begin to take responsibility for the future
text: • Bakhuthaze ukuthi baqale bahlelele ikusasa

SourceText: • Keep supporting them and loving them so that they feel comfortable, secure, and safe
text: • Qhubeka nokubeseka nokubathanda ukuze bakhulueke, bazizwe bephephile futhi bevikelekile.

SourceText: If you are concerned that your child might be delayed in their development, here is a link to services in your area that may also be helpful: [INSERT LOCAL LINK]
text: Uma ukhathazekile ukuthi ingane yakho kungenzeka ibambezeleke ekukhuleni, nansi i-link yezindawo ezingakusiza endaweni yangakini [FAKA I-LINK YENDAWO YANGAKINI]

SourceText: You can also visit UNICEF's website for more helpful information about child development [INSERT LOCAL UNICEF LINK]
text: Ungaphinde uvakashele iwebhusayithi ye-UNICEF ngolunye ulwazi olungaba wusizo ekukhuleni kwengane [FAKA I-LINK YE-UNICEF YANGAKINI]

SourceText: The teen years are the second most active time of brain development for your child! Here's an audio message to help you understand how to support @fields.child_nickname during this stage.
text: Iminyaka yokukhula yezingane ezindala yisikhathi sesibili ngokubakuleka ekukhuleni kwengqondo yengane yakho! Nawu umyalezo oqoshiwe ozokusiza uqonde ukuthi ungameseka kanjani u@fields.child_nickname ngalesi sikhathi.

SourceText: The teen years are the second most active time of brain development for your child! Here's an audio message to help you understand how to support your child during this stage.
text: Iminyaka yokukhula yezingane ezindala yisikhathi sesibili ngokubakuleka ekukhuleni kwengqondo yengane yakho! Nawu uyalezo oqoshiwe ozokusiza uqonde ukuthi ungayeseka kanjani ingane yakho ngalesi sikhathi.

SourceText: The most important things that you can do for your teen in this stage are:
text: Izinto ezibaluleke kakhulu ongazenzela ingane yakho ngalesi sikhathi:

SourceText: • Continue providing love, support and guidance and build a strong
text: • Qhubeka nokuyinika uthando, ukwesekwa nokukhalinywa futhi nakhe ubudlelwane obunamandla

SourceText: father-child connection
text: Ubudlelwane phakathi kukababa nengane

SourceText: • Monitor who their friends are, have clear rules to keep them safe
text: • Bheka ukuthi ngobani abangani  babo, bese uba nemithetho eqondile ukuze baphephe

SourceText: • Nurture their independence
text: • Beseke ekuzimeleni kwabo

SourceText: mother-child connection
text: Ukuxhumana kukamama nengane

SourceText: • Continue providing love, support and guidance and build a strong parent-child connection
text: • Qhubeka nokubanika uthando, ukwesekwa nokukhalinywa futhi wakhe budlelwane obuqinile phakathi komzali nengane.

SourceText: Well done for adding another tool to your Parenting Toolkit! Knowing about child development can help you feel less frustrated by them.
text: Siyakubongela ngokwengeza elinye ithuluzi eMgodleni wakho wokuba ngumzali! Ukwazi ngokukhula kwengane yakho kuyakusiza ukuthi ungabadinelwa kakhulu.

SourceText: Well done for adding another layer to your House of Support! Knowing about child development can help you feel less frustrated by them.
text: Siyabonga ngokwengeza okunye okusha emgodleni wakho wokweseka ingane ekhaya! Ukwazi ngokukhula kwengane yakho kuyakusiza ukuthi ungabadinelwa kakhulu.

SourceText: Remember you can always type "Help" if you ever want more parenting tips or support. Chat to you later @fields.user_name!
text: Khumbula ukuthi noma nini ungabhala “Usizo” uma udinga amanye amathiphu okuba ngumzali. Siyobuye sikhulume @fields.user_name!
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Remember you can always type "Help" if you ever want more parenting tips or support. Chat to you later!
text: Khumbula ukuthi noma nini ungabhala “Usizo” uma udinga amanye amathiphu okuba ngumzali. Sobuye sikhulume!

SourceText: All children, including those living with disabilities, need love, respect and time especially at difficult times.
text: Zonke izingane, okubalwa lezo eziphila nokukhubazeka, zidinga uthando, inhonipho nesikhathi ikakhulukazi ezikhathini ezinzima.

SourceText: Here's a video to help you support children living with disabilities.
text: Nansi i-video ezokusiza weseke izingane eziphila nokukhubazeka.

SourceText: Here's an audio message to help you support children living with disabilities.
text: Nawu uyalezo oqoshiwe ozokusiza weseke izingane eziphila nokukhubazeka.

SourceText: That's okay! You can always type "Help" if you want to learn more about how to support children living with disabilities.
text: Kulungile! Noma nini ungabhala “Usizo” uma udinga amanye amathiphu okweseka ingane ephila nokukhubazeka..

SourceText: Here are 6 simple tips that you can do to support children living with disabilities:
text: Nawa amathiphu awu-6 alula okweseka ingane ephila nokukhubazeka:

SourceText: 1. Keep your child safe and well
text: 1. Gcina ingane yakho iphephile futhi iphilile

SourceText: 2. Try to understand what they are feeling
text: 2. Zama ukuqonda ukuthi bazizwa kanjani

SourceText: 3. Communicate and talk with them
text: 3. Xhumana futhi ukhulume nabo

SourceText: 4. Praise them!
text: 4. Bancome!

SourceText: 5. Make things that you do the same every day to help them feel secure
text: 5. Yiba nezinto ozenzayo ezifanayo nsuku zonke ukubasiza bazizwe bevikelekile

SourceText: 6. Ask for help if you can
text: 6. Cela usizo uma ungakwazi

SourceText: Type "1" to "6" to learn more about each tip. Type "N" to stop this tip.
text: Bhala “1” kuya ku “6” ukufunda kabanzi ngethiphu ngayinye. Bhala u “N” ukumisa le thiphu.

SourceText: Step 4. Praise them!
text: Isinyathelo 4. Bancome!

SourceText: • Praise them for behaving well, and for trying.
text: • Bancome ngokuziphatha kahle, nangokuzama.

SourceText: • Focus on what they can do, not what they can't.
text: • Gxila kulokho abakwazi ukukwenza, hhayi abangakwazi.

SourceText: • Only help children when they need it. It is also good to build independence!
text: • Siza kuphela izingane uma zidinga usizo. Kuhle futhi ukubenza bazimele!

SourceText: Step 6. Ask for help if you can
text: Isinyathelo 6. Cela usizo uma ungakwazi

SourceText: • Share the load with other adult family members.
text: • Lekelelana namanye amalungu omndeni asekhulile.

SourceText: •  You are not alone! Keep connected with people who understand your situation.
text: Awuwedwa! Xhumana nabantu abasiqondayo isimo sakho.

SourceText: Here is a comic on how you can reinforce your child's strength.
text: Nawu omunye umzekelo wokuthi ungayithuthukisa kanjani ingane yakho.

SourceText: • Share your challenges AND your successes.
text: • Xoxa ngezinselelo nangokuphumelela kwakho.

SourceText: • It is normal to feel stressed, frustrated, and afraid at this time.
text: • Kuvamile ukuzizwa unengcindeni, udiniwe, futhi unokwesaba ngezinye izikhathi.

SourceText: • Be kind to yourself and take a break when you need to!
text: • Ungazixini futhi kuhle uhlabe ikhefu uma ulidinga!

SourceText: Child: "la la la la…."
text: Ingane: “la la la la….”

SourceText: Teen: "la la la la…"
text: Ingane ekhulile: “la la la la…”

SourceText: Disabled Child: "la la la la…"
text: Ingane ekhubazekile: “la la la la…”

SourceText: Parent: "It was so lovely to hear you singing while I was preparing dinner. Food is ready! Please tidy the room and put away the toys."
text: Umzali: “Bekumnandi ukukuzwa ucula ngesikhathi senza isidlo sakusihlwa. Ukudla sekulungile! Ngicela uhlanze igumbi bese ubeka kahle amathoyizi.”

SourceText: Please select another number if you want to learn more about how to support children living with disabilities:
text: Khetha enye inombolo uma ufuna ukufunda kabanzi ngokuthi ungayeseka kanjani ingane ephila nokukhubazeka:

SourceText: Teen: "Here is the toy box. We can put the toys inside."
text: Ingane esikhulile: “Nali ibhokisi lamathoyizi. Singafana phakathi amathoyizi.”

SourceText: Disabled Child: "Please remember my favourite car!"
text: Ingane ephila nokukhubazeka: “Ngicela ukhumbule imoto yami engiyithandayo!”

SourceText: Child: "I have it right here!"
text: Ingane: “Ikhona la!”

SourceText: Here is a link to disability services in your area that may also be helpful: [INSERT LOCAL LINK]
text: Nansi i-link yokuthola usizo ngokukhubazeka ngakini engaba wusizo: [FAKA I-LINK YANGAKINI]

SourceText: Parent: "I am so happy you have tidied up your toys together! It is dinnertime!"
text: Umzali: “Ngiyajabula ukuthi usuwaqoqile amathoyizi akho! Sekuyisikhathi sesidlo sakusihlwa!”

SourceText: Disabled child: "Can you help me come to dinner?"
text: Ingane ephila nokukhubazeka: “Ungangisiza ukuba ngize esidlweni sakusihlwa?”

SourceText: Parent: "Thank you for asking. Let's go together. You are so strong!"
text: Umzali: “Ngiyabonga ngokuba ungicele. Masihambe kanye kanye. Unamandla!”

SourceText: Remember you can always type "Help" if you ever want more parenting tips or support. Chat later!
text: Khumbula ukuthi noma nini ungabhala “Usizo” uma udinga amanye amathiphu okuba ngumzali. Masibuye sikhulume!

SourceText: Step 1. Keep your child safe and well
text: Isinyathelo 1. Gcina ingane yakho iphephile futhi iphilile

SourceText: • Keep your country's COVID-19 rules, and also help @fields.child_nickname_disabled to be active - do whatever exercise you can with them inside or outside your home
text: • Gcina imigomo yeCOVID-19 yezwe lakho, uphinde usize u@fields.child_nickname_disabled ukuzivocavoca – enze noma yimuphi umnyakazo wokujima ongawenza naye ngaphakathi ekhaya noma ngaphandle.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated. @results.count is a number (counter for list)

SourceText: • Keep emergency contact numbers somewhere easy to see
text: • Gcina kahle izinombolo zezimo eziphuthumayo endaweni okuzoba lula ukuzibona khona

SourceText: • Keep your country's COVID-19 rules, and also help your child to be active - do whatever exercise you can with them inside or outside your home
text: • Hlonipha imigomo yeCOVID-19 yezwe lakho, futhi usize ingane izivocavoca – yeze noam yimuphi umnyakazo wokujima ongawenza nayo ngaphakathi ekhaya noma ngaphandle.

SourceText: Step 5. Make daily plans to help them feel secure
text: Isinyathelo 5. Yenza amapulani ansuku zonke azobenza bazizwe bephephile

SourceText: • Having things that are the same each day helps children feel secure and safe.
text: • Ukwenza izinto ezifanayo nsuku zonke kwenza izingane zizizwe ziphephile futhi zivikelekile.

SourceText: • Make a daily plan that includes some things they like to do.
text: • Yenza uhlelo losuku olubandakanya izinto abangathanda ukuzenza.

SourceText: • Help @fields.child_nickname_disabled connect to friends and family members through phone, writing cards, or drawing pictures.
text: • Siza u{1) ukuxhumana banangani namalungu omndeni ngocingo, ukubhala amakhadi, noma ukudweba izithombe.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: • Help your child connect to friends and family members through phone, writing cards, or drawing pictures.
text: • Siza ingane yakho ukuxhumana banangani namalungu omndeni ngocingo, ukubhala amakhadi, noma ukudweba izithombe.

SourceText: Step 2. Try to understand how they are feeling
text: Isinyathelo 2. Zama ukuqonda ukuthi bazizwa kanjani

SourceText: • @fields.child_nickname_disabled may be feeling a lot of stress, anxiety, and frustration.
text: • U@fields.child_nickname_disabled angazizwa enengcindezi, enokukhathazeka futhi nokudinwa.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: • Tell them that you love them
text: • Batshele ukuthi uyabathanda

SourceText: • Praise them for being good and for trying to be good!
text: • Bancome ngokwenza kahle noma ngokuzama ukwenza kahle!

SourceText: • Your child may be feeling a lot of stress, anxiety, and frustration.
text: • Ingane yakho ingazizwa inengcindezi, inokukhathazeka futhi inokudinwa.

SourceText: • Give @fields.child_nickname_disabled choices: this gives them a sense of control and builds self-esteem.
text: • Nikeza u@fields.child_nickname_disabled ithuba lokukhetha: lokhu kubanika umqondo wokukwazi ukulawula futhi kwakhe ukuzethemba.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: • Use simple language and clear instructions. If words aren't good for them, try gestures and pictures.
text: • Sebenzisa ulimi olulula nemiyalelo ecacile. Uma bengawezwa amagama, zama ukulingisa nezithombe.

SourceText: • Give your child choices: this gives them a sense of control and builds self-esteem.
text: • Ukunika ingane yakho ithuba lokukhetha: lokhu kubanika umqondo wokukwazi ukulawula futhi kwakhe ukuzethemba.

SourceText: Step 3. Talking and communicating with your child
text: Isinyathelo 3. Ukukhuluma nokuxhumana nengane yakho

SourceText: • Get down to @fields.child_nickname_disabled’s level when you speak.
text: • Yehlela ezingeni lakhe u@fields.child_nickname_disabled uma ukhuluma.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: • Look at them and smile
text: • Mbheke bese umoyizela

SourceText: • Give them time to tell you or show you what they think
text: • Banikeze isikhathi sokukutshela noma sokukukhombisa ukuthi bacabangani

SourceText: • Tell @fields.child_nickname_disabled that you understand
text: •Tshela u@fields.child_nickname_disabled ukuthi uyamuzwa
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: • Get down to your child’s level when you speak.
text: • Yehlela ezingeni lengane yakho uma ukhuluma.

SourceText: • Tell your child that you understand
text: • Tshela ingane yakho ukuthi uyayizwa

text: Usuwengeze elinye izinga lokwesekwa endlini yakho! Izingane eziphila nokukhubazeka zidinga uthando, inhlonipho nesikhathi – njenganomam iyiphi enye ingane.

SourceText: Hello! Today we are going to learn what we can do when our children are already misbehaving or have already misbehaved…
text: Sawubona!  Namuhla sizofunda ngokuthi yikuphi esingakwenza uma izingane zethu zingaziphathi kahle noma zenze okungafanele…

SourceText: Use consequences for refusing to follow instructions or forgetting household rules. Consequences help teach our children responsibility for what they do. They also allow discipline that is controlled. This is more effective than hitting or shouting.
text: Makube nesijeziso ukwenqaba ukulandela imiyalelo noma ukukhohlwa imithetho yasekhaya. Isijeziso sisiza ukufundisa izingane zethu ukuphendula ngezinto ezizenzayo. Siphinde sense kube nendlela yokuziphatha elawulekile.  Lokhu kusebenza kangcono ukunokuthetha nokushaya.

SourceText: Children and teens often act disrespectfully or like they only care about themselves. Growing up is a difficult time when they are learning about who they are and how they want to be in the world. Luckily, there are other ways to discipline your teen without using violence…and they work well!
text: Izingane nezingane esezikhulile zivamile ukungahlonipho noma ukwenza sengathi yizona kuphela. Ukukhula yisikhathi esinzima uma befunda ukuthi bangobani nokuthi bafuna ukuba ngobani nokuba yini emhlabeni. Ngenhlanhla, kunezindlela zokukhuza abantu abasha ngaphandle kokucasuka noma ukuba nodlame... futhi zisebenza kahle!

SourceText: Giving calm consequences help teach our children responsibility for what they do. They also allow discipline that is controlled. This is more effective than hitting or shouting.
text: Ukwethula imiphumela ngomoya ophansi kusiza izingane zifunde ukuthi ezikwenzayo kunemiphumela – emihle noma emibi. Siphinde sense kube nendlela yokuziphatha elawulekile.  Lokhu kusebenza kangcono ukunokuthetha nokushaya.

SourceText: Here are 5 tips for using consequences:
text: Nawa amathuphu awu-5 okusebenzisa isijeziso:

SourceText: 1. Give a choice before consequence
text: 1. Qale umnike ithuba lokuzikhethela ngaphambi kwesijeziso

SourceText: 2. Stay calm but be firm
text: 2. Yehlisa umoya kodwa uqinise  kokushoyo

SourceText: 3. Be realistic and follow through
text: 3. Yisho into ezwakalayo bese uyilandela

SourceText: 4. Reconnect afterwards
text: 4. Ngemuva kwalokho phinde uxhumane nengane yakho

SourceText: 5. Consequences for breaking rules
text: 5. Isijezo sokuphula imithetho

SourceText: To learn more about one of these tips, type "1" to "5". You can also type "N" to move on.
text: Ukufunda kabanzi ngenye yalawa mathiphu, bhala “1” kuya ku “5”. Ungaphinde ubhale “N” ukuphubekela phambili.

SourceText: Consequences can also be used when your children forget a household rule, like going to bed at a certain hour or doing schoolwork before T.V.
text: Isijeziso singaphinde sisetshenziswe uma izingane zakho zikhohlwa yimithetho yasekhaya, njengokuyolala ngesikhathi esithile noma ukwenza umsebenzi wesikole ngaphambi kokubuka i-TV.

SourceText: 2. Try to stay calm but firm when giving the consequence.
text: 2. Zama ukwehlisa umoya kodwa uqinise uma ukhipha isijesizo.

SourceText: If you start yelling, it will just make things worse. Take a deep breath before you speak in a clear, calm, and firm voice.
text: Uma uqala ngokuthetha, kuzokwenza izinto zibe zimbi kakhulu. Donsa kakhulu umoya ngaphambi kokukhuluma ngendlela ecacile, enomoya ophansi nezwi eliqinile.

SourceText: Make sure you can follow through with the consequence. For example, taking away a teenager’s phone for a week is hard to enforce. Taking it away for one hour is more realistic.
text: Qinisekisa ukuthi isijeziso uyasilandelela. Isibonelo, ukuthatha iselula yengane esikhulile isonto lonke kunzima ukukwenza. Ukuyithatha ihora elilodwa khona kuyenzeka kalula.

SourceText: Please select another number if you want to learn more about using consequences:
text: Khetha enye inombolo uma ufuna ukufunda kabanzi ngokusebenzisa isijeziso:

SourceText: Here is a comic that shows a parent giving their child a choice to follow the instruction or receive a consequence.
text: Nansi indatshana ekhombisa umzali enikeza ingane ithuba lokuzikhethela ukulandela umyalelo noma ukuthola isijeziso.

SourceText: Parent: “In 5 minutes it will be time to give me back the phone and start your school work.”
text: Umzali: “Esikhathini esiyimizuzu ewu-5 kuzomele ungikeze ucingo bese uqala umsebenzi wakho wesikole.”

SourceText: Teen (distractedly): “Uh-huh…”
text: Ingane ekhulile (ngokunganaki): “Uh-huh…”

SourceText: Parent: “5 minutes is up. Please give me the phone.”
text: Umzali: “Imizuzu wu-5 iphelile. Ngicela unginikeze ucingo.”

SourceText: Teen: “No, I am not done. I just need to get to the next level.”
text: Ingane esikhulile: “Cha. Angikakaqedi. Ngisafuna ukudlulela kwesinye isigaba esilandelayo.”

SourceText: Parent: “You have a choice, either you give me the phone now, or you cannot use it after dinner.”
text: Umzali: “Uzokhetha, ukuthi unginikeza ucingo manje, noma angeke ukwazi ukulusebenzisa ngemuva kwesidlo sakusihlwa.”

SourceText: Teen (not happy but agreeing): “Fine.”
text: Ingane ekhulile (ingathandi kodwa ivuma): “Kulungile-ke.”

SourceText: Parent: “Thank you for giving me the phone back, Carter. Now please do your school work. After that we can take a walk or play a game together.”
text: Umzali: “Ngiyabonga ngokunginika ucingo, Carter. Manje-ke yenza umsebenzi wakho wesikole. Uma usuqedile sizohamba noma sidlale umdlalo ndawonye.”

text: 1. Nikeza ingane yakho ithuba lokukhetha ukulandela umyalelo wakho ngaphambi kokuyinika isijeziso.

SourceText: 4. Reconnect afterwards.
text: 4. Phindani nizwane futhi.

SourceText: Once the consequence is over, give @fields.child_nickname a chance to do something good, and praise them for it.
text: Uma sesiphelile isijeziso, nika u{1) ithuba lokwenza into enhle, bese uyamncoma emuva kwalokho.

SourceText: Once the consequence is over, give your child a chance to do something good, and praise them for it.
text: Uma sesiphelile isijeziso, nika ingane yakho ithuba lokwenza into enhle, bese uyayincoma emuva kwalokho.

SourceText: For example, you can tell @fields.child_nickname that if they do not do their schoolwork before dinner, they cannot watch their favourite T.V. show that evening.

note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: For example, you can tell your child that if they do not do their schoolwork before dinner, they cannot watch their favourite T.V. show that evening.
text: Isibonelo, ungatshela ingane yakho ukuthi uma  ingawenzi umsebenzi wesikole ngaphambi kwesidlo sakusihlwa angeke iwubuke umdlalo wayo ewuthandayo kwiTV.

SourceText: Well done! You have added another skill to your Parenting Toolkit! When your child is behaving badly, try responding in a calm way with a fair consequence. It will help them learn that their actions have an impact on themselves and others. It also teaches them about responsibility and respect!
text: Wenze kahle! Sewengeze elinye ikhono emgodleni wakho wokuba ngumzali! Uma ingane yakho iziphatha budlabha, zama ukuphendula ngendlela enomoya ophansi futhi kube nesijezo esifanele. Kuzobasiza bafunde ukuthi izenzo zabo zinomthelela kubona nakwabanye. Kuphinde kubafundise ukuthi kumele bamele abakwenzayo futhi bafunde inhlonipho!

SourceText: Well done! You have added another layer to your House of Support! When your child is behaving badly, try responding in a calm way with a fair consequence. It will help them learn that their actions have an impact on themselves and others. It also teaches them about responsibility and respect!
text: Wenze kahle! Usuwengeze elinye izinga lokwesekwa endlini yakho! Uma ingane yakho iziphatha budlabha, zama ukuphendula ngendlela enomoya ophansi futhi kube nesijezo esifanele. Kuzobasiza bafunde ukuthi izenzo zabo zinomthelela kubona nakwabanye. Kuphinde kubafundise ukuthi kumele bamele abakwenzayo futhi bafunde inhlonipho!

SourceText: Today's Tip is about how we can support our teens when they experience really difficult situations.
text: Ithiphu yanamuhla ingokuthi sizisiza kanjani izingane esezindala uma zibhekana nezimo ezinzima ngempela.

SourceText: When our children share difficult experiences with us, we may initially get angry because we are afraid for them. But that is when we need to stay calm, listen, and be open.
text: Uma izingane zisixoxela izinkinga ezibhekene nazo, okokuqala singadinwa ngoba siyazesabela. Kodwa yingaleso sikhathi okumele ukuthi sehlise umoya, silalele futhi sivuleleke.

SourceText: Do you want some tips that can help you respond in a more supportive way?
text: Uyawadinga amathiphu angakusiza ukuphendula ngendlela enokweseka okungcono?

SourceText: Remember that you can also change the type of messages you receive for an older or younger child. Just select "Technical Support." Chat to you later @fields.user_name!
text: Khumbula ukuthi ungashintsha futhi nendlela owemukela ngayo enganeni ekhulile nasenganeni encane. Vele ukhethe u “Tehcnical Support.” Siyobuye sikhulume @fields.user_name!

SourceText: Remember that you can also change the type of messages you receive for an older or younger child. Just select "Technical Support." Chat to you later!
text: Khumbula ukuthi ungashintsha futhi nendlela owemukela ngayo enganeni ekhulile nasenganeni encane. Vele ukhethe u “Tehcnical Support.” Sobuye sikhulume!

SourceText: When our children share something that is especially troubling, we need to remember to stay calm, listen, and be open.
text: Uma izingane zethu zisitshela izinto ikakhulukazi eziyinkinga, kudingeka zikhumbule ukwehlisa umoya, silalele, vese siyavuleleka.

SourceText: Here's a video on how you can support your teen when they are experiencing difficult situations.
text: Nansi i-video ekukhombisa ukuthi ungayeseka kanjani ingane yakho endala uma inezinkinga.

SourceText: Here's an audio message on how you can support your teen when they are experiencing difficult situations.
text: Nawu umyalezo oqoshiwe wokuthi ungayisiza kanjani ingane yakho uma inezinkinga.

SourceText: Here are some things you can do when your teen shares something difficult with you:
text: Nazi ezinye izinto ongazenza uma ingane yakho esikhulile ikuxoxela into enzima:

SourceText: • Take a deep breath before you respond.
text: • Donsa umoya ngaphambi kokuphendula.

SourceText: • Listen to what your child is saying. Notice how they are feeling.
text: • Lalela ukuthi ingane yakho ithini. Qaphela ukuthi izizwa kanjani.

SourceText: • Notice how you feel. Ask yourself, "What does my child need right now?"
text: • Qaphela indlela ozizwa ngayo Zibuze ‘yini edingwa yingane yami njengamanje’

SourceText: • Reassure your child that you are there for them.
text: • Qinisekisa ingane yakho ukuthi ukhona wena ukuyimela.

SourceText: • You can deal with the consequences later but right now your child needs you.
text: • Ungasikhipha isijeziso ngokuhamba kwesikhathi kodwa manje ingane yakho iyakudinga.

SourceText: • Discuss possible solutions or next steps to take action.
text: • Xoxa ngezisombululo ezingaba khona noma izinyathelo ozozithatha.

SourceText: • Remind your child again that you love them and thank them for sharing with you.
text: • Khumbuza ingane yakho ukuthi uyayithanda futhi uyibonge ngokukuxoxela inkinga yayo.

SourceText: We understand that this can be really difficult. Please type "Help" if you want any extra support or guidance.
text: Siyazi ukuthi lokhu kungaba nzima kakhulu. Siyacela ubhale “Usizo” uma ufuna ukuthola okunye ukwesekwa noma ukwelulekwa.

SourceText: Here is a comic that shows how you can support your child during a crisis.
text: Nansi indatshana ekhombisa ukuthi ungayeseka kanjani ingane yakho uma ibhekene nenkinga.

SourceText: Parent: “What’s wrong, my dear? Come and sit by me and tell me what happened.”
text: Umzali: “Yini inkinga ngane yami? Woza uzohlala name ungixoxele ukuthi kwenzekeni.”

SourceText: Child: “It’s that person…they touched me…”
text: Ingane: “Yilowa muntu… ungithintile…”

SourceText: Parent: “Take your time... I am listening.”
text: Umzali: “Ungajahi… Ngilalele.”

SourceText: Child: “… they held me down…told me I would be in trouble if I told anybody…”
text: Ingane: “…ungicindezele phansi… wangitshela ukuthi ngizobona uma ngike ngaxoxela omunye umuntu…”

SourceText: Parent: “I believe you. You are not in trouble. It is not your fault. This is a big thing and we will find a way to get the help you need. I wonder where we can go for help…?”
text: Umzali: “Ngiyakukholwa. Awukho enkingeni. Lokhu akulona iphutha lakho.” Yinto enkulu lena futhi sizoyithola indlela yokuthola usizo oludingayo. Angazi ukuthi sizoya kuphi ukuze sithole usizo…?

SourceText: Child: “The clinic? But could you come with me?”
text: Ingane: “Emtholampilo? Kodwa wena ungahamba nami?”

SourceText: Parent: “Yes, they will know what to do. Of course, I will come with you. Remember, this is not your fault. I love you and we will get through this.”
text: Umzali: “Yebo, bazokwazi ukuthi yini okumele yenziwe. IMpela, ngizohamba nawe. Khumbula ukuthi lokhu akulona iphutha lakho.” Ngiyakuthanda futhi sizodlula kule nto.”

SourceText: Child: “Thanks so much.”
text: Ingane: Ngiyabonga kakhulu

SourceText: Remember you can always type "Help" if you ever want more parenting tips or support.
text: Khumbula ukuthi noma nini ungabhala “Usizo” uma udinga amanye amathiphu okuba ngumzali.

SourceText: Well done @fields.user_name! You have added another skill to your Parenting Toolkit! Try following these steps whenever your child shares something difficult. Supporting your child through a crisis will also teach them how to support others in difficult times. Good for you!
text: Wenze kahle @fields.user_name. Sewengeze elinye ikhono emgodleni wakho wokuba ngumzali! Zama ukulandela lezi zinyathelo noma nini uma ingane yakho ikuxoxela into enzima. Ukweseka ingane yakho idlule ebunzimeni kuzophinde kubafundise ukweseka abanye uma kunezikhathi ezinzima. Kuhle lokho!

text: Wenze kahle! Usuwengeze elinye izinga lokwesekwa endlini yakho! Zama ukulandela lezi zinyathelo noma nini uma ingane yakho ikuxoxela into enzima. Ukweseka ingane yakho idlule ebunzimeni kuzophinde kubafundise ukweseka abanye uma kunezikhathi ezinzima. Kuhle lokho!

SourceText: When we are able to have peaceful and loving relationships, our children feel more secure and loved. Kindness and taking care of yourself help.
text: Uma siveza ubudlelwano obunokuthula nobunothando, izingane zethu zizizwa zivikelekile futhi zithandwa kakhudlwana. Umusa nokuzinakekela kuyasiza.

SourceText: Here's a video to help you support positive family relationships at home.
text: Nansi i-video ezokusiza wesekele ubudlelwano obuhle emndenini.

SourceText: Here's an audio message to help you support positive family relationships at home.
text: Nawu uyalezo oqoshiwe ozokusisa wesekele ubudlelwano obuhle emndenini.

SourceText: Here are 6 simple steps that you can do to support family harmony at home:
text: Nazi izinyathelo eziwu-6 ezilula ongazithatha ukweseka ubumbano lomndeni ekhaya:

SourceText: 1. Be a model of behaviour for your kids
text: 1. Yiba yisibonelo sendlela yokuziphatha ezinganeni zakho

SourceText: 2. Keep it positive
text: 2. Hlala njalo unethemba

SourceText: 3. Listen carefully to others
text: 3. Balalelisise abanye

SourceText: 4. Share the load
text: 4. Yabelana ngomthwalo.

SourceText: 5. Take care of yourself
text: 5. Zinakekele.

SourceText: 6. Do nice things together as a family.
text: 6. Izinto ezinhle eningazenza ndawonye njengomndeni.

SourceText: Type "1" to 6" to learn more about these tips. Type "N" to stop this tip.
text: Bhala “1” kuya ku “6” ukufunda kabanzi ngalawa mathiphu. Bhala u “N” ukumisa le thiphu.

SourceText: Step 4. Share the load
text: Isinyathelo 4. Yabelana ngomthwalo.

SourceText: Looking after children and other family members is difficult, but it’s much easier when responsibilities are shared. Try to share household chores, childcare, and other tasks equally amongst family members
text: Ukunakekela abantwana kanye namanye amalungu omndeni kunzima, kodwa kuba lula uma imisebenzi ihlanganyelwa. Zamani ukwaba imisebenzi yasekhaya, ukunakekela izingane, kanye neminye imisebenzi ngokulinganayo phakathi kwamalungu omndeni.

SourceText: Step 5. Take care of yourself
text: Isinyathelo 5. Zinakekele.

SourceText: Create a schedule for time “on” and time “off” with other adults in your household. It is okay to ask for help when you are feeling tired or stressed so that you can take a break
text: Yakha isimiso sesikhathi "sokungena" nesikhathi "sokuphuma" nabanye abantu abadala ekhaya lakho. Kulungile ukucela usizo uma uzizwa ukhathele noma ucindezelekile ukuze uthathe ikhefu.

SourceText: Step 6. Do nice things together as a family
text: Isinyathelo 6. Izinto ezinhle eningazenza ndawonye njengomndeni

SourceText: Let each family member take turns choosing a whole family activity. Find ways to spend time alone with other adults in your home, too!
text: Ilungu ngalinye lomndeni malishintshane ngokukhetha umsebenzi womndeni wonke usuku ngalunye. Thola izindlela zokuchitha isikhathi uwedwa nabanye abantu abadala ekhaya!

SourceText: Step 1. Be a model of behaviour for your kids
text: Isinyathelo 1. Yiba yisibonelo sendlela yokuziphatha ezinganeni zakho

SourceText: How we talk and behave in front of our children is a big influence on how they behave too! Try to talk kindly to everyone in the family, adults and children.
text: Indlela esikhuluma nesiziphatha ngayo phambi kwezingane zethu inomthelela omkhulu endleleni abaziphatha ngayo nabo! Zama ukukhuluma ngomusa kuwo wonke umuntu emndenini, abantu abadala kanye nezingane.

SourceText: Step 2. Use positive language. It works!
text: Isinyathelo 2. Sebenzisa ulimi olwakhayo! Luyasebenza! Kuyasebenza!

SourceText: Tell others what you want them to do instead of what you don’t want them to do: Instead of “Stop shouting,” try “Please speak more quietly”
text: Tshela abanye ukuthi ufuna benzeni ukunokubatshela ongafuni bakwenze: Esikhundleni sokuthi “Yeka umsindo,” zama ukuthi “Ngicela ukhulumele phansi”

SourceText: Decide to take a break from arguing when you see arguments building up, and go into another room or outside if you can.
text: Nquma ukuyeka ukuphikisana uma ubona ukuthi kunempikiswano eqalayo, bese uya kwelinye igumbi noma uphume phandle uma ungakwazi.

SourceText: You can always type "Help" if you need an activity to help you with stress.
text: Ngabhala u “Usizo” uma udinga ozokwenza ukubhekana nengcindezi.

SourceText: Praise others to make them feel appreciated and good about themselves. Simple words like, “Thank you for clearing the dinner,” or “Thank you for watching the baby” can make a big difference
text: Bancome abanye ukuze bazibone ukuthi bayathandwa futhi bazizwe kangcono. Amagama alula njengokuthi, “Ngiyabonga ukuqoqa iyafula lesidlo sakusihlwa,” noma “Ngiyabonga ukubheka ingane” kungenza umehluko omkhulu.

SourceText: Bad communication between adults in the household can have a negative impact on our children. The more we practice modeling peaceful, loving relationships for our children, the more secure and loved they will feel.
text: Ukukhulumisana okongalungile phakathi kwabantu abadala ekhaya kungaba nomthelela omubi ezinganeni zethu. Uma sizijwayeza ngokwengeziwe ukubonisa ubudlelwano obunokuthula, nothando ezinganeni zethu, ziyozizwa zivikeleke kakhulu futhi zithandwa.

SourceText: Please select another number if you want to learn more about how to support family harmony at home:
text: SIcela ukhethe enye inombolo uma ufuna ukufunda kabanzi ngokuthi lwesekelwa kanjani ubumbano lomndeni ekhaya:

SourceText: Step 3. Be a great listener
text: Isinyathelo 3. Yiba nekhono lokulalela

SourceText: Listen to others when they are talking with you. Be open and show them that you hear what they are saying. It can help to summarise what you have heard before responding: “What I hear you saying is…”
text: Lalela abanye uma bekhuluma nawe. Vuleleka futhi ubabonise ukuthi uyakuzwa abakushoyo. Kungasiza ukufingqa okuzwile ngaphambi kokuba uphendule: "Engikuzwa ukusho ukuthi...". “Engizwa ukusho wokuthi…”

SourceText: Well done for adding another skill to your Parenting Toolkit! Over the next few days, try taking a deep breath or walking away for a bit when you start getting angry at someone. Every time you find a way to resolve conflicts in a peaceful way, you increase your child's brain development. Be proud of yourself when you do it!
text: Siyakubongela ngokwengeza elinye ikhono emgodleni wakho wokuba ngumzali! Ezinsukwini ezimbalwa ezilandelayo, zama ukudonsa umoya kakhulu noma uvele usuke eduze komuntu uma uzwa ukuthi useqala ukukucasula. Njalo uma uthola indlela yokuxazulula ngokuthula ukungaboni ngasolinye, wandisa ukukhula komqondo wengane yakho.  Ziqhenye uma ukwenza lokho!

SourceText: Here are some tips that might help when your baby cries:
text: Nanka amathiphu angakusiza uma ingane yakho ikhala:

SourceText: 1. Why babies cry
text: 1. Kungani izingane zikhala

SourceText: 2. Respond as soon as you can
text: 2. Phendula ngokushesha okukhulu

SourceText: 3. Check to see why your baby is crying
text: 3. Bheka ukuze uthole ukuthi ikhalelani ingane yakho

SourceText: 4. Comfort your baby
text: 4. Yange ingane yakho

SourceText: 5. Take a break if you need it
text: 5. Phumula uma udinga ukuphumula

SourceText: 6. Be gentle and patient with yourself
text: 6. Ungazigqilazi futhi zinike isikhathi

SourceText: 7. If you think your baby is injured or sick, call or visit a clinic
text: 7. Uma ucabanga ukuthi ingane yakho ilimele noma iyagula, shayela noma uvakashele emtholampilo

SourceText: To learn more about one of these, type "1" to "7". You can also type "N" to stop this tip.
text: Ukufunda kabanzi ngokunye kwalokhu, bhala “1” kuya ku “7”. Ungabhala futhi u “N” ukumisa le thiphu.

SourceText: If your baby cries for a long time and does not stop, they might be injured or sick. You should seek medical help immediately.
text: Uma ingane yakho ikhala isikhathi eside ingathuli, kungenzeka ukuth ilimele noma iyagula. Kumele usheshe uyothola usizo lwezokwelashwa.

SourceText: Go to your baby when you hear them crying. You will not spoil your baby by picking them up. Babies who are carried and cuddled frequently, during both fussy and contented periods, may actually cry less.
text: Iya enganeni yakho uma uyizwa ikhala. Angeke uyone ingane yakho ngokuyiqukula. Izingane eziphathwayo noma ezivamise ukugonwa, noma kukubi noma kukuhle, imvamisa azitetemi.

SourceText: 1. Why do babies cry?
text: 1. Zikhalelani izingane?

SourceText: Crying is a normal part of your baby's development. Sometimes babies even have crying patterns. Crying usually increases at 2-3 weeks old and is generally highest when your baby is around 6 to 8 weeks. Often babies will start crying less around 3 to 4 months. Of course, remember that every baby is different!
text: Ukukhala kuyingxenye ejwayelekile yokukhula kwengane yakho. Kwesinye isikhathi izingane zigcina sezinezikhathi zazo zokukhala. Ukukhala kuvamise ukwanda uma ingane isinamaviki awu-2-3 ubudala kanti ikhala kakhulu uma isinamasonto awu-6 kuya ku-8.  Livame ukwehla izinga lokukhala ezinganeni uma sezinezinyanga ezingu-3 kuya ku-4. Impela kunjalo, khumbula zonke izingane azifani!

SourceText: 3.  Check to see why your baby is crying
text: 3.  Bheka ukuze uthole ukuthi ikhalelani ingane yakho

SourceText: There are lots of reasons why babies cry. It might be hunger, pain, too much going on, rough handling, feeling cold/hot, wanting contact or attention, or feeling irritable. Babies can cry when they sense tension in the room. And sometimes they cry for no reason at all!
text: Ziningi izizathu ezenza izingane zikhale. Kungenzeka ukuthi ilambile, inezinhlungu, kuningi okwenzekayo, ubambeke kabi, iyagodola/iyashiselwa, ifuna ukuthintwa noma ukunakwa noma idiniwe. Izingane ziyakhala uma zizwa ukuthi kunengcindezi endlini. Kwesinye isikhathi siyakhala ngaphandle kwesizathu!

SourceText: Please select another number if you want to learn more about what to do when your baby is crying:
text: Sicela ukhethe enye inombolo uma ufuna ukufunda kabanzi ngokuthi yini ongayenza uma ingane yakho ikhala:

SourceText: Here is a comic on coping with a colicky baby
text: Nansi indatshana yokuthi ungamelana kanjani nengane etetemayo

SourceText: Parent 1: "We should do something."
text: Umzali 1: “Kumele sense okuthile.”

SourceText: Parent 2: "Okay, I'll try feeding them."
text: Umzali 2: “Kulungile, ngizozama ukubafunza.”

SourceText: Baby: "aaaaaaaa"
text: Ingane: “aaaaaaaa”

SourceText: Parent 1:  "What is wrong with them?"
text: Umzali 1:  Yini inkinga yabo?

SourceText: Parent 2: "I don't know. It has been an hour and they are still crying. I cannot take it anymore. They are driving me crazy, I just want to shake them!"
text: Umzali 2: “Angazi. Sekuphele ihora kodwa basakhala. Ngeke ngisakwazi. Bayangihlanyisa, engathi nje ngingabaxukuza!”

SourceText: Parent 2: "I can see that this has been a stressful night for you. How about you get some sleep while I take Frankie into the other room. I will try wrapping them up in a blanket."
text: Umzali 2: “Ngiyabona ukuthi wubusuku obunengcindezi lobu kuwena. Kunganjani ukuthi uthi ukulala kancane mina ngithathe uFrankie ngiye naye kwelinye igumbi. Ngizozama ukubagoqa ngengubo.”

SourceText: Parent 1: "Thank you. I was getting so angry at myself."
text: Umzali 1: “Ngiyabonga! Bese ngizidinelwe kwamina.”

SourceText: Parent 1: "How did you manage to get them to sleep?"
text: Umzali 1: “Wenze kanjani ukuthi ubalalise?”

SourceText: Parent 2: "I think they wore themselves out but we should take them to the clinic tomorrow morning."
text: Umzali 2: “Ngiyacabanga ukuthi baze bakhathala kodwa kumele sibayise emtholampilo kusasa ekuseni.”

SourceText: Call someone for help - a family member, a friend. Sometimes just talking with someone is enough, but if you feel overwhelmed, ask someone for help. Calling for help is a sign of strength.
text: Biza omunye ozosiza – owomndeni noma umngani. Kwesinye isikhathi ukukhuluma nje nomunye umuntu kuyasiza, kodwa uma uzizwa sengathi uyehluleka, cela usizo. Ukucela usizo kuwuphawu lwamandla.

SourceText: Here's a video that might help you when @fields.child_nickname cries.
text: Nansi i-video engakusiza uma u@fields.child_nickname ekhala
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Here's a video that might help you when your baby cries.

SourceText: Here's an audio message to help you when your baby cries.

SourceText: 5. Take a break!
text: 5. Hlaba ikhefu.

SourceText: If you are getting angry because @fields.child_nickname won’t stop crying, it’s OK to leave them on their back in a safe place and walk away for a bit. Check on @fields.child_nickname every 5-10 minutes.
text: Uma udinwa ngoba u@fields.child_nickname akayeki ukukhala, kulungile ukumshiya elele ngomhlane endaweni ephephile uthi ukuqhela kuye kancane.  Mbheke njalo u@fields.child_nickname emuva kwemizuzu engu-5 – 10 .
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: If you are getting angry because your baby won’t stop crying, it’s OK to leave them on their back in a safe place and walk away for a bit. Check on your baby every 5-10 minutes.
text: Uma udinwa ngoba ingane yakho ayiyeki ukukhala, kulungile ukuyishiya ilele ngomhlane endaweni ephephile uthi ukuqhela kuyo kancane.  Bheka ingane yakho njalo emuva kwemizuzu engu-5 – 10.

SourceText: We know that this is not easy. You are not a bad father if your baby continues to cry after you have done all you can to calm them. You are doing your best!
text: Siyazi ukuthi akulula. Awusiyena ubaba omubi uma ingane yakho iqhubeka ikhala noma ngabe usukwenzile konke okokuyithulisa. Wenza okusemandleni!

SourceText: Try swaddling, gently rocking, or singing or soft music. You might need to feed @fields.child_nickname or change their diaper. They may be too hot or too cold. Or maybe they just need to be held. Take a Pause and try to relax - @fields.child_nickname can actually sense tension from you, too!
text: Zama ukwenza imisindo, ukubhamba kancane, ukucula noma umculo opholile. Kungadingeka ukuba umfunze u@fields.child_nickname noma umshintshe inabukeni. Mhlawumbe uyashiselwa noma uyagodola. Noma mhlawumbe udinga ukubanjwa. Phumula kancane uthambise umzimba – u@fields.child_nickname mhlawumbe uyakuzwa ukuthi unengcindezi!
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Try swaddling, gently rocking, or singing or soft music. You might need to feed your baby or change their diaper. They may be too hot or too cold. Or maybe they just need to be held. Take a Pause and try to relax - your baby can actually sense tension from you, too!
text:
Zama ukwenza imisindo, ukubhamba kancane, ukucula noma umculo opholile. Kungenzeka ukuthi udinga ukufunza ingane yakho noma ukuyishintsha inabukeni.
 Mhlawumbe uyashiselwa noma uyagodola. Noma mhlawumbe udinga ukubanjwa. Yima kancane uzame ukuthambisa igazi - ingane yakho iyezwa uma unengcindezi nawe!

SourceText: Today's Tip is about how we can support our children when they are feeling sad, scared, angry, and confused.
text: IThiphu yanamuhla ingokuthi sizeseka kanjani izingane zethu uma sidangele, zethukile, zidiniwe, futhi zididekile.

SourceText: Remember that you can also change the type of messages you receive for an older or younger child. Just select "Tech Support". Chat to you later @fields.user_name!
text:
Khumbula ukuthi ungashintsha futhi nendlela owemukela ngayo enganeni ekhulile nasenganeni encane. Khetha u “Tech Support”.
 Siyobuye sikhulume @fields.user_name!
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Remember that you can also change the type of messages you receive for an older or younger child. Just select "Tech Support". Chat to you later!
text:
Khumbula ukuthi ungashintsha futhi nendlela owemukela ngayo enganeni ekhulile nasenganeni encane. Khetha u “Tech Support”.
 Sobuye sikhulume!

SourceText: Be open to your children. They get stressed too - sometimes from different things from you. Allow them to express how they feel and accept their feelings. Try to listen to them and think about how it must feel for them.
text:
Vuleleka ezinganeni zakho.
 Nazo ziyaba nengcindezi - ngesinye isikhathi ngenxa yezinto ezehlukile ukunezakho.
 Bavumele baveze ukuthi bazizwa kanjani futhi wamukele imizwa yabo.
 Zama ukubalalela bese ucabanga ukuthi ngabe bazizwa kanjani.

SourceText: Here are some tips for how we can help our children learn how to cope with their emotions:
text: Nanka amathiphu okuthi singazisiza kanjani izingane zethu zifunde ukubhekana nemizwa yazo:

SourceText: 1. Be open to your child
text: 1. Vuleleka enganeni yakho.

SourceText: 2. Share your own feelings
text: 2. Yitshele ngeyakho imizwa.

SourceText: 3. Help your child learn how to talk about feelings
text: 3. Siza ingane yakho ikwazi ukukhuluma ngemizwa.

SourceText: 4. Talking about difficult emotions
text: 4. Khuluma ngemizwa enzima.

SourceText: 5. Notice the positive emotions
text: 5. Yisho futhi nemizwa emnandi.

SourceText: 6. Show your child that you care
text: 6. Khombisa ingane yakho ukuthi unendaba.

SourceText: To learn more about one of these, type "1" to "6". You can also type "N" to stop this tip.
text:
Ukufunda kabanzi ngokunye kwalokhu, bhala u “1” kuya ku “6” 
 Ungabhala futhi u “N” ukumisa le thiphu.

SourceText: Your child will look to you for support and reassurance. Listen to your children when they share how they are feeling. Accept how they feel and give them comfort.
text:
Lalela ingane yakho uma ikutshela ukuthi izizwa kanjani.
 Yamukela ukuthi izizwa kanjani bese uyayisingatha.
 Yamukela ukuthi izizwa kanjani bese uyayisingatha.

SourceText: When you share your own feelings with your children, you help them recognise their own feelings. It can also help your children learn self-discipline and to understand their own feelings.
text:
Uma utshela ingane yakho ngemizwa yakho, uyenza ukuba iyazi nayo imizwa yayo.
 Kungazisiza futhi izingane zakho ukufunda ukuziphatha nokuqonda imizwa yazo.

SourceText: There are 6 basic emotions: Happy, Sad, Angry, Disgusted, Surprised, and Afraid. Even babies can feel and express these emotions. As children get older, they learn to identify lots of other emotions, like excited, frustrated, proud, lonely, peaceful, guilty, or confused.
text:
Nayi imizwa evamile eyisithupha:
 Injabulo, Ukudumala, Ukudinwa, Ukwenyanya, Ukumangala, noKwethuka.
 Ngisho izingane ezincane ziyakwazi ukuzwa noma ukuveza le mizwa.
 Uma izingane zikhula, ziyafunda ukuhlionza eminye imizwa, njengokwesasa, ukucikeka, ukuziqhenya, umzwangedwa, ukuthula, ukuzisola, noma ukudideka.

SourceText: It is normal to have difficulty talking about and expressing emotions and feelings. Many of us were told not to cry when we were sad or laugh when we were happy. This may be especially the case for boys and men.
text:
Kuvamile ukuthi kube nzima ukukhuluma nokuveza imizwa yakho. 
 Abaningi bethu babetshelwa ukuthi bangakhali uma bedumele noma ukuhleka uma bejabule. 
 Lokhu kuvame kakhulu ebafaneni nasemadodeni.

SourceText: But we all have the same feelings, and  we can learn how to become aware of our own emotions, to experience them in our body, and to communicate about them.
text: Kodwa sonke sinemizwa efanayo, futhi singafunda ukuthi zingayibona kanjani imizwa ayethu, ukuyizwa emzimbeni, nokukhuluma ngayo.

SourceText: Talking about feelings can help children manage anger, disappointment, and frustration. It can also help @fields.child_nickname be more aware of positive emotions such as a sense of peace, happiness, or calmness. It can also allow children to appreciate a beautiful moment or feeling of love!
text:
Ukukhuluma ngemizwa kungasiza ukuba ingane yakho ikwazi ukulawula ukudinwa, ukudumala nokucikeka.
 Kungaphinde kusize u{1) ukuba akwazi ukuqaphela imizwa emihle njengomuzwa wokuthula, injabulo nokwehlisa umoya.
 Kungaphinde kuvumele izingane ukujabulela isikhathi esihle somuzwa wothando.

text:

SourceText: Use physical and verbal support to make @fields.child_nickname feel accepted and loved. A hug or saying, "I understand," can mean a lot. Remind @fields.child_nickname that you are there for them and that they can always talk to you.

text:

SourceText: Here is a comic that shows how you can give @fields.child_nickname love and support when they share difficult emotions with you…
text: Nansi indatshana ekhombisa ukuthi ungamnika kanjani u @fields.child_nickname uthando nokwesekwa uma bekuxoxela ngemizwa ebuhlungu abanayo…
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Parent: “How are you doing, Andy?”
text: Umzali: “Unjani Andy?”

SourceText: Teen (looking sad): “I wish I could hang out with my friends.”
text:
Ingane esikhulile (ibukeka idumele):
 “Ngifisa sengathi ngingahlala nabangani bami.”

SourceText: Parent (thinking): "Hmmm…that can wait…"
text:
Umzali (ecabanga):
 “Hmmm… lokho kungalinda…”

SourceText: Parent (looks back to teen):“I understand it is hard to be separate from your friends. Especially since I am sure they are missing you, too. Let’s think of some ways that you could reach out to them.”
text:
Umzali (ebuka inganyana): “Ngiyazi kunzima ukuqhelelana nabangani bakho.
 Ikakhulukazi ngoba ngiyazi ukuthi nabo bayakukhumbula.
 Ake sicabange izindlela ongabonana nabo ngazo.”

SourceText: Teen: "Maybe I can make a TikTok video to share with them. But I am not sure how…can you help me?”
text:
Ingane esikhulile: “Mhlawumbe ngingenza i-video kaTikTok ozobakhombisa yona.
 Kodwa angazi yenziwa kanjani… ungangisiza?”

SourceText: Parent: “I would be happy to help and would like to know more about TikTok, too!”
text: Umzali: “Ngingajabula ukukusiza futhi nami ngiyafuna ukwazi kabanzi ngeTikTok!”

SourceText: Here is a comic that shows how you can give your teen love and support when they share difficult emotions with you…
text: Nansi indatshana ekukhombisa ukuthi ungayinika kanjani inganyana yakho uthando nokwesekwa uma ikuxoxela izindaba ezibuhlungu…

SourceText: Child: “Why can’t I go play with my friends today?”
text: Ingane: “Kungani ngingayi ukuyodlala nabangani bami namuhla?”

SourceText: Parent: “I can see that you are upset, Sam. It can be difficult when we feel separated from our friends.”
text:
Umzali: “Ngiyabona ukuthi udiniwe, Sam.
 Kuba nzima uma kwenzeka sihlukana nabangani bethu.”

SourceText: Parent: “We are not allowed to visit other people right now because of COVID-19.
text: Umzali: “Kasivunyelwe ukuvakashela abanye abantu manje ngenxa yeCOVID-19.

SourceText: This will keep them and us safe while making sure our health services are able to support those who are sick."
text: Lokhu kuzokwenza ukuthi baphephe nathi siphephe ukuze izinsiza zezempilo zizokwazi ukusiza labo abagulayo.”

SourceText: Parent: “As soon as we are able, you can play with your friends. In the meantime, we can draw some pictures of your favourite times playing with them.”
text:
Umzali: “Uma sesikwazi, uzokwazi ukuyodlala nabangani bakho.
 Okwamanje, singadweba izithombe ngezikhathi ezimnandi owazichitha udlala nabo.”

SourceText: Child: “Okay!”
text: Ingane: “Kulungile, !”

SourceText: Here is a comic that shows how you can give your child love and support when they share difficult emotions with you…
text: Nansi indatshana ekhombisa ukuthi ungayinika kanjani ingane yakho uthando nokwesekwa uma ikuvezela imizwa ebuhlungu…

SourceText: Here are 6 steps on how we can reduce negative attention seeking and demanding behaviours like tantrums using what we call Ignore:
text: Nazi izinyathelo eziyisithupha zokuthi singanciphisa kanjani ukuziphatha okungekuhle kokufuna ukubukwa nokunenkani njengokweyisa sisebenzisa lokhu esikubiza ngokuziba:

SourceText: 1. Try to redirect your child’s attention
text: 1. Zama ukushintsha lokho ingane egxile kukho.

SourceText: 2. Make sure it is a behaviour you can ignore
text: 2. Qinisekisa ukuthi wukuziphatha ongakuziba.

SourceText: 3. Ignore the behaviour not your child
text: 3. Qinisekisa ukuthi wukuziphatha ongakuziba.

SourceText: 4. Praise your child immediately for the next positive behaviour
text: 4. Ncoma ingane yakho ngokushesha uma iziphatha ngendlela enhle.

SourceText: 5. Be consistent when ignoring
text: 5. Ungashintshi uma uyiziba.

SourceText: 6. Make sure you are giving your child plenty of positive attention at other times.
text: 6. Qinisekisa ukuthi ingane yakho uyinika izinto eziningi ezinhle engagxila kuzona.

SourceText: To learn more about one of these tips, type "1" to "6". You can also type "N" to move on.
text:
Ukufunda kabanzi ngenye yalawa mathiphu, bhala u “1” kuya ku “6”
 Ungaphinde ubhale “N” ukuqhubekela phambili.

SourceText: Here is a comic on combining consequences and ignore.
text: Nansi indatshana yokuhlanganisa isijeziso nokuziba.

SourceText: Parent 1: "Bailey, please clear the dishes after dinner"
text: Umzali 1: “Bailey, ngicela ususe isitsha emuva kwesidlo sakusihlwa.”

SourceText: Parent 2: "Sam, time to get ready for bed. Come with me."
text:
Umzali 2: “Sam, yisikhathi sokulungela ukuyolala.
 Woza sihambe.”

SourceText: Parent: "The household rule is that you have to help clean up after dinner before you can play with your toys."
text: Umzali: “Umthetho walapha ekhaya uthi kumele usize ukuqoqa emuva kwesidlo sakusihlwa ngaphambi kokuyodlala amathoyizi akho.”

SourceText: Child: "I don't want to clear the dishes. I want to play with my new toy car. "
text:
Ingane: “Angifuni ukuqoqa izitsha.
 Ngifuna ukudlala ithoyizi lami elisha lemoto.”

SourceText: Parent 1: "Bailey, either you clear the table now, or you will not be able to play with your toys later tonight"
text: Umzali 1: “Bailey, uma ungaliqoqi itafula manje, angeke ukwazi ukuyodlala ithoyizi lakho makhathaleni namuhla”

SourceText: Child: "But it is not fair! Sam doesn't have to clean up after dinner!"
text:
Ingane: “Kodwa lokho akunabulungiswa!
 USam yena akatshelwa kuthi aqoqe emuva kwesidlo sakusihlwa!”

SourceText: Parent 1: "Because you did not listen, you cannot play with your toys. Please get ready for bed.
text:
Umzali 1: “Ngoba awulaleli, angeke uwadlale amathoyizi akho.
 Ngicela ulungele ukuyolala.

SourceText: Child: "But that is not fair!"
text: Ingane: “Kodwa lokho akunabulungiswa!”

SourceText: Child: "But that is not fair. Waaaah!"
text:
Ingane: “Kodwa lokho akunabulungiswa!”
 Waaaaahh!”

SourceText: Parent 1: "It is so nice to see that you got ready for bed all by yourself!"
text: Umzali 1: “Kuhle ukubona ukuthi ukwazile ukuzilungiselela wena ukuyolala!”

SourceText: Child: "Now can I play with my toy car?"
text: Ingane: “Manje ke sengingadlala ngethoyizi lami lemoto.”

SourceText: Parent 1: "You can play with your car tomorrow. It is bedtime. Come, my sweetie, I will tell your favourite bedtime story."
text:
Umzali 1: “Uzodlala ngethoyizi lakho lemoto kusasa.
 “Yisikhathi sokulala.
 Woza ngane yami ngizokuxoxela inganekwane emnandi.”

SourceText: Parent 1: "Once upon a time..."
text: Umzali 1: “Kwasukasukela…”

SourceText: 1. Try to redirect your child's attention
text: 1. Zama ukuguqula umqondo wengane yakho.

SourceText: When they start demanding for something or whining, first try to redirect them to a positive behaviour or activity. Praise them for that positive behaviour!
text:
Uma beqala ukufuna ngenkani izinto noma betetema, kuqala zama ukubanakisa enye into enhle noma isenzo esihle.
 Bancome uma beziphatha kahle!

SourceText: These are behaviours like whining, demanding, showing off, tantrums, and lots of other negative attention seeking and demanding behaviours that might make us think of the child as a bad child. But there are no bad children, only difficult behaviours!
text:
Lokhu kuziphatha okufana nokutetema, ukufuna ngenkani, ukuchoma, ukuhlupha, nezinye izinto ezingezinhle ezifuna ukubukwa nokufuna ngenkani okungenza ukuthi ingane siyibone njengengane embi.
 Kodwa azikho izingane ezimbi, kuphela ukuziphatha okungekuhle!

SourceText: When you ignore your child's behaviour (but not your child!), your child learns that the demanding behaviour will not work.
text: Uma uziziba izenzo ezingezinhle zengane yakho, (kodwa hhayi ingane yakho)), ingane yakho ifunda ukuthi ukufuna ngenkani izinto angeke kuyisebenzele.

SourceText: If we respond to these behaviours, our children learn that this behaviour will get them attention. They sometimes also learn that if they increase the demand, they will get their way.
text:
Uma siphendula kulezi zenzo, izingane zethu zifunda uma ziqhubeka kakhulu nalokho kuziphatha, sizozinaka.
 Ngesinye isikhathi zibuye zifunde ukuthi uma zenyusa izinga, zizophumelela.

SourceText: This takes time AND patience. Normally your child will try to test you and behave worse. This is a good time to Take a Pause and Keep Calm.
text:
Lokhu kuthatha isikhathi nokubekezela.
 Imvamisa ingane yakho izozama ukukuvivinya iziphathe ngendlela embi kakhulu.
 Lesi yisikhathi esihle sokuma kancane wehlise umoya.

SourceText: 6. Make sure you are giving your child plenty of positive attention at other times
text: 6. Qinisekisa ukuthi ingane yakho uyinaka kakhulu ngezinye izikhathi.

SourceText: Children need attention. If children get plenty of attention for just being themselves, as well as for the “good” things that they do, it helps them to feel good about themselves, and they do more of what they are asked.
text:
Izingane zifuna ukunakwa.
 Uma izingane zithola ukunakwa okukhulu ngokuba yizona nje, nangezinto “ezinhle” ezizenzayo, kuyasiza lokho ekutheni zizijabulele, futhi zenze okungaphezulu kwalokho eziyalelwa khona.

SourceText: Your child's behaviour might continue to get worse.  It is important that you continue to ignore the behaviour.
text:
Ukuziphatha kwengane yakho kungaqhubeka nokuba kubi kakhulu.
  Kubalulekile ukuthi uqhubeke nokuziba ukuziphatha okungekuhle.

SourceText: Often, your child's response will grow more agitated when you start ignoring a specific behaviour as your child tries to test your resolve.
text: Imvamisa, ingane yakho izophendula ngokudinwa kakhulu uma uqala uziba ukuziphatha kwayo okuthile njengoba ingane yakho isuke ikuhlola ukuthi wenzani.

SourceText: If you find yourself ignoring your child's behaviour a lot, it is either because you are not being consistent (sometimes ignoring and sometimes giving in) OR you are not spending enough positive time with your child. One-on-One Time is super important!
text:
Uma uzithola uziba ukuziphatha kwengane yakho isikhathi esiningi, kungenzeka ukuba awenzi izinto ngendlela eyodwa (ngesinye isikhathi uyaziba ngesinye isikhathi wehlukele) noma kungenzeka ukuthi awuchithi isikhathi esiningi esimnandi nengane yakho.
 Isikhathi senu nobabili sibaluleke kakhulu!

SourceText: Please select another number if you want to learn more about how to use ignore to reduce tantrums or other difficult behaviours:
text: Sicela ukhethe enye inombolo uma ufuna ukufunda kabanzi ngokuthi ungakusebenzisa kanjani ukuziba ukunciphisa ukuhlupha noma okunye ukuziphatha okungekuhle:

SourceText: Ignore negative attention seeking and demanding behaviours like whining or tantrums. Your @fields.child_nickname’s behaviour might at first get worse, but with time they will learn that it does not work. Be consistent and patient. And make sure that you are also giving @fields.child_nickname plenty of positive attention at other times. You can do it!
text:
Kuzibe ukungaziphathi kahle kwengane yakho njengokutetema nokuziginqa phansi. Ukuziphatha kabi kwengane yakho kungaqala ngokuba kubi kakhulu kodwa ngokuhamba kwesikhathi izobona ukuthi akusebenzi. Ungashintshi futhi ubeke umoya phansi. Qinisekisa futhi ukuthi ingane yakho uyayinaka kahle ngezinye izikhathi.
 Ungakwazi ukukwenza lokhu.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Ignore negative attention seeking and demanding behaviours like whining or tantrums. Your child’s behaviour might at first get worse, but with time they will learn that it does not work. Be consistent and patient. And make sure that you are also giving your child plenty of positive attention at other times. You can do it!
text:
Kuzibe ukungaziphathi kahle kwengane yakho njengokutetema nokuziginqa phansi. Ukuziphatha kuka kwengane yakho kungaqala ngokuba kubi kakhulu kodwa ngokuhamba kwesikhathi izobona ukuthi akusebenzi.
 Ungashintshi futhi ubeke umoya phansi. Qinisekisa futhi ukuthi ingane yakho uyayinaka kahle ngezinye izikhathi.
 Ungakwazi ukukwenza lokhu.

text:

SourceText: Today's Parenting Tip is all about Praise. How did the above message make you feel? We all appreciate it when the good things we do are recognised by others, especially when it is someone who is close to us.
text:
Ithiphu yanamuhla Yokuba Ngumzali ikhuluma Ngokuncoma

 Sonke siyajabula uma izinto ezinhle esizenzayo zinconywa ngabanye abantu, ikakhulukazi uma kungumuntu osondelene naye.

SourceText: Praise your children when they are behaving well! They may not show it but you’ll see them doing that good behaviour again…

SourceText: Keep it positive! Make sure your children get lots of praise when they are behaving well. This will make them want to behave that way more often.
text:
Yiba nethemba!
 Qinisekisa ukuthi izingane zakho zithola izincomo eziningi uma ziziphatha kahle.
 Lokhu kungazenza sufune ukwenza kahle futhi.

SourceText: We all appreciate it when the good things we do are recognised by others, especially when it is someone who is close to us.
text: Sonke siyajabula uma izinto ezinhle esizenzayo zinconywa ngabanye abantu, ikakhulukazi uma kungumuntu osondelene naye.

SourceText: Praise works for our children, too. When you bring more attention to positive behaviour, they are likely to do it more often. They also will feel good about themselves!
text:

 Uma ukunaka ukuziphatha kwabo okuhle, bazojwayela ukukwenza.
 Bazozizwa kahle futhi ngabo.

SourceText: Challenges are stressful. But problem-solving can really help. There are 6 basic steps for problem solving:
text:
Izinselelo ziphathisa ngengcindezi.
 Ikhono lokuxazulula izinkinga lingaba wusizo.
 Ziyisithupha izinyathelo esicacile sokuxazulula izinkinga:

SourceText: 1. Identify the problem
text: 1. Ibone inkinga.

SourceText: 2. Think of possible solutions
text: 2. Ukucabanga izixazululo ezikhona

SourceText: 3. Figure out what the results of each solution would be
text: 3. Ukubheka umphumela wesixazululo ngasinye

SourceText: 4. Choose one solution
text: 4. Ukukhetha isixazululo esisodwa

SourceText: 5. Try it out!
text: 5. Ukusizama

SourceText: 6. Did it work? Great! If it did not work, then try another solution
text: 6. Ingabe sisebenzile? Kuhle! Uma singasebenzanga, zama esinye isixazululo.

SourceText: We can also teach our children the same steps.
text: Singazifundisa futhi izingane zethu lezo zinyathelo ezifanayo.

SourceText: When something bad happens, we often get upset and blame our children. But what they really need is someone to help them work through their problems.
text: Uma kwenzeka okuthile okubi, ngokuvamile siphatheka kabi bese siyagxeka. Kodwa ezikudinga ngempela wumuntu ozozisiza zikwazi ukuxazulula izinkinga zazo.

SourceText: Take a Pause! Become aware of anger and stress. Take a deep breath or count to 10 before you react. Then respond in a calmer way.
text:
Yima kancane Qaphela ukudinwa nengcindezi.
 Donsa kakhulu umoya bese ubala kawu-10 ngaphambi kokuphendula.
 Phendula ngendlela enomoya ophansi.

SourceText: Help @fields.child_nickname learn how to solve problems. As children get older, they become more independent and sometimes push the boundaries that we create to keep them safe.
text:

 Esikhathini esizayo uma ingane yakho ibhekana nenselelo, zama ukwehlisa umoya bese nibhekana nenselelo ndawonye.
 Ukusiza ingane yakho ifunde ukuthi ixazululwa kanjani inkinga yinto ezophila nayo impilo yayo yonke.
 Yeka isipho esihle kangaka!

SourceText: Stop it before it starts! When your children get restless, you can distract them with something interesting or fun: "Come, let's play a game together!"
text:
Yinqande ingakaqali!
 Uma izingane zakho zingakhululekile, ungaziphazamisa ngokwenza into emnandi noma ehlekilsayo:
 “Woza sidlale umdlalo ndawonye!”

SourceText: Try to redirect. Stop it before it starts! When your children get restless, you can distract them with something interesting or fun: "Come, let's play a game together!"
text:
Zama ukuyishintsha umqondo.
 Yinqande ingakaqali!
 Uma izingane zakho zingakhululekile, ungaziphazamisa ngokwenza into emnandi noma ehlekilsayo:
 “Woza sidlale umdlalo ndawonye!”

SourceText: If your baby is starting to crawl or walk, you can also redirect them by physically picking them up and focusing their attention on something else interesting. Use a lively and cheerful voice!
text:
Uma ingane yakho iqala ukukhasa noma ukuhamba, ungayididisa ngokuthi uyiqukule bese uyenza inake enye into eyikhonzile.
 Sebenzisa izwi eligqamile nelincomayo!

SourceText: Here is a comic that shows how you can use redirect!
text: Nansi indatshana ekhombisa ukuthi ungayididisa kanjani ingane yakho!

SourceText: Child: “Give it to me!”
text: Ingane: “Yilethe la!”

SourceText: Teen: “I had it first!”
text: Ingane esikhulile: “Ngiyithole kuqala!”

SourceText: Parent: “Cameron and Billy, come and help me prepare dinner. We are making your favourite dish!”
text:
Umzali: “Cameron noBilly, wozani nizongisiza silungise ukudla.
 Senza ukudla kwenu enikukhonzile!”

SourceText: Parent: “Thank you for helping me get these veggies clean for our dinner tonight!”
text: Umzali: “Ngiyabonga ukungisiza ukugeza lezi ziqathe esizopheka ngazo ukudla kwakusihlwa!”

SourceText: Keep it positive. It is normal to want to say something about @fields.child_nickname's negative behaviour, like “Don’t whine,” or “Stop running in the house.” Instead, just say something that you want @fields.child_nickname to do, like "Speak with a calm voice," or "Remember to walk inside the house."

 Kuyinto ejwayelekile ukusho okuthile ngokuhlupha kuka @fields.child_nickname, njengokuthi “Musa ukutetema,” noma “Yeka ukugijima endlini.”
 Esikhundleni salokho yisho into ofuna u @fields.child_nickname ayenze, njengokuthi “Khulumela phansi,” noma “Ungakhohlwa wukuthi endlini kuyahanjwa.”

SourceText: Keep it positive. It is normal to want to say something about your child's negative behaviour, like “Don’t whine,” or “Stop running in the house.” Instead, just say something that you want your child to do, like "Speak with a calm voice," or "Remember to walk inside the house."

SourceText: COVID-19 has interrupted our daily work, home and school routines. This is hard for children, teenagers and for you. Making new routines can help.
text:
I-COVID-19 iphazamise imisebenzi yethu yansuku zonke, ekhaya nasesikoleni.
 Lokhu kunzima ezinganeni ezincane, esezikhulile nakuwena imbala.
 Ukwenza uhlelo olusha lokuzokwenziwa kungasiza.

SourceText: We are now spending a lot more time online. Being connected helps us stay positive…but it also presents risks and dangers.
text:
Njengamanje sichitha isikhathi esiningi kwi-inthanethi.
 Ukuxhumana nabantu kuyasisiza ukuthi sihlale sinethemba… kodwa futhi kuza nengozi nengcuphe.

SourceText: Here's a video to help you keep yourself safe online.
text: Nansi i-video ezokusiza ukuba uhlale uphephile kwi-inthanethi.

SourceText: Here's an audio message to help you keep yourself safe online.
text: Nanku umyalezo oqoshiwe osokusiza uhlale uphephile kwi-inthanethi.

SourceText: Here are 5 tips that can help you keep yourself safe online:
text: Nawa amathiphu awu-5 azokusiza ukuba uhlale uphephile kwi—inthanethi:

SourceText: 1. Learn about the risks and dangers
text: 1. Funda ngengcuphe nobungozi

SourceText: 2. Quick tech fixes
text: 2. Izindlela zokulungisa ezisheshayo

SourceText: 3. Create healthy and safe online habits
text: 3. Yiba nomkhuba ophephille futhi omuhle wokusebenzisa i-inthanethi.

SourceText: 4. Maintain privacy
text: 4. Gcina ulwazi ngawe luyimfihlo

SourceText: 5. Report and seek help
text: 5. Bika futhi ufune usizo

SourceText: To learn more about one of these, type "1" to "5". You can also type "N" to stop this tip.
text:
Ukufunda kabanzi ngenye yalezi zindlela, bhala u “1” kuya ku “5”.
 Ungabhala futhi u “N” ukumisa le thiphu.

SourceText: 1. Learn about risks and dangers
text: 1. Funda ngobungozi nengcuphe

SourceText: Keep personal information private, especially from strangers. – some people are not who they say they are!
text: Gcina ulwazi ngawe luyimfihlo, ikakhulukazi kubantu ongabazi. - abanye abantu kabayona le nto abaziveza seengathi bayiyona!

SourceText: 2. Quick tech fixes:
text: 2. Izindlela zokulungisa ezisheshayo:

SourceText: 3. Create healthy and safe online habits:
text: 3. Yiba nomkhuba ophephille futhi omuhle wokusebenzisa i-inthanethi.

SourceText: You can also create healthy and safe online habits like creating device-free spaces and times in your house (eating, playing, schoolwork, and sleeping).
text: Ungakwazi futhi ukuqala imiikhuba emihle futhi ephephile yokusebenzisa i-inthanethi njengokuthi kube nezindawo lapho engasetshenziswa khona amadivayisi ubeke nezikhathi emzini wakho (esokudla, ukudlala, umsebenzi wesikole nokulala).

SourceText: Remember that what goes online stays online (messages, photos, and videos).
text: Khumbula ukuthi ukungena kwi-inthanethi kuhlala kwi-inthanethi (imiyaleyo, yizithombe nama-video).

SourceText: Please select another number if you want to learn another way to protect yourself online:
text: Sicela ukhethe inombolo uma usafuna ukufunda kabanzi ngenye indlela yokuzivikela kwi-inthanethi.

SourceText: Here's a video to take you through the shared book reading activity!

SourceText: Here's an audio message that takes you through the shared book reading activity!
text: Nanku umyalezo oqoshiwe ozokufundisa ngokufunda nengane yakho!

SourceText: Here are some tips for sharing books with your child:
text: Nanka amathiphu okwabelana ngencwadi nengane yakho:

SourceText: 1. Follow your child's interest
text: 1. Landela lokho okuthandwa yingane yakho

SourceText: 2. Use a lifely voice
text: 2. Sebenzisa izwi elicacile

SourceText: 3. Pointing and naming
text: 3. Khomba ubize amagama

SourceText: 4. Be positive and supportive
text: 4. Yeseke futhi uyilekelele

SourceText: 5. Making actions and links
text: 5. Yenza izenzo uqondanise

SourceText: 6. Talking about feelings
text: 6. Khuluma ngemizwa

SourceText: 7. Babies and books go well together
text: 7. Izingane ziyezwana nezincwadi

SourceText: 2. Use a lively voice
text: 2. Sebenzisa izwi eligqamile

SourceText: Speak with a lively or animated voice. This will help to keep the child’s attention on the book.
text: Khuluma kucace noma ulingise. Lokhu kuzosiza ingane yakho igxile encwadini.

SourceText: 7. Babies and Books!
text: 7. Izingane ezincane nezincwadi!

SourceText: Even very young babies enjoy book-sharing and looking at the pictures together with a parent or caregiver. In fact, regular book-sharing helps their development and learning. And it is okay for them to put the book in their mouth - they are exploring!
text: Ngisho izinganeni ezincane ziyathanda ukufundelwa incwadi nokubuka nazo izithombe njengabazali nababheki bazo. Empeleni, ukujwayela ukufunda nabo izincwadi kuyabakhulisa futhi bayafunda. Kulungile futhi ukuthi bafake incwadi emlonyeni – bazama izinto ezintsha!

SourceText: Here are some examples!
text: Nazi ezinye izibonelo!

SourceText: “Look, she is smiling. Why do you think she is smiling? What made you smile today?”
text: “Buka, uyamoyizela. Ucabanga ukuthi kungani emoyizela? Yini ekumoyizelisile namuhla?”

SourceText: “The monkey is sad because he is all on his own. Can you remember when you were last sad?”
text: “Inkawu idumele ngoba iyodwana. Uyakhuluma ukuthi wagcina nini ukudinwa?”

SourceText: “That tiger looks angry. Why do you think he is angry? Do you remember when I got angry this morning?”
text: “Leya ngwe ibukeka idiniwe. Ucabanga ukuthi idinwe yini? Uyakhumbula ngesikhathi ngidiniwe ekuseni namuhla?

You can use what is happening in the book to talk about your child’s own feelings, and why other people might feel a certain way.
