SourceText: Millions of families are struggling to make ends meet. When money is tight, this can make us feel anxious, stressed, and sad. How we understand and talk about money with our children is important. Our children can also help us to spend and save in ways that will benefit the family.

SourceText: Millions of families are struggling to make ends meet. When money is tight, this can make us feel anxious, stressed, and sad. How we understand and talk about money is important. We can also learn about how we can save in ways that will benefit the family.
text: Izigidi zemindeni zithwele kanzima. Uma kubheda ezimalini, lokhu kungabenza badinwe, babe nengcindezi noma badumale. Ukuthi sikhuluma futhi siyiqonda kanjani indaba yemali kubalulekile. Zingafunda futhi ukuthi songa kanjani ngendlela ezohlomulisa umndeni.

SourceText: Here's a video to help you make a budget and save money together as a family.
text: Nansi i-video ezokusiza ukuhlela izimali nokonga imali ngokubambisana njengomndeni.

SourceText: Here's an audio message to help you make a budget and save money together as a family.
text: Nanku umyalezo oqoshiwe ozokusiza ukuhlela izimali nokonga ngokubambisana njengomndeni.

SourceText: Making a budget.
text: Ukwenza isabelomali.

SourceText: A budget is how we decide what we will spend our money on, even in stressful times. Making a budget can help you have enough at the end of the month so that you need to borrow less.
text: Isabelomali yindlela esinquma ukuthi sizoyisebenziselani imali yethu, nangezikhathi ezinzima. Ukwenza isabelomali kungenza ukuthi ube neyanele ekupheleni kwenyanga bese ungaboleki kakhulu.

SourceText: Do you want 4 quick steps to help you make a budget and save money?
text: Uyazidinga izinyathelo ezine ezisheshayo ezingakusiza ukwenza isabelomali futhi wonge imali?

SourceText: Step 1: What do we spend on now?
text: Isinyathelo 1: Siyisebenzisa kuphi imali njengamanje?

SourceText: • Get a piece of paper (or old newspaper or a cardboard box) and a pen.
text: Thola isiqeshana sephepha (noma iphephandaba elidala noma ikhadibhodi) kanye nepeni.

SourceText: • Draw pictures of all the things that you and your family spend money on each month.
text: Dweba izithombe zazo zonke izinto wena nomndeni wakho enichitha imali kuzo ngenyanga.

SourceText: • Write next to each picture how much each thing costs.
text: Bhala eceleni kwesithombe ngasinye ukuthi into ngayinye ibiza malini.

SourceText: • Add up how much money you have to spend each month.
text: Hlanganisa inani lemali enilisebenzisayo ngenyanga.

SourceText: Do you want to receive Step 2?
text: Uyafuna ukuthola isinyathelo 2?

SourceText: Step 2: Talk about needs and wants
text: Isinyathelo 2: Khulumani ngezidingo kanye nezimfuno.

SourceText: • Needs: Which things are important or must haves for your family to survive? (like food, soap to wash hands, needs for ill or disabled family members).
text: Esikudingayo: Izidingo: Yiziphi izinto ezibalulekile noma okumele nibe nazo ukuze umndeni wakho uphile? (njengokudla, insipho yokugeza izandla, izidingo zamalungu omndeni agulayo noma akhubazekile).

SourceText: • Wants: Which things are nice to have but not essential?
text: Esikuthandayo  Izimfuno: Yiziphi izinto okuhle ukuba nazo kodwa ezingabalulekile?

SourceText: Do you want to receive Step 3?
text: Uyafuna ukuthola isinyathelo 3?

SourceText: Step 3: Build your own budget
text: Isinyathelo 3: Zakhele uhlelo lokusebenzisa imali.

SourceText: • Find a bag of stones or anything with lots of bits. This is your money for the month.
text: Thola isikhwama samatshe noma okunye okuyizinhlayiya. Lena yimali yakho yenyanga.

SourceText: • As a family, decide what you will spend on what, and put the stones on your picture.
text: Njengomndeni, vumelanani ukuthi yikuphi enizokusebenzisa kuphi, bese nibeka amatshe esithombeni senu.

SourceText: • If you can save even a tiny amount for the future, or for an emergency  – it can make a big difference over time.
text: Uma ukwazi ukongela ikusasa noma izimo eziphuthumayo noma ngabe yimali encane kanjani – lokho kungenza omkhulu umehluko.

SourceText: Do you want to receive Step 4?
text: Uyafuna ukuthola isinyathelo 4?

SourceText: Step 4: Find out where you can get extra help
text: Isinyathelo 4: Thola ukuthi ungalutholaphi olunye usizo

SourceText: Your government or community groups may be giving money, vouchers, or food parcels to families in need. Ask about whether places in your community are giving support.
text: Uhulumeni wangakini noma izinhlangano zomphakathi kuyenzeka banikele ngemali, amavawusha noma amaphasela okudla emindenini eyeswele. Buza ukuthi ingabe izindawo emphakathini wakho ziyanikeza yini ukweseka.

SourceText: Well done for adding another skill to your Parenting Toolkit! Over the next few days, try following these steps to create a family budget. You can even involve your partner in the discussion. Millions of families find that learning ways to manage money as a family reduces family arguments and brings everyone together. That's real success!
text: Siyakubongela ngokwengeza elinye ikhono emgodleni wakho wokuba ngumzali! Kulezi zinsuku ezimbalwa ezizayo, zama lezi zinyathelo ezilandelayo ukwakha isabelomali somndeni. Ungabandakanya nophathina wakho engxoxweni Izigidi zemindeni zithola ukuthi ukufunda izindlela zokuphatha imali njengomndeni kuyayehlisa ingxabano ekhaya kuhlanganise umndeni. Leyo yimpumelelo yangempela!

SourceText: Well done for adding another layer to your House of Support! Over the next few days, try following these steps to create a family budget. You can even involve your partner in the discussion. Millions of families find that learning ways to manage money as a family reduces family arguments and brings everyone together. That's real success!
text: Siyabonga ngokwengeza okunye okusha emgodleni wakho wokweseka ingane ekhaya! Kulezi zinsuku ezimbalwa ezizayo, zama lezi zinyathelo ezilandelayo ukwakha isabelomali somndeni. Ungabandakanya nophathina wakho engxoxweni Izigidi zemindeni zithola ukuthi ukufunda izindlela zokuphatha imali njengomndeni kuyayehlisa ingxabano ekhaya kuhlanganise umndeni. Leyo yimpumelelo yangempela!

SourceText: Millions of families are struggling to make ends meet especially due to the COVID-19 pandemic. When money is tight, this can make us feel anxious, stressed, and sad. How we understand and talk about money with our children is important. Our children can also help us to spend and save in ways that will benefit the family.
text: Izigidi zemindeni zidonsa kanzima ikakhulukazi njengoba kuhlasele ubhubhane lweCOVID-19. Uma kubheda ezimalini, lokhu kungabenza badinwe, babe nengcindezi noma badumale. Kubalulekile ukuxoxa nokuqonda indaba yezimali nezingane zethu. Izingane zethu zingasisiza ukusebenzisa nokonga imali ngendlela ezosiza umndeni.

SourceText: Making a budget with your children and teens.
text: Ukwenza isabelomali nezingane zakho ezikhulile.

SourceText: A budget is how we decide what we will spend our money on, even in stressful times. Making a budget together helps children understand that we all need to make hard decisions in difficult times. It can also help you have enough at the end of the month so that you need to borrow less.
text: Isabelomali yindlela esinquma ukuthi sizoyisebenziselani imali yethu, nangezikhathi ezinzima. Ukwenza isabelomali ndawonye kusiza izingane ukuba ziqonde ukuthi sonke kumele sithathe izinqumo ezinzima ngezikhathi ezinzima. Kungakusiza ukuba ube nemali eyanele ekupheleni kwenyanga ukuze ungaboleki kakhulu.

SourceText: Do you want 4 quick steps to help you make a budget and save money with your children?
text: Uyazifuna izinyathelo ezine ezisheshayo ezizokusiza wenze isabelomali futhi wonge imali nomndeni wakho?

SourceText: • Discuss with your children what things you could try to spend less on as a family.
text: Xoxa nezingane zakho ukuthi yiziphi izinto eningazama ukusebenzisa imali encane kuzo njengomndeni.

SourceText: Well done for adding another skill to your Parenting Toolkit! Over the next few days, try following these steps by involving your child in creating a family budget. Millions of families find that learning ways to manage money as a family reduces family arguments and brings everyone together. That's real success!
text: Siyakubongela ngokwengeza elinye ikhono emgodleni wakho wokuba ngumzali! Kulezi zinsuku ezimbalwa ezizayo, zama lezi zinyathelo ngokufaka ingane yakho uma wakha isabelomali somndeni. Izigidi zemindeni zithola ukuthi ukufunda izindlela zokuphatha imali njengomndeni kuyayehlisa ingxabano ekhaya kuhlanganise umndeni. Leyo yimpumelelo yangempela!

SourceText: Well done for adding another layer to your House of Support! Over the next few days, try following these steps by involving your child in creating a family budget. Millions of families find that learning ways to manage money as a family reduces family arguments and brings everyone together. That's real success!
text: Siyabonga ngokwengeza okunye okusha emgodleni wakho wokweseka ingane ekhaya! Kulezi zinsuku ezimbalwa ezizayo, zama lezi zinyathelo ngokufaka ingane yakho uma wakha isabelomali somndeni. Izigidi zemindeni zithola ukuthi ukufunda izindlela zokuphatha imali njengomndeni kuyayehlisa ingxabano ekhaya kuhlanganise umndeni. Leyo yimpumelelo yangempela!

SourceText: Create routines! Your children will feel more secure and safe when they know what is expected of them and how each day will go. Make a plan with them with time for play, meals, chores, school, and sleep.
text: Qala uhlelo oluzolandelwa! Izingane zakho zizozizwa ziphephile futhi zivikelekile uma zazi ukuthi yini elindelwe kuzona nokuthi usuku ngalunye luzoma kanjani. Yenza uhlelo nazo lwezikhathi zokudlala, ukudla, imisebenzi yasendlini, isikole nokulala.

SourceText: Here's a video to help you create daily routines with your children.
text: Nansi i-video ezokusiza uqale uhlelo oluzolandelwa losuku nezingane zakho.

SourceText: Here's an audio message to help you create daily routines with your children.
text: Nanku umyalezo oqoshiwe ozokusiza uqale uhlelo losuku enizolulandela nezingane zakho.

SourceText: Daily routines, such as time for schoolwork, play, meals, and sleep, can help our children feel safe and secure. They also give our children a sense of security.
text: Uhlelo losuku olulandelwayo, njengesikhathi somsebenzi wesikole, ukudlala, ukudla, nokulala kungasiza izingane zakho zizizwe ziphephile futhi zivikelekile. Ziphinde zenze izingane zakho zizizwe ziphephile.

SourceText: Here are 4 simple tips that you can use when establishing routines with your children:
text: Nawa amathiphu amane ongawasebenzisa ukuqala uhlelo oluzolandelwa yizingane zakho:

SourceText: 1. Give one instruction at a time
text: 1. Khipha umyalelo owodwa ngesikhathi

SourceText: 2. Use transition warnings to help move from one activity to the next one
text: 2. Sebenzisa izexwayiso zokuthi sekuzoshintshwa ngaphambi kokushintshela kokunye okuzokwenziwa

SourceText: 3. Create regular eating and sleeping times
text: 3. Yiba nesikhathi esicacile sokudla nesokulala

SourceText: 4. Involve your teen in creating daily routines
text: 4. Bandakanya ingane yakho uma uhlela okuzokwenziwa ngosuku.

SourceText: To learn more about one of these tips, type "1" to 4". You can also type "N" to stop this tip.
text: Ukufunda kabanzi ngenya yalawa amathiphu, bhala “1” kuya ku “4”. Ungabhala futhi u “N” ukumisa le thiphu.

SourceText: 1. Help your younger children learn routines by taking them through the activity step by step. Give one instruction at a time. Praise them each time they follow!
text: 1. Siza izingane zakho ezincane ukufunda ngezinto ezizokwenziwa ngokubacathulisa kancane kancane. Khipha umyalelo owodwa ngesikhathi. Bancome njalo uma belandela umyalelo!

SourceText: 2. Transition warnings can also be very helpful. They give your child some time to prepare for the next activity: "In 5 minutes it will be time to pack up the toys before bedtime…"
text: 2. Ukubexwayisa uma sekushintshwa kungaba wusizo. Nika ingane yakho isikhathi sokulungiselela okunye isekuzokwenziwa: “Emizuzwini engu 5 kuzoba yisikhathi sokuqoqa amathoyizi ngaphambi kokuyolala...”

SourceText: 3. Regular eating and sleeping times are especially important for babies. Not enough sleep can make your child cranky, irritable, and short tempered.
text: 3. Isikhathin esiqondile sokudla nokulala sibalulekile ikakhulukazi ezinganeni Ukungalali ngokwanele kungenza ingane yakho iteteme, ihluphe futhi ibe nenhliziyo encane.

SourceText: Here are some tips for how to help your child prepare for bedtime:
text: Nawa amathiphu okulungiselela ingane yakho ukuba iyolala:

SourceText: • Try to have regular bedtimes each day as much as possible.
text: Zama ngayo yonke indlela ukuba nesikhathi esifanayo sokuyolala nsuku zonke.

SourceText: • Try to make it quiet and the lights in the room dim.
text: Zama ukuthi kube yisikhathi esithule namalambu akhanyele phansi egumbini.

SourceText: • Spend some time with your child. You can sing a lullaby or tell a calm story.
text: Chitha isikhathi nengane yakho. Ungayiculela umlolozelo noma ubaxoxele inganekwane.

SourceText: • Give your child a hug and kiss goodnight before leaving the room.
text: Yanga ingane yakho noma uyiqabule uvalelise ngaphambi kokuphuma egumbini.

SourceText: Please select another number if you want to learn more about creating daily routines:
text: Khetha enye inombolo uma ufuna ukufunda kabanzi nokuqala uhlelo losuku:

SourceText: 4, Involve your teen in creating daily routines
text: 4, Bandakanya ingane yakho ekwakheni uhlelo oluzolandelwa losuku

SourceText: Here are some suggestions for routines that you could establish with your children:
text: Nazi ezinye izibonelo zohlelo ongalwenza nezingane zakho:

SourceText: Bedtime
text: Isikhathi sokulala

SourceText: Schoolwork and Online Classes
text: Isikhathi somsebenzi wesikole nowamakilasi akwi-inthanethi

SourceText: Chores
text: Imisebenzi yasendlini

SourceText: Mealtime
text: Isikhathi sokudla

SourceText: Play/free time
text: Isikhathi sokudlala/sokukhululeka

SourceText: T.V. or gadget time
text: Yisikhathi seTV/semishini yokudlala

SourceText: Storytime
text: Isikhathi sokuxoxa indaba

SourceText: One-on-One Time
text: Isikhathi Sokuthi Nibe Nobabili Ndawonye

SourceText: You can add more, too! Here is a comic on creating a daily routine with your child.
text: Ungengeza okunye futhi! Nansi indatshana emayelana nokuqala uhlelo losuku nengane yakho.

SourceText: Parent: “Now let’s look at the multiplication tables…”
text: Umzali: Manje-ke ake sibheke amatebhula ezibalo zokuphindaphinda...”

SourceText: Parent: “Thank you for helping me make lunch, Junior”
text: Umzali: “Ngiyabonga ukungisiza senze ukudla kwasemini Junior”

SourceText: Child: “My favourite!”
text: Ingane: “Ngiyawuthanda!”

SourceText: Parent “And they all lived happily ever after…Goodnight, my love.”
text: Umzali “Ngemuva kwalokho bahlala kamnandi njalo njalo... Ulale kahle sithandwa sami.”

SourceText: Parent: "Thank you for being so supportive with the kids today.”
text: Umzali: “Ngiyabonga ukuba wusizo olungaka ngezingane namuhla.”

SourceText: 4. Involve @fields.child_nickname in creating daily plans. Set goals and rewards together. Let them plan when they do schoolwork and when they can relax!
text: 4. Bandakanya u @fields.child_nickname ukuqala izinhlelo zosuku. Bekani ndawonye izinjongo nemihlomulo. Bayeke bahlele ukuthi bazowenza nini umsebenzi wesikolne nokuthi bazophumula nini!
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: 4. Involve your teen in creating daily plans. Set goals and rewards together. Let them plan when they do schoolwork and when they can relax!
text: 4. Bandakanya ingane yakho ukuqala izinhlelo zosuku. Bekani ndawonye izinjongo nemihlomulo. Bayeke bahlele ukuthi bazowenza nini umsebenzi wesikolne nokuthi bazophumula nini!

SourceText: Well done @fields.user_name! You have added another skill to your Parenting Toolkit. Over the next few days, try creating at least 1 regular daily routine like having a meal together or sharing a story before bedtime. It will help your child feel secure and loved!

SourceText: I am sorry it did not go well. How did your child respond?
text: Ngiyaxolisa akuhambanga kahle. Ingane yakho iphendule kanjani?

SourceText: Being specific is not rude or insensitive, it really helps others understand you clearly and prevents confusion in the family. Emotions like anger and stress are part of our lives. All we need to do when we feel angry and stressed is know how to handle it by taking a few deep breaths before responding.
text: Ukukhuluma ngokuqondile akusho ukuba luhlaza noma ukungacabangeli, kusiza abanye bakuqonde ngendlela ecacile futhi lokhu kuvimbela ukudideka emndenini. Imizwa enjengentukuthelo nokucindezeleka iyingxenye yokuphila kwethu. Okudingeka nje sikwenze lapho sizizwa sithukuthela noma sicindezelekile ukusingatha imizwelo yethu kahle ngokudonsa umoya izikhathi ezimbalwa ngaphambi kokuba uphendule.

SourceText: It’s okay to not want to share at that time. Find some time later on when you feel calmer to explain so that everyone can understand.
text: Kulungile ukungafuni ukukhuluma ngaleso sikhathi. Thola isikhathi kamuva sokuchaza, lapho usuzizwa uzolile, ukuze wonke umuntu akwazi ukuqonda.

SourceText: Sharing emotions – especially the difficult ones – sets an important example for @fields.child_nickname! It actually makes everyone in the family stronger, because you can understand and support each other better.

SourceText: Sharing emotions – especially the difficult ones – sets an important example for your child or teen ! It actually makes everyone in the family stronger, because you can understand and support each other better.
text: Ukuxoxa ngemizwa, ikakhulukazi leyo enzima, kubekela ingane yakho eyevile eminyakeni eyishumi nambili isibonelo esibalulekile! Empeleni kuqinisa wonke umuntu emndenini ngoba nikwazi ukuqondana nokusekelana kangcono.

SourceText: Sharing emotions is about explaining how you are feeling so @fields.child_nickname is aware and learns to do the same. You can choose how much detail you want to share about the situation. It’s up to you! You can also choose to answer questions later: “I am feeling angry/stressed now, can you please give me some time? We can talk about this more tonight”.
text: Ukwabelana ngemizwa kumayelana nokuchaza ukuthi uzizwa kanjani ukuze u @fields.child_nickname ezoqonda futhi afunde ukwenza okufanayo. Ungakhetha ukuthi yimininingwane engakanani ofuna ukuyiveza ngaleso simo. Kulele kuwe! Ungakhetha ukubuye uyiphendule imibuzo: “Ngizizwa ngidiniwe/nginengcindezi manje, unganginika isikhashana? Singakhuluma kabanzi ngalokhu namuhla kusihlwa”.

SourceText: Sharing emotions is about explaining how you are feeling so your child or teen  is aware and learns to do the same. You can choose how much detail you want to share about the situation. It’s up to you! You can also choose to answer questions later: “I am feeling angry/stressed now, can you please give me some time? We can talk about this more tonight”.
text: Ukwabelana ngemizwa kumayelana nokuchaza ukuthi uzizwa kanjani ukuze ingane yakho ekhulile izoqonda futhi ifunde ukwenza okufanayo. Ungakhetha ukuthi yimininingwane engakanani ofuna ukuyiveza ngaleso simo. Kulele kuwe! Ungakhetha ukubuye uyiphendule imibuzo: “Ngizizwa ngidiniwe/nginengcindezi manje, unganginika isikhashana? SourceText: Starting a new thing is always difficult at first. Give yourselves some time to get used to it, and keep giving the good example by noticing and sharing emotions. Over time, @fields.child_nickname will learn to do the same – and they will feel even more loved and cared for.
text: Ukuqala into entsha kuhlale kunzima ekuqaleni. Zinikeze isikhathi zokuyejwayela, uqhubeke nokunikeza izibonelo ezinhle ngokuqaphela nokwabelana ngemizwa. Ngokuhamba kwesikhathi, ingane yakho eyevile eminyakeni eyishumi nambili izofunda ukwenza okufanayo, futhi izozizwa ithandwa nakakhulu, inakekelwa!

SourceText: Starting a new thing is always difficult at first. Give yourselves some time to get used to it, and keep giving the good example by noticing and sharing emotions. Over time, your child or teen  will learn to do the same – and they will feel even more loved and cared for.

Ngokuhamba kwesikhathi, ingane yakho eyevile eminyakeni eyishumi nambili izofunda ukwenza okufanayo, futhi izozizwa ithandwa nakakhulu, inakekelwa!

SourceText: 1. Treat each other as equals
text: 1. Thathanani sengathi niyalingana

SourceText: Family and friends might tell you how a husband or a father should act. But both men and women benefit when they talk to each other and make decisions together! For example, next time you’re making a decision, try involving your partner and ask what they think.
text: Umndeni noma abangani bangakutshela ukuthi umyeni noma ubaba kumele aziphathe kanjani. Kodwa bobabili indoda nomfazi bayahlomula uma bekhuluma futhi bethatha izinqumo ndawonye! Isibonelo, ngokuzayo uma nithatha isinqumo, zama ukusondeza uphathina wakho umbuze ukuthi yena ucabangani.

SourceText: Family and friends might tell you how a wife or a mother should act compared to a husband or father.  But both men and women benefit when they talk to each other and make decisions together! For example, next time you’re making a decision, try involving your partner and ask what they think.
text: Umndeni noma abangani bangakutshela ukuthi umfazi noma umama kumele aziphathe kanjani uma kuqhathaniswa nomyeni noma nobaba.  Kodwa bobabili indoda nomfazi bayahlomula uma bekhuluma futhi bethatha izinqumo ndawonye! Isibonelo, ngokuzayo uma nithatha isinqumo, zama ukusondeza uphathina wakho umbuze ukuthi yena ucabangani.

SourceText: Family and friends might tell you how a partner or a parent should act. But both men and women benefit when they talk to each other and make decisions together! For example, next time you’re making a decision, try involving your partner and ask what they think.
text: Umndeni noma abangani bangakutshela ukuthi uphathina kumele aziphathe kanjani. Kodwa bobabili indoda nomfazi bayahlomula uma bekhuluma futhi bethatha izinqumo ndawonye! Isibonelo, ngokuzayo uma nithatha isinqumo, zama ukusondeza uphathina wakho umbuze ukuthi yena ucabangani.

SourceText: Would you like to see a comic about treating each other as equals?
text: Ungathanda ukubona indatshana ngokuthi ningaphathana kanjani ngendlela elinganayo?

SourceText: Parent 1: “My dear, you look worried. What’s wrong?”
text: Umzali 1: “Sthandwa, ubukeka ukhathazekile. Kwenzekeni?”

SourceText: Parent 2: “The stove has not been working very well recently. I think the stove might be broken.”
text: Umzali 2: Isitofu asisebenzi kahle kulezi zinsuku. Ngicabanga ukuthi isitofu siphukile.”

SourceText: Parent 1: “I noticed this too when I was cooking last week. I wanted to ask you: do you think we should buy a new one?”
text: Umzali 1: “Nami ngikuqaphelile lokho ngesikhathi ngipheka ngesonto eledlule. Ngifuna ukukubuza: Ucabanga ukuthi kumele sithenge esisha?”

SourceText: Parent 2: “Buying a new one would be really expensive. How about we talk about it after dinner, and we can make a decision together?
text: Umzali 2: “Ukuthenga esisha kungamba eqolo. Kunganjani uma singakhuluma emuva kwesidlo sakusihlwa, bese sithatha isinqumo ndawonye?

SourceText: Parent 1: “That sounds great. Thank you for cooking dinner, my dear!”
text: Umzali 1: “Lokho kuzwakala kumnandi. Ngiyabonga ukupheka isidlo sakusihlwa, sthandwa!”

SourceText: Parent 1: “I am grateful we can talk about this and make this decision together. It makes a lot more sense to try to get it repaired first.”
text: Umzali 1: Nguyajabula ukuthi siyakwazi ukukhuluma ngale nto futhi sithathe isinqumo ndawonye. Kuyawakha umqondo ukuthi sizame ukusikhanda kuqala.”

SourceText: Parent 2: “Me too. I feel a lot better now that we have talked about it together.”
text: Umzali 2: “Nakimi futhi. Ngizizwa ngingcono kakhulu manje ngoba sesikhulumile ngalokhu sindawonye.”

SourceText: When mothers and fathers are both engaged with the parenting of their children, everyone benefits, including the children! Show your partner that you appreciate it when they spend quality time with your children.
text: Uma omama nobaba beyingxenye yokukhulisa izingane zabo, wonke umuntu uyahlomula, okubandakanya nazo izingane zabo! Khombisa uphathina wakho ukuthi uyajabula uma echitha isikhathi nezingane zenu.

SourceText: Would you like to see a comic about becoming a confident parent and a supportive partner?
text: Ungathanda ukubona indatshana ngokuthi ungaba kanjani wumzali ozethembayo nophathina owusizo?

SourceText: Parent 1: “Good job, Jessie! You are reading very well!”
text: Umzali 1: “Wenze umsebenzi omuhle, Jessie! Ufunda kahle kakhulu!”

SourceText: Parent 2: “The weather today is so nice. It is a shame I have not had time to go outside for a walk.”
text: Umzali 2: “Isimo sezulu sihle namuhla. Kuyinto embi ukuthi angisitholanga isikhathi sokuphuma ngishaywe wumoya.”

SourceText: Parent 1: “If you would like to get some fresh air and exercise, my dear, I can continue helping the children with their homework while you go for your afternoon walk.”
text: Umzali 1: “Uma ufuna ukushaywa ngumoya nokujima, sthandwa, ngingaqhubeka nokusiza izingane ngomsebenzi wesikole uma usuphuma uya ngaphandle ntambama.”

SourceText: Parent 2: “That would be wonderful, my love! Thank you for being so supportive.”
text: Umzali 2: “Lokho kungaba kuhle kakhulu, sthandwa! Ngiyabonga ukungeseka.”

SourceText: Parent 1: “Of course! It is fun to help the children with their reading practice! They are doing so well.”
text: Umzali 1: “Kunjalo! Kumnandli ukusiza izingane zifunde ukufunda! Zenza kahle kakhulu.”

SourceText: Sharing family responsibilities with your partner can make life less stressful! Can you think of ways you can share the workload? Doing tasks together can also make them more fun!
text: Ukwabelana ngemisebenzi yasekhaya nophathina wakho kungenza impilo ibe lula! Ungacabanga ngezindlela eningalekelelana ngazo? Ukwenza eminye imisebenzi ndawonye kungenza ibe mnandi!

SourceText: Would you like to see a comic about sharing family responsibilities?
text: Ungathanda ukubona indatshana ngokwabelana ngemisebenzi yomdeni?

SourceText: Child: “Wow, there are so many clothes in here!”
text: Ingane: “Wow, ziningi izingubo lapha!”

SourceText: Parent 1: “You’re right, Kyle, there is quite a lot to do.”
text: Umzali 1: “Uqinisile, Kyle, kuningi okudinga ukwenziwa.”

SourceText: Parent 1: “If we do it together it will take less time!”
text: Umzali 1: Uma sibambisana kuzoshesha!”

SourceText: Parent 1: “Doing tasks together is also fun”
text: Umzali 1: “Ukwenza umsebenzi ndawonye kumnandi

SourceText: Parent 2: “Thank you, my love. Sharing the workload makes it less stressful.”
text: Umzali 2: “Ngiyabonga, sthandw sami. Ukubambisana emsebenzini kwenza ungabi yinkinga.”

SourceText: All adults have disagreements sometimes. But solving issues through fighting is not effective. Instead, if you start feeling angry, walk away for a bit or take a deep breath before responding in a calmer way.
text: Bonke abantu abadala kuyenzeka baphikisane. Kodwa ukuxazulula izinkinga ngokulwa akusebenzi. Esikhundleni, uma uzizwa ukuthi uqala ukudinwa, suka uhambe isikhashana noma udonse umoya kakhulu ngaphambi kokuba uphendule kahle.

SourceText: Would you like to see a comic about resolving conflict peacefully?
text: Ungathanda ukubona indatshana ngokuxazulula ingxabano ngendlela enokuthula?

SourceText: Parent 1: “Dinner is ready!”
text: Umzali 1: “Ukudla sekulungile!”

SourceText: Child: “Look, it is raining so much outside!”
text: Ingane: “Buka liyana ngempela ngaphandle!”

SourceText: Parent 1: “I am glad you brought in the laundry earlier, my dear. Otherwise, it would have been soaked by now!”
text: Umzali 1: “Ngiyajabula ukuthi uzingenisile izingubo, sthandwa. Ngale kwalokho, ngabe zimanzi manje!”

SourceText: Parent 1: “I thought you said you would bring in the laundry today?”
text: Umzali 1: “Bengithi uthe uzozingenisa wena izingubo namhlanje?”

SourceText: Parent 1: “No, I was busy cooking dinner! You told me you would take care of it! How could you forget? Now all the laundry is wet!”
text: Umzali 1: Cha, bengimatasa ngipheka ukudla! Uthe wena uzozingenisa! Ukhohlwa kanjani kodwa? Bheka manje zonke izingubo zimanzi!”

SourceText: Parent 2: “I’m really sorry. It was a mistake!”
text: Umzali 2: “Ngiyaxolisa kakhulu. Kube yiphutha!”

SourceText: Parent 1(thinking): I can’t believe he forgot! But everyone can make mistakes. Take a deep breath…
text: Umzali 1 (Ecabanga): Angikholwa ukuthi ukhohliwe! Kodwa wonke umuntu uyalenza iphutha. “Donsa umoya kakhulu...

SourceText: Parent 1: “I’m sorry if I sounded upset. I just got stressed because I have had a long day.”
text: Umzali 1: “Ngiyaxolisa uma ungizwa ngathi ngidiniwe. Ngisuke ngadumala ngoba benginosuku olude.”

SourceText: Parent 2: “I am sorry that I forgot the laundry. I know you have had a long day. I will make sure to take care of it after dinner.”
text: Umzali 2: “Ngiyaxolisa ukuthi ngikhohlwe yizingubo. Ngiyazi ukuthi ube nosuku olude. Ngizoqinisekisa ukuthi ngiyayibeka indaba yazo emuva kokudla.”

SourceText: Listening and talking to those around us is key to a more peaceful home. Talking to your partner about issues before they become problems can help avoid arguments from building up.
text: Ukulalela nokukhuluma nalabo esihlala nabo kubalulekile ekwakheni ikhaya elinokuthula. Ukukhuluma nophathina wakho ngezinto ngaphambi kokuba zibe yininga kusiza ukugwema ukuqala kwengxabano.

SourceText: Parent 1: “Are you okay, my love? You look tired.”
text: Umzali 1: “Ngabe konke kuhamba kahle, sthandwa? Ubukeka ukhathele.”

SourceText: Parent 2: “I didn’t sleep well last night and so I am feeling quite tired.”
text: Umzali 2: “Angilalanga kahle izolo, ngakho ngizizwa ngikhathele.”

SourceText: Parent 1: “I am sorry to hear that, Amir. Is there anything I can do to help?”
text: Umzali 1: “Ngiyaxolisa ngokuzwa lokho, Amir . Ngabe kukhona engungakwenza ukusiza?”

SourceText: Parent 2: “I might try and get an earlier rest this evening.”
text: Umzali 2: “Ngizozama ukusheshe ngiphumule kusihlwa.”

SourceText: Parent 1: “I can take over the children’s bedtime routine after dinner tonight, so that you can get some extra rest.”
text: Umzali 1: “Ngingazama ukulalisa izingane ngemuva kwesidlo sakusihlwa, ukuze ukwazi ukuphumula.”

SourceText: Parent 2: “That would be lovely. Thank you so much, my dear.”
text: Umzali 2: “Ngingakujabulela lokho. Ngiyabonga kakhulu sthandwa.”

SourceText: Would you like to see a comic about listening and talking to each other?

SourceText: First, we can find ways to encourage our children to behave well more often. Spending One-on-One Time with them is an important first step!
text: Okokuqala, singathola izindlela zokugqugquzela izingane zethu ukujwayela ukuziphatha kahle. Ukuchitha isikhathi ninobabili nazo kungaba yisinyathelo sokuqala esibalulekile!

SourceText: Second, we can learn effective ways to manage difficult behaviours in a loving but firm way.
text: Okwesibili, singafunda izindlela ezisebenzayo zokubhekana nokuziphatha okungekuhle ngendlela enothando kodwa eqinile.

SourceText: There are 2 main ways that we can do to help our children behave positively more often.
text: Zimbili izindlela esingenza ngazo ukusiza izingane zethu zijwayele ukuziphatha kahle.

SourceText: Hi! Have you tried to talk to your partner about your feelings and any difficulties you are facing recently?
text: Sawubona! Uke wazama ukukhuluma nophathina wakho ngemizwa yakho nanoma yibuphi ubunzima obhekene nabo muva nje?

SourceText: Good for you! Talking about challenges and our emotions can be hard. How was your experience?
text: Kuhle lokho! Ukukhuluma ngezinselelo nemizwa yethu kungaba nzima. Kwenzekeni kuwe?

SourceText: Sharing how we feel and talking about the difficulties we’re facing actually makes everyone in the family stronger! By sharing emotions you can better understand and support each other.
text: Ukuxoxa ngemizwa nokukhuluma ngezinselelo esibhekene nazo kwenza wonke umuntu emndenini abe namandla! Ngokwabelana ngemizwa yenu ningaqonda kangcono futhi nesekane kangcono.

SourceText: Sharing your emotions or difficulties you are facing is about making others more aware of how you are feeling. You get to decide how much you want to share. You can also choose to share more at a later time.
text: Ukwabelana ngemizwa yenu noma izinselelo enibhekene nazo kwenzela ukuthi nabanye bazi ukuthi uzizwa kanjani. Uyanquma ukuthi kungakanani ofisa ukwabelana ngakho. Ungakhetha futhi ukuphinde uxoxe ngokunye ngesinye isikhathi.

SourceText: Talking about our feelings or challenges we’re facing can help others understand and support you better. Emotions and challenges are a part of life and learning how to handle these can help you avoid conflict with loved ones and make life less stressful.
text: Ukukhuluma ngemizwa yethu noma izinselelo zethu kungasiza nabanye ukuba baqonde futhi bakweseke kangcono. Imizwa nezinselelo kuyingxenye yempilo kanti ukufunda ukuthi ubhekana kanjani nalokhu kungasiza ukugwema ingxabano nabathandiweyo bakho kwenze nempilo ibe lula.

SourceText: Starting something new can be difficult. Give yourself and others time to get used to it. By setting a good example by sharing your emotions and challenges you’re facing others will feel start to feel more comfortable sharing too.
text: Ukuqala into entsha kungaba nzima. Zinikeze isikhathi wena nabanye ukuze nejwayele. Ngokuba yisibonelo esihle ngokwabela abanye imizwa nezinselelo zakho obheke nazo kwenza abanye nabo babone kukuhle ukuxoxa ngezabo izinkinga.

SourceText: It’s okay if you don’t want to share at that time. You can choose to share how you’re feeling at a later time once you feel calmer.
text: Akunankinga uma ungathandi ukukhuluma ngakho ngaleso sikhathi. Ungakhetha ukwabelana ngemizwa yakho ngesinye isikhathi uma usuzizwa ungcono.

SourceText: Here are 6 tips that can help you keep your children safe online:
text: Nanka amathiphu ayisithupha azokusiza ugcine izingane zakho ziphephile kwi-inthanethi:

SourceText: 4. Spend time with your child online
text: 4. Chitha isikhathi nengane yakho  kwi-intanethi

SourceText: 5. Build open communication
text: 5. Vulelanani izifuba

SourceText: 6. Report and seek help
text: 6. Bika futhi ufune usizo

SourceText: • Adults targeting children for sexual purposes on social media, gaming, and messaging platforms.
text: Abantu abadala abafunana nezingane ngezinjongo zocansi ezinkundleni zokuxhumana, kwezemidlalo, kanye nasezinkundleni zemiyalezo.

SourceText: • Teens sharing personal information and sexual photos or videos of themselves.
text: Intsha yabelana ngemininingwane yabo yomuntu siqu kanye nezithombe zocansi noma amavidiyo ayo.

SourceText: • Cyberbullying from other young people and strangers.
text: Ukuhlukumezana kwi-inthanethi okuvela kwabanye abantu nezingane.

SourceText: 2. Tech fixes to protect your children online:
text: 2. Lawula ezobuchwepheshe ukuvikela ingane yakho kwi-inthanethi:

SourceText: This does not mean we should ban our children from spending time online. It just means that we need to learn how to protect them in a new world.
text: Lokhu akusho ukuthi kumele sivalele izingane zethu ukusebenzisa i-inthanethi. Kusho ukuthi kumele sifunde ukuthi singazivikela kanjani kuleli zwe elisha.

SourceText: 5. Build open communication and trusting relationships
text: 5. Yakha uhlelo lokuxhumana oluvulelekile nokwethembana nengane yakho.

SourceText: Tell your children that if they experience something online (or anywhere) that makes them feel upset, uncomfortable, or scared, they can talk to you and you will not get mad or punish them.
text: Tshela izingane zakho ukuthi uma zihlangabezana nokuthile ku-inthanethi okubenza bacasuke, bangakhululeki, noma besabe, bangakhuluma nawe futhi ngeke uthukuthele noma ubajezise.

SourceText: Report to INHOPE Hotlines and IWF portals and the Child Helpline in your country to get support if you or your children experience online violence or other things that are not acceptable.
text: Bika ezinombolweni zokumpimpa ze-INHOPE nakwi-IWF ne-Child Helpline yezwe lakho ukuze uthole usizo uma wena noma ingane yakho ihlukumezeka kwi-inthanethi noma kwenzeka izinto ezingemukelekile.

SourceText: Please select another number if you want to learn another way to protect your child online:
text: Sicela ukhethe enye inombolo uma ufuna ukufunda kabanzi ngokuvikela ingane yakho kwi-inthanethi:

SourceText: Here is a comic on discussing online activities with your child
text: Nansi indatshana ngokukhuluma ngezinto ezenzeka kwi-inthanethi nengane yakho.

SourceText: Parent: "Shani, have you done your homework?"
text: Umzali:  "Shani, usuwenzile umsebenzi wakho wesikole?"

SourceText: Child: "Just a minute, I'm finishing this tiktok video"
text: Ingane: “Umzuzwana nje , ngisaqedela le vidiyo"

SourceText: Parent: "You are a really great dancer! Tell me about why you like it."
text: Umzali: “Ave udansa kahle kakhulu! Ngitshele ukuthi kungani ukuthanda."

SourceText: Child: "All my friends are on it. I have more than 600 likes and 120 followers."
text: Ingane: “Bonke abangane bami bayadansa. Nginama-likes angu-600 nabalandeli abangu-120.”

SourceText: Parent: "I’m proud of how well you dance, Joey. But we need to make sure you are safe on this. I know your friends look at TikTok, but with an open account there are also paedophiles who look at videos of teenagers. Paedophiles are older people who want to attack young children and teens."
text: Umzali: “Ngiyaziqhenya ngawe ngendlela odansa kahle ngayo. Kodwa kumelwe siqiniseka ukuba uphephile. Ngiyazi abangani bakho babuka iTikTok, kodwa uma une-akhawunti evulelekile kukhona nabakhokhobela izingane ababuka ama-video ezingane esezikhulile. Abakhokhobela izingane ngabantu abadala abafuna ukuhlasela izingane ezincane nesezikhulile.”

SourceText: Parent: "Let’s look together online at how we can keep this fun for you but also safe. Look – you can make your account private and control who follows you. So you can accept people you know but not strangers. Can we make a rule together that you can use TikTok but with a private account? I trust you to know who to accept!"
text: Umzali: “Ake sihlole ku-inthanethi sobabili ukuthi singenza kanjani ukuthi ukujabulele lokhu kodwa uphephe ngesikhathi esifanayo. Bheka - ungakwazi ukwenza ukuba kube abantu abathile kuphela abakwazi ukubona i-akhawunti yakho futhi ungakwazi nokukhetha ukuthi ubani ozokulandela. Ungamukeli abantu ongabazi ungabamukela abantu obaziyo. Ingabe singakwazi ukwenza umthetho ndawonye ungawusebenzisa , kodwa nge-akhawunti engavulelekile kuwonke wonke? Ngiyakwethemba ukuthi uyazi ukuthi obani ozobavumela!”

SourceText: Parent: "I’m proud of you Shalini..."
text: Umzali: “Ngiyaziqhenya ngawe Shalini...”

SourceText: Involve @fields.child_nickname in creating family tech agreements about healthy device use.
text: Bandakanya u @fields.child_nickname ekuqaleni isivumelwano somndeni ngezobuchwepheshe sokuthi yimaphi amadivayisi okuphephile ukuwasebenzisa.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Create device-free spaces and times in your house
text: Makube nezindawo angasetshenziswa khona amadivayisi ekhaya lakho.

SourceText: (eating, playing, schoolwork, and sleeping).
text: (ukudla, ukudlala, umsebenzi wesikole, nokulala)

SourceText: Child tech agreement: https://www.esafety.gov.au/sites/default/files/2020-01/Our%20Family%20Tech%20Agreement_0.pdf

text: Bandakanya ingane yakho esikhulile ekuqaleni izivumelwano zokusebenzisa ubuchwepheshe zokuthi yimaphi amadivayisi okuphephile ukuwasebenzisa.

SourceText: Help @fields.child_nickname learn how to keep personal information private, especially from strangers – some people are not who they say they are!
text: Siza u @fields.child_nickname ukufunda ukuthi ulwazi lwakhe ulugcina kanjani luyimfihlo, ikakhulukazi kubantu abangaziwa – abanye abantu abayona into abathi bayiyona!

SourceText: Remind your children that what goes online stays online (messages, photos, and videos).
text: Khumbuza izingane zakho ukuthi okufakwa kwi-inthanethi kuhlala khona (imiyalezo, izithombe, nama-video).

SourceText: Actively supervise children’s time online, including computers, smartphones, and tablets.
text: Qaphisisa isikhathi ingane yakho esichitha kwi-inthanethi, okubandakanya amakhompyutha, amaselula namathebhulethi.

SourceText: Help your child learn how to keep personal information private, especially from strangers – some people are not who they say they are!
text: Siza ingane yakho ukufunda ukuthi ulwazi lwayo ilugcina kanjani luyimfihlo, ikakhulukazi kubantu abangaziwa – abanye abantu abayona into abathi bayiyona!

SourceText: 4. Spend time with your child or teen online
text: 4. Chitha isikhathi nengane yakho esikhulile kwi-inthanethi

SourceText: Get to know how @fields.child_nickname experiences the digital world.
text: Yazi ukuthi u @fields.child_nickname ubonani ezweni ledijithali.

SourceText: Explore websites, social media, games, and apps together.
text: Bhekani amawebhusayithi, izinkundla zokuxhumana, amagemu nama-app ndawonye.

SourceText: Talk to your teen on how to report things that aren't OK.
text: Khuluma nengane yakho esikhulile ukuthi zibikwa kanjani izinto ezingalungile.

SourceText: Common Sense Media has great advice for apps, games and entertainment for different ages.
text: I-Common Sense Media inezeluleko ezinhle mayelana nama-app, amagemu nezinto zokuzijabulisa zabaneminyaka ehlukene yobudala.

SourceText: It‘s hard to feel positive when our kids or teenagers are driving us crazy. We often end up saying “Stop doing that!” But children are much more likely to do what we ask if we give them positive instructions and lots of praise for what they do right.
text: Kuba nzima ukujabula uma izingane ezincane kanye nentsha yethu ingaziphathi kahle.    Sigcina sithi “Yeka lento oyenzayo!” Kepha izingane zingenza lokhu esikucelayo uma sibatshele ngendlela ekahle bese sibancoma uma benze kahle.

SourceText: Here's a positive video to help you get your children to follow your instructions more often!
text: Nansi i-video engakusiza ukuze izingane zilandele imiyalo yakho!

SourceText: Here's a positive audio message to help you get your children to follow your instructions more often!
text: Nanku umnkenenezo engakusiza izingane zilandele imiyalo yakho!

SourceText: Here are 4 steps to help you get your children to follow your instructions more often:
text: Nazi izinyathelo ezine ezingakusiza ukuthi izingane zakho zilandele imiyalo yakho.

SourceText: 1. Get their attention
text: 1. Benze bakunake

SourceText: 2. Be positive, specific, and realistic
text: 2. Gqugquzela, cacisa, bese ubacabangele nabo.

SourceText: 3. One instruction at a time
text: 3. Umyalo owodwa ngesikhathi

SourceText: 4. Praise them for doing it!
text: 4. Bancome ngokwenza kahle!

SourceText: To learn more about one of these steps, type "1" to "4". You can also type "N" to stop this tip.
text: Ukufunda kabanzi ngalezi zinyathelo, bhala “1” kuya ku “4”. Ungabhala futhi u “N” ukumisa le thiphu.

SourceText: Step 3. Give Instructions One at a Time
text: Isinyathelo 3. Nika imiyalelo ngayodwa ngesikhati

SourceText: Children are much more likely to do what you ask if you break things up into smaller steps.
text: Izingane kunamathuba amaningi okuthi zenze lokho okushoyo uma ukuhlukanisa ngezigaba ezincane.

SourceText: Step 4. Praise Your Children When They Follow Instructions
text: Isinyathelo 4. Ncoma uma izingane zilandela imiyalo

SourceText: They will feel good about it and be more likely to follow instructions in the future!
text: Bazokujabulela lokho bese kuba lula ukulandela imiyalo njalo!

SourceText: Please select another number if you want to learn more about how to get your children to follow instructions more often:
text: Khetha enye inombolo uma ufuna ukufunda ukukhuluma nezingane zakho ngokulandela imiyalo njalo:

SourceText: Can your child actually do what you are asking them? It is very hard for a child to keep quiet inside for a whole day but maybe they can keep quiet for 15 minutes.
text: Ingabe izingane zakho zike zenze lokhu okucelayo? Kuba nzima ukuthi izingane zithule usuku lonke kepha mhlawumbe zingakwazi ukuthula imizuzu eyi-15.

SourceText: Here is a comic on using positive words and praise with your teen.
text: Nayi indlela eyihlaya yokusebenzisa amagama akhayo nezingane zakho

SourceText: Teen: “Can I watch some T.V. after dinner?”
text: Intsha: “Ngingabukela umabonakude uma uqeda isidlo sasebusuku?”

SourceText: Parent: “When you clear the table, you can watch an hour of T.V.”
text: Umzali: “Uma uqeda ukuqoqa itafula, ungabukela umabonakude ihora”

SourceText: Parent: “I really appreciate it when you help clean up after dinner. Thank you, Dylan”
text: Umzali: Ngiyajabula kakhula uma ungisiza ukuqoqa emuva kwesidlo sakusihlwa. Ngiyabonga Dylan”

SourceText: Parent and teen watching T.V. together.
text: Umzali nengane babukela umabona kude ndawonye.

SourceText: Step 2. Be Specific, Positive, and Realistic!
text: Isinyathelo 2. Gqugquzela, cacisa, bese ubacabangele nabo.

SourceText: Describe exactly what you want @fields.child_nickname to do. Say, 'Please wash your hands for 20 seconds before coming to dinner, instead of 'Wash your hands.'

SourceText: Household rules can help keep our children safe from potential dangers both inside the house and in the community. They also help children to know what kind of behaviour is expected from them.

text: Sawubona! Ithuphi Yanamuhla yokuba Umzali ukuthi singabandakanya kanjani izingane zethu ekusunguleni imithetho ekhaya.

SourceText: Household rules can help keep our children safe from potential dangers both inside the house and in the community. They also help children to know what kind of behaviour is expected from them.
text: Imithetho yasekhaya ingasiza ngokuphephisa izingane ekhaya nangaphandle emphakathini. Iphinde isize izingane zazi ukuthi iyiphi indlela yokuziphatha elindeleke kubona

SourceText: Here's an audio message on how you can involve your children in establishing household rules.
text: Nanku umyalezo oqoshiwe mayelana nokubandakanya izingane zakho ekwakheni imithetho yasendlini.

SourceText: Here's is a video on how you can involve your children in establishing household rules.
text: Nansi i-video mayelana nokubandakanya izingane zakho ekwakheni imithetho yasendlini.

SourceText: Here are some simple tips on how you can make household rules with your children and teens:
text: Nanka amasu okusungula imithetho ekhaya lakho nezingane zakho:

SourceText: • Involve your child in establishing household rules.
text: Bandakanya izingane zakho uma usungula imithetho ekhaya lakho.

SourceText: • Make your household rules clear and specific.
text: Yenza imithetho yasekhaya icace.

SourceText: • Make sure your child understands the reasons why you are establishing a household rule.
text: Qinisekisa ukuthi ingane yakho iyaqonda ukuthi kungani nisungula lemithetho yasekhaya.

SourceText: • Make your household rules fair and realistic (just like instructions).
text: Yenza imithetho yekhaya lakho ibe ngezwakalayo futhi eyenzekayo (njengemiyalelo).

SourceText: • Praise and simple incentives can help support your child in following a household rule.
text: Ukuncoma kuphinde kuphe ingane yakho okuthize kungagqugquzela ingane ukuthi ilandele imithetho.

SourceText: • Add only 1 household rule at a time.
text: Faka imithetho ngayodwa ngeskhathi.

SourceText: Children and teens are spending a lot more time online. Here is a comic on how you can create safe and healthy online habits like scheduling time online and offline.
text: Izingane nentsha zichitha isikhathi eside ku-inthanethi. Nansi indatshana ngokuthi ungenza kanjani ukuthi kube nomkhuba ophephile novikelekile wokusebenzisa i-inthanethi njengokubeka izikhathi zokungena nokuphuma kwi-inthanethi.

SourceText: Parent: “Jack, you have been spending a lot of time on your tablet. Why do you think I am concerned about that?”
text: Umzali: “Jack, uhlala isikhathi esiningi kuthebhulethi yakho” Ucabanga ukuthi kungani ngikhathazeka?

SourceText: Child: “Um…because I am not doing my schoolwork?”
text: Ingane: Um...ngoba angenzi umsebenzi wami wesikole?

SourceText: Parent: “Yes, that is one reason. It is important that you make the time for your schoolwork. I also like seeing you being more active. Maybe we can make a household rule about gadget use. What do you think would be a fair limit each day?”
text: Umzali: “Yebo, yileso sizathu esisodwa Kubalulekile ukwenza isikhathi somsebenzi wesikole. Ngithanda ukubona futhi uzivocavoca Mhlawumbe singabeka umthetho ngokusebenzisa amagajethi. Ucabanga ukuthi singanquma isikhathi esingakanani ngosuku?

SourceText: Child: “Um…two hours a day?”
text: Ingane: “Um...amahora amabili ngosuku?

SourceText: Parent: “Hmmm…I think that might be too much time. You have so much else to do every day.”
text: Umzali: “Hmmm...Ngicabanga ukuthi siningi kakhulu leso sikhathi. Kuningi okumele ukwenze nsuku zonke.”

SourceText: Child: “How about one hour for fun and one hour for learning?
text: Ingane: Kunganjani ihora elilodwa lokudlala bese elilodwa lokufunda?

SourceText: Parent: “That sounds reasonable. I would also like you to do your schoolwork before using any gadgets. So from now on, the household rule is that you do your schoolwork before using gadgets and that you can have 1 hour for free time and 1 hour for educational activities. Okay?”
text: Umzali: “Kuyamukeleka lokho. Ngingathanda uma ungenza umsebenzi wakho wesikolo ngaphambi kokuba usebenzise amagajethi.  Kusukela manje, umthetho walapha ekhaya uthi uqeda ngomsebenzi wakho wesikole ngaphambi kokusebenzisa amagajethi futhi unehora elilodwa lokuphumula bese elilodwa elomsebenzi wesikole.  “Kulungile?”

SourceText: Child: “Okay.”
text: Ingane: Kulungule.”

 Ezinsukwini ezilandela zama ukwengeza umthetho owodwa nengane yakho.  khumbula ukuthi uma ufaka ingane yakho eseminyakeni yokuthomba ekubekeni imithetho aba maningi amathuba okuthi iwulandela umthetho. Kuyisinyathelo esinya empumelelweni!

SourceText: Well done! You have added another layer to your House of Support. Over the next few days, try to create one household rule with your child. Remember when you involve your child in making household rules, they are more likely to follow them. It's a recipe for success!
text:
Wenze kahle! Sewengeze elinyelinye izinga ohlelweni lwakho lokweseka lwaseKhaya.
 Ezinsukwini ezilandela zama ukwenza umthetho owodwa nengane yakho.  khumbula ukuthi uma ufaka ingane yakho eseminyakeni yokuthomba ekubekeni imithetho aba maningi amathuba okuthi iwulandela umthetho. Kuyisinyathelo esinya empumelelweni!

SourceText: Today's tip is about how we can help to protect our children.
text: Ithiphu yanamuhla ingokuthi zingasiza kanjani ukuvikela izingane zethu.

SourceText: The idea of talking to children about abuse can be scary. We don't know what to say. But there are some simple things that can help them understand when it is not OK to be touched, and that they can tell you if something ever happens.
text: Umbono wokukhuluma nezingane ngokuhlukumezeka ungethusa. Asazi singathini. Kodwa zikhona izinto ezilula ezingabasiza ukuqonda uma kungalungile ukuthintwa, nokuthi zingakutshela uma kukhona okwenzekayo.

SourceText: When you are walking or doing something together it can be easier to chat.
text: Uma nihamba noma nenza okuthile ndawonye kungaba lula ukuxoxa.

SourceText: Do you want to learn more about how to protect your child from abuse?
text: Ngabe ufuna ukufunda kabanzi ngokuthi ungazivikela kanjani izingane zakho ekuhlukumezekeni?

SourceText: Here are 3 things that you should make sure your child knows to protect them from abuse:
text: Nazi izinto ezintathu okumele uzenze ukuqinisekisa ukuthi ingane yakho iyakwazi ukuzivikela ekuhlukumezekeni:

SourceText: 1. Learn about private parts
text: 1. Funda ngezitho zangasese

SourceText: 2. Your body belongs to you
text: 2. Umzimba wakho ngowakho

SourceText: 3. Bad secrets should be told
text: 3. Izimfihlo ezimbi kumele zikhulunywe

SourceText: Type "1" to "3" to learn more about these tips. Type "N" to stop this tip.
text: Bhala “1” kuya ku “3” ukufunda kabanzi ngalawa mathiphu. Bhala u “N” ukumisa le thiphu.

SourceText: Please select another number if you want to learn more about how to protect your child from abuse:
text: Khetha enye inombolo uma ufuna ukufunda kabanzi ngokuvikela ingane yakho ekuhlukunyezweni:

SourceText: 3. Bad secrets should be told.
text: 3. Izimfihlo ezimbi kumele zikhulunywe.

SourceText: Your children should tell you if there is a secret that makes them feel worried. You will not be angry. Only nice secrets - like a surprise birthday party - should be kept secret.
text: Izingane kumele zikutshele uma kukhona imfihlo uyenza bakhathazeke. Angeke uthukuthele.  Yizimfihlo ezinhle kuphela okumele zigcinwe ziyimfihlo - njengokuzumisa ngomcimbi wokubungaza usuku lokuzalwa

SourceText: The parts of their body that go under people's underwear or a swimsuit are private parts. It is not OK for other people to touch or to ask to look at them, or ask them to look at or touch theirs.
text: Izingxenye zomzimba ezingaphakathi kwezingubo zangaphansi noma zokubhukuda ziyizitho zangasese. Akulungile ukuba abanye abantu bazithinte noma bazibuke, noma bacele ukuthi ubuke noma uthinte ezabo.

SourceText: If someone tries to touch your children's private parts they must say NO and tell a grown up that they trust.
text: Uma kukhona ozama ukuthinta izingane zakho ezithweni zangasese kumele zithi CHA bese zitshela umuntu omdala ezimthembayo.

SourceText: Here's a video on how you can help protect @fields.child_nickname.
text: Nansi i-video ngokuthi ungasiza kanjani ukuvikela u @fields.child_nickname.

SourceText: Stress from caregiving can make us angry. Here is how we can maintain control and keep calm.
text: Ingcindezi yokunakekela izingane ingasenza sidinwe. Nansi indlela esingabalawula ngayo futhi sibagcine bethobile.

SourceText: Here's a video to help you maintain control and keep calm when you get angry.
text: Nansi i-video ezokusiza ukubalawula nokubehlisa umoya lapho usudiniwe.

SourceText: Here's an audio message to help you maintain control and keep calm when you get angry.
text: Nanku umyalezo ozokusiza ukubalawula nokubehlisa umoya uma udinwa.

SourceText: Think about what makes you angry? When does it happen? How do you normally react?
text: Cabanga ngalokho okukwenza uthukuthele? Kwenzeka nini? Ngokuvamile usabela kanjani?

SourceText: Prevent anger from starting in the first place. Get some sleep or rest when you are tired. Try to eat something when you are hungry. Ask someone for support when you are feeling alone.
text: Zisuka nje gwema ukuthi uthukuthele. Lala noma uphumule lapho ukhathele. Zama ukudla okuthile lapho ulambile. Cela othile ukuba akusekele lapho uzizwa uwedwa.

SourceText: Here are some things that can prevent bad things from happening when you are angry:
text: Nazi ezinye izinto ezingavikela ukuba kungenzeki izinto ezimbi uma usudiniwe:

SourceText: 1. Cut back on drinking alcohol or don’t drink, especially when the kids are awake.
text: 1. Nciphisa ukuphuza utshwala noma ungaphuzi nhlobo, ikakhulukazi uma izingane zivukile.

SourceText: 2. Do you have weapons or things that can be used to hurt others? Lock them up, hide them or take them out of the home.
text: 2. Ngabe unazo izikhali noma izinto ezingasetshenziswa ukulimaza abanye? Bavalele, bacashise noma ubakhiphe ekhaya.

SourceText: 3. It’s ok to have your children stay somewhere safe or take them to a place where they can get help.
text: 3. Kulungile ukuba izingane zakho zihlale kwenye indawo ephephile noma endaweni lapho zingathola khona usizo.

SourceText: Hello @fields.user_name! We love our children and teenagers, but stress from caregiving and money can make us angry. Here is how we can maintain control and keep calm.
text: Sanibona @fields.user_name! Siyazithanda izingane nentsha yethu, kodwa ingcindezi evela ekubanakekeleni, emalini, kanye ne-COVID-19 kungasenza sithukuthele. Nansi indlela esingabalawula ngayo futhi sibagcine bethobile.

SourceText: Great job! You should be proud of yourself! Research shows that every time you control your anger in front of your child, you increase your child's brain development.
text: Umsebenzi omuhle! Ziqhenye! Ucwaningo luveza ukuthi uma ulawula intukuthelo yakho phambi kwengane yakho, wandisa ukukhula kwengqondo yengane yakho.

SourceText: It is completely normal to experience this challenge. Next time you feel yourself getting angry try to manage this by taking deep breaths in. This can allow you to relax and reduce stress, which can help with managing your emotions. Every time you do this, you increase your child's brain development!
text: Kuyinto evamile ukubhekana nale nselelo. Ngokuzayo uma ubona ukuthi uyadinwa zama ukulawula lokhu ngokudonsa umoya kakhulu. Lokhu kungenza ukwazi ukwehlisa umoya nengcindezi, okungasiza ulawule izenzo zakho. Njalo uma wenza lokhu, wandisa ukukhula kwengqondo yengane yakho!

SourceText: Hi! Managing anger can be really difficult. Take a break when you feel you are getting angry at your children or someone else.
text: Sawubona! Ukulawula intukuthelo kungaba nzima kakhulu. Thatha ikhefu lapho uzwa ukuthi uqala ukuthukuthelela izingane zakho noma omunye umuntu.

SourceText: Go somewhere else for 5 minutes to regain control of your emotions. If you have safe outdoor space, go outside. You can get through this!
text: Hamba uye kwenye indawo imizuzu emihlanu ukuze ukwazi ukulawula imizwelo yakho. Uma unendawo ephephile ngaphandle, yiya ngaphandle. Ungadlula kulokhu!

SourceText: Did you know that research shows if you control your anger or do something positive, you increase your child's brain development? Be proud of yourself when you manage to do it!
text: Isayensi yobuchopho ibonisa ukuthi uma ulawula intukuthelo yakho noma wenza okuthile okuhle wandisa ukukhula kwengqondo yengane yakho. Ziqhenye ngawe uma ukwazile ukukwenza!

SourceText: When you take care of yourself, you take care of your children. We all need to connect. Try to talk to friends, family, and other support networks every day. If it has been a while since you reached out to someone, do it now!
text: uma uzinakekela, usuke unakekela izingane zakho. Sonke sidinga ukuxhuma. Zama ukuxoxa nsuku zonke nabangane, umndeni, kanye nezinye izinhlaka ezinikeza usizo. Sekuyisikhathi wagcina ukuxhumana nothile, yenza lokho manje!

SourceText: Sorry to hear that you are not having a good day. It is completely normal to be going through a difficult time now. Remember that you are not alone. Here is an activity that might also help...
text: Ngiyaxolisa ukuzwa ukuthi usuku lwakho aluhambi kahle. Kuyinto ejwayelekile ukuthi njengamanje udlula ezikhathini esinzima. Khumbula ukuthi awuwedwa. Nakhu okunye okungabuye kusize...

SourceText: Make a list of healthy activities that you like to do. Here are some suggestions:
text: Yenza uhlu lwezinto ongazenza ezinempilo ongathanda ukuzenza. Nanka amacebiso amabalwa:

SourceText: • Listening to your favourite music
text: * Ukulalela umculo wakho owuthandayo

SourceText: • Going for a walk (if allowed)
text: * Ukuhambahamba ngaphandle (uma kuvumelekile)

SourceText: • Doing some exercise
text: Ukuzivocavoca

SourceText: • Drinking a cup of tea by yourself
text: Phuza inkomishi yetiye uwedwa

SourceText: • Calling up a friend
text: * Ukushayela umngane

SourceText: • Singing, dancing, praying, or reading
text: * Ukucula, ukudansa, ukuthandaza noma ukucula

SourceText: • Sitting in the sun with your eyes closed
text: * Ukuhlala elangeni uvale amehlo akho

SourceText: • Watching your favourite T.V. show
text: * Ukubukela uhlelo lwe-T.V oluthandayo

SourceText: Pick one and do it today!
text: Khetha okokudwa ukwenze namuhla!

SourceText: We would love to learn more about how we can improve these messages. Would you be willing to chat with us about your experience? You will receive a free data voucher if you are contacted for an interview!
text: Singathanda ukufunda kabanzi ukuthi singayenza kanjani ibe ngcono le miyalezo. Ungafisa ukukhuluma nathi ngesipiliyoni sakho? Uzothola ivawusha yamadatha amahhala uma ubizelwe kwinhlolokhono!

SourceText: Thank you so much! Here is a link to sign up!

SourceText: Hello! Did you know that 3 is a magical number? Breathe in to the count of three and breathe out to the count of three. How do you feel now? Do you feel any different?
text: Sawubona! Ngabe bewazi ukuthi unombolo 3 yinombolo yemilingo? Donsa umoya ubale kathathu bese uyawukhipha futhi ubala kathathu. Uzizwa kanjani? Ingabe ukhona umehluko owuzwayo?

SourceText: Here's an audio message to guide you through this activity!
text: Nanku umyalezo oqoshiwe wokukukhalima kulo mdlalo!

SourceText: What are your three favourite foods? Can you name three things you can see right now?
text: Yisho ukudla okuthathu okuthanda kakhulu. Ungazisho izinto ezintathu ozibonayo manje?

SourceText: Can you hear three sounds you can hear right now?
text: Yisho imisindo emithathu oyizwayo manje.

SourceText: What are the three things you are grateful for right now?
text: Yiziphi izinto ezintathu ongabonga ngazo njengamanje?

SourceText: Breathe in to the count of three and breathe out to the count of three. How do you feel now? Do you feel any different?
text: Donsa umoya ubale kathathu bese uyawukhipha futhi ubala kathathu. Uzizwa kanjani? Ingabe ukhona umehluko owuzwayo?

SourceText: Three is a magical number!
text: Inombolo 3 yinombolo yemilingo!

SourceText: Here's a video to guide through this activity!
text: Nansi i-video ezokukhalima kulo mdlalo!

SourceText: Here is a song made just for parents like you.
text: Nanti iculo elenzelwe abazali abafana nawe.

SourceText: One-on-One Time with your children is free and fun. It makes children feel loved and secure, and shows them that they are important. It also increases their confidence and self-esteem!
text: Isikhathi sokuba wedwa wena nengane yakho simahhala futhi simnandi. Kwenza izingane zizizwe zithandwa futhi zivikelekile, futhi kuzikhombisa ukuthi zibalulekile. Kuphinde kwandize ukuzethemba nokuzigqaja kuzona!

SourceText: Here are 6 tips to make One-on-One Time with your child a success:
text: Nanka amathiphu awu-6 okwenza isikhathi sakho nengane yakho sibe yimpumelelo:

SourceText: 1. Spend at least five minutes with each child
text: 1. Chitha okungenani imizuzu eyisihlanu nengane ngayinye

SourceText: 2. Give your child your full attention
text: 2. Yinake ngokuphelele ingane yakho

SourceText: 3. Let your child choose the activity
text: 3. Yeka ingane yakho ikhethe okuzokwenziwa

SourceText: 4. Follow your child's lead
text: 4. Landela lokho okushiwo yingane yakho

SourceText: 5. Use words to describe what your child is doing
text: 5 Sebenzisa amagama ukuchaza lokho okwenziwa yingane yakho

SourceText: 6. Have fun!
text: 6. Yiba nesikhathi esimnandi!

SourceText: Even 5 minutes a day of quality time makes a big difference. If you have more than one child, try to find time for each individual child. It can be at the same time each day so your children look forward to it.
text: Ngusho imizuzu ewu-5 ngosuku yokuba nesikhathi senu yenza umehluko. Uma unezingane ezingaphezu kweyodwa, zama ukuthola isikhathi sengane ngayinye. Kungaba yisikhathi esifanayo nsuku zonke ukuze ingane izosilangazelela.

SourceText: Children need to do things in their own time. Try to give them time to explore and be patient. Play alongside and copy what they are doing but try to let them keep the initiative.
text: Izingane zidinga ukuzenzela izinto ngesikhathi sazo. Zama ukubanikeza isikhathi sokuzizamela ube nesineke. Dlala kanye nengane yakho ulingiselse lokho abakwenzayo kodwa zama ukwenza kube yibo abaqalayo.

SourceText: Choosing builds their self confidence. If they want to do something that isn’t okay, then this is a chance to talk with them about this.
text: Ukukhetha kubenza bakwazi ukuzethemba. Uma befuna ukwenza okuthile kulungile, lesi kuzoba yisikhathi sokukhuluma nabo ngalokho.

SourceText: Please select another number if you want to learn more about how to spend One-on-One Time with your child:
text: Khetha enye inombolo uma ufuna ukufunda kabanzi ngokuthi usichitha kanjani isikhathi senu nengane yakho:

SourceText: Here is a comic about spending one-on-one time with your child! Try to follow your child's lead when spending time with them. It will help build self-confidence.
text: Nansi indatshana ngokuchitha isikhathi senu nobabili nengane yakho! Zama ukulandela lokho abakwenzayo uma uchitha isikhathi nabo. Kuzosiza ukwakha ukuzethemba.

SourceText: Parent: "I see you are playing quietly with the lego with concentration, Alex."
text: Umzali: “Ngiyabona udlala ngokuthula ngethoyizi futhi ugxilile, Alex.”

SourceText: Parent: "Wow! You are building such a tall and strong wall with those legos."
text: Umzali: “Kwaze kwakuhle! Wakha ubonda olude futhi oluqinile ngalawo mathoyizi.”

SourceText: Child: "It is for cows."
text: Ingane: Ngabe wuthango lwezinkomo.”

SourceText: Parent: "It will keep the cow safe!"
text: Umzali: Luzogcina izinkomo ziphephile!”

SourceText: Child: "Now you can help me build a house for our family to sleep in!"
text: Ingane: Manje ungangisiza nami ngakhe indlu ezolala umndeni wethu!”

SourceText: Parent: "This house is going to keep our family warm and dry. You are such a good builder, Alex!"
text: Umzali: Lendlu izogcina umndeni wethu ufudumele futhi womile. Uwumakhi omuhle, Alex!”

SourceText: Would you like some suggestions for activities to do with your child?
text: Ungathanda imibono ngezinto ongazenza nengane yakho?

SourceText: Here's a video about spending one-on-one time with your child!

SourceText: Make sure you will not be interrupted. Finish all your chores, switch off the TV and put your phone on silent. It will show @fields.child_nickname, they are important.

SourceText: Ask @fields.child_nickname what they would like to do. You can say, "I have 5 minutes to spend One-on-One Time with you, what would you like to do?"
text: Buza u @fields.child_nickname ukuthi angathanda ukwenzani. Ungathi, “Nginemizuzu eyisihlanu engizoyichitha nawe sisobabili, ungafisa ukuba senzeni?”
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Ask your child what they would like to do. You can say, "I have 5 minutes to spend One-on-One Time with you, what would you like to do?"
text: Buza ingane yakho ukuthi ingathanda ukwenzani. Ungathi, “Nginemizuzu eyisihlanu engizoyichitha nawe sisobabili, ungafisa ukuba senzeni?”

SourceText: If @fields.child_nickname cannot think of anything, you can give them a choice of a couple things that you know they like.

SourceText: If your child cannot think of anything, you can give them a choice of a couple things that you know they like.
text: Uma ingabe yakho kungekho ekucabangayo, ungayinika izinto ezimbalwa engakhetha kuzo ekuthandayo.

SourceText: Listening to @fields.child_nickname is more important than talking to them at this time. If you do talk you should describe what @fields.child_nickname is doing. Use words to describe actions, colours, shapes, numbers, sizes, textures, temperatures, tastes, sounds, and anything else that is happening!
text: Ukulale u @fields.child_nickname kubaluleke kakhulu kunokukhuluma naye ngalesi sikhathi. Uma ukhuluma kumele uchaze lokho okwenziwa wu @fields.child_nickname. Sebenzisa amagama ukuchaza izenzo, imibala, izimo, izinombolo, osayizi, ukuthamba, amazinga okushisa, ukunambitha, imisindo, nanoma yini enye eyenzekayo!
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Listening to your child is more important than talking to them at this time. If you do talk you should describe what your child is doing. Use words to describe actions, colours, shapes, numbers, sizes, textures, temperatures, tastes, sounds, and anything else that is happening!
text: Ukulalela ingane kubaluleke kakhulu kunokukhuluma nayo ngalesi sikhathi. Uma kwenzeka ukhuluma kumele uchaze lokho okwenziwa yingane yakho. Sebenzisa amagama ukuchaza izenzo, imibala, izimo, izinombolo, osayizi, ukuthamba, amazinga okushisa, ukunambitha, imisindo, nanoma yini enye eyenzekayo!

SourceText: One-on-One Time with your child can be fun for you, too! You might even find that you feel less stressed after playing with @fields.child_nickname.

SourceText: Here is a comic on spending one-on-time with your teen.
text: Nansi indatshana ngokuchitha isikhathi senu nobabili nengane yakho!

SourceText: One-on-One Time with your teen helps build a positive and trusting relationship. When you really notice them and listen to what they are saying and what they like, you make them feel valued and appreciated.
text: Isikhathi Sokuthi Nibe Nobabili Ndawonye nengane yakho eyevile eshumini nesishiyagalombili ukwakha ubudlelwano obunokuthembana. Uma ubanaka futhi ubalalela nangezinto abazithandayo, ubeza bazizwe bebalulekile.

SourceText: Here are 6 tips on how to make One-on-One Time a positive experience for you and your teen:
text: Nanka amathiphu ayisithupha okwenza isikhathi osichitha nengane yakho esikhulile ndawonye sibe mnandi:

SourceText: 2. Let your teen choose the activity
text: 2. DLALA – Vumela ingane yakho ikhethe enizokwenza

SourceText: 3. Follow your teen's lead
text: 3. Landela ukuholwa ingane yakho eyevile eminyakeni eyishumi nesishiyagalombili

SourceText: 4. Give your teen your full attention
text: 4. Yinake ngokuphele ingane yakho eyevile eminyakeni eyishumi nesishiyagalombili

SourceText: 5. Show your teen you are really listening
text: 5 Khombisa ingane yakho esikhulile ukuthi uyilalele ngempela

text: Nansi i-video ngokuchitha isikhathi senu nobabili nengane yakho esikhulile!

SourceText: Here's an audio message about spending one-on-one time with your teen!
text: Nanku umyalezo oqoshiwe ngokuchitha isikhathi senu nobabili nengane yakho esikhulile!

SourceText: Fathers can have difficult relationships with their teenagers, it can be hard to find pleasure from spending time with them. Instead, we spend a lot of time disciplining them or complaining about how they are behaving.
text: Obaba bangathola ubunzima ngokuba nobudlelwano nezingane zabo esezikhulile, okungenza kube nzima ukuthokozela isikhathi nabo. Esikhundleni salokho, sichitha isikhathi esiningi sibayala noma sikhononda ngendlela abaziphatha ngayo.

SourceText: Mothers can have difficult relationships with their teenagers, it can be hard to find pleasure from spending time with them. Instead, we spend a lot of time disciplining them or complaining about how they are behaving.
text: Omama bangathola ubunzima ngokuba nobudlelwano nezingane zabo esezikhulile, okungenza kube nzima ukuthokozela isikhathi nabo. Esikhundleni salokho, sichitha isikhathi esiningi sibayala noma sikhononda ngendlela abaziphatha ngayo.

SourceText: When we have difficult relationships with our teenagers, it can be hard to find pleasure from spending time with them. Instead, we spend a lot of time disciplining them or complaining about how they are behaving.
text: Uma kunzima ukuba nobudlelwano nezingane zethu esezikhulile, kungenza kube nzima ukuthokozela isikhathi nabo. Esikhundleni salokho, sichitha isikhathi esiningi sibayala noma sikhononda ngendlela abaziphatha ngayo.

SourceText: That's okay! You can always type "Help" whenever you want to learn more about how to spend One-on-One Time with your teen. Chat to you later @fields.user_name!
text: Kulungile! Ungabhala u “Help” uma ufuna ukufunda kabanzi ngokuthi ungasichitha kanjani isikhathi nengane yakho. Siyobuye sikhulume @fields.user_name!

SourceText: Tell @fields.child_nickname that you would like to spend some time with them and that they can choose what to do or talk about. @fields.child_nickname might think this is weird at first but will come to enjoy having this dedicated time with you!
text: Tshela  u @fields.child_nickname ukuthi ungathanda ukuchitha isikhathi nabo nokuthi yibona abazokhetha ukuthi kwenziwani noma kukhulunywa ngani. U @fields.child_nickname angacabanga ukuthi lokhu akujwayelekile okokuqala kodwa uzigcina ekuthanda ukuba nesikhathi esikhethekile nawe!
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Tell your teen that you would like to spend some time with them and that they can choose what to do or talk about. Your teen might think this is weird at first but will come to enjoy having this dedicated time with you!
text: Tshela ingane yakho eyevile eminyakeni eyishumi nambili ukuthi ungathanda ukuchitha isikhathi nayo nokuthi ingakhetha lokho efuna ukukwenza noma efuna ukukhuluma ngakho. Ingase idideke ekuqaleni kodwa ngokuhamba kwesikhathi izokujabulela ukuchitha isikhathi nawe!

SourceText: Try to follow @fields.child_nickname's lead during One-on-One Time. Accept their suggestions. Remember this is @fields.child_nickname's activity. Your job is to show an interest and say something nice.
text: Zama ukulandela okwenziwa u @fields.child_nickname ngesikhathi senu nobabili. Yamukela lokho abakuphakamisayo. Khumbula ukuthi lona ngumdlalo ka @fields.child_nickname. Umsebenzi wakho wukukhombisa ukuthi uyawuthanda nokusho izinto ezinhle.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Try to follow your teen's lead during One-on-One Time. Accept their suggestions. Remember this is your teen's activity. Your job is to show an interest and say something nice.
text: Zama ukulandela okwenziwa yingane yakho uma ninesikhathi senu nobabili. Yamukela lokho abakuphakamisayo. Khumbula ukuthi lona ngumdlalo wengane yakho esikhulile. Umsebenzi wakho wukukhombisa ukuthi uyawuthanda nokusho izinto ezinhle.

SourceText: Set aside a specific time to spend One-on-One Time with @fields.child_nickname each day. Choose a time when you and @fields.child_nickname will not be interrupted and when @fields.child_nickname does not have something else that they want to do, like watching TV or playing with phones.
text: Beka eceleni isikhathi ozosichitha nabo esukwini. Khetha isikhathi lapho wena no @fields.child_nickname ningeke niphazamiseke nalapho u @fields.child_nickname engenayo enye into okumele ayenze, njengokubuka iTV noma ukudlala ngocingo.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Set aside a specific time to spend One-on-One Time with your teen each day. Choose a time when you and your teen will not be interrupted and when your teen does not have something else that they want to do, like watching TV or playing with phones.
text: Beka eceleni isikathi ozosichitha nengane yakho esikhulile ninobabili esukwini. Khetha isikhathi lapho wena nengane yakho endala ningeke niphazamiseke futhi kungekho into okumele yenziwe yingane yakho njengokubuka iTV noma ukudlala ngocingo.

SourceText: Try to do something different than watching TV or playing with a tablet/phone. However, you may need to at first join @fields.child_nickname and watch their favourite TV programme with them. They may feel comfortable doing other activities with time.
text: Zamani ukwenza okwehlukile nokubuka umabonakude noma ukudlala ngethebhulethi noma ucingo. Nokho, kungadingeka ukuba uqale ngokujoyina u @fields.child_nickname ubuke naye uhlelo lwakhe alukhonzile lweTV.  Kungenzeka bazizwe bekhululekile ukwenza ezinye izinto uma kuqhubeka isikhathi.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Try to do something different than watching TV or playing with a tablet/phone. However, you may need to at first join your teen and watch their favourite TV programme with them. They may feel comfortable doing other activities with time.
text: Zamani ukwenza okwehlukile nokubuka umabonakude noma ukudlala ngethebhulethi noma ucingo. Nokho kungadingeka ukuba uqale ujoyine ingane yakho ubuke nayo uhlelo lwayo elukhonzile lweTV.  Kungenzeka bazizwe bekhululekile ukwenza ezinye izinto uma kuqhubeka isikhathi.

SourceText: You can even try rephrasing back what @fields.child_nickname says when they speak to you. For example, when @fields.child_nickname says, “This math problem is really hard,” you can say, “Yeah, I see that you are finding it difficult.” It shows you are really listening to them and will make them feel supported.
text: Ungazama nokuthi usho ngenye indlela lokho u @fields.child_nickname akushoyo uma ekhuluma nawe. Isibonelo, uma u @fields.child_nickname ethi, “Le nkinga yesibalo inzima ngempela,: wena ungathi, “Yebo, ngiyabona ukuthi uyibona inzima.” Kukhombisa ukuthi uyabalalela futhi kuzobenza ukuthi bazizwe besekiwe.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: You can even try rephrasing back what your teen says when they speak to you. For example, when your teen says, “This math problem is really hard,” you can say, “Yeah, I see that you are finding it difficult.” It shows you are really listening to them and will make them feel supported.
text: Ungazama nokuthi usho ngenye indlela lokho ingane yakho ekushoyo uma ekhuluma nawe. Isibonelo, uma ingane yakho ithi, “Le nkinga yesibalo inzima ngempela,” wena ungathi, “Yebo, ngiyabona ukuthi uyibona inzima.” Kukhombisa ukuthi uyabalalela futhi kuzobenza ukuthi bazizwe besekiwe.

SourceText: 4. Give your teen all of your attention.
text: 4. Nikeza ingane yakho sonke isikhathi sakho

SourceText: Switch off the television and put away phones. Make sure you can give all of your attention to @fields.child_nickname.

text: Cisha umabonakude ubeke kude nezingcingo. Qinisekisa ukuthi uyinika konke ukunakwa ingane yakho esikhulile.

SourceText: Look at @fields.child_nickname. Nodding or “I see” shows @fields.child_nickname you are really paying attention. Accept what they are saying without judging them.

SourceText: One-on-One Time with your teen can be fun for you, too! You might even find that you feel less stressed after spending time with @fields.child_nickname.

SourceText: Parent (looks back to teen): “I understand it is hard to be separate from your friends. Especially since I am sure they are missing you, too. Let’s think of some ways that you could reach out to them.”
text:
Umzali (ubuka ingane yakhe esikhulile): “Ngiyazi kunzima ukuhlukana nabangani bakho. Ikakhulukazi ngoba ngiyazi ukuthi nabo bayakukhumbula.
 Ake sicabange izindlela ongabonana nabo ngazo.”

SourceText: Type "SOS" at any time if you would like the details of emergency services or other hotlines. Remember everything you say will be completely private!
text: Bhala “SOS” noma nini uma ufuna imininingwane yezimo eziphuthumayo noma ezinye izinombolo zosizo. Khumbula yonke okushoyo kuzogcinwa kuyimfihlo!

text: Kumele uziqhenye ngokufuna izindlela ongathola ngazo usizo wena nomndeni wakho!

SourceText: Do you need some support with an emotional issue?
text: Ngabe udinga usizo mayelana nesimo esikuhlukumeza emoyeni?

text: Ngabe udinga usizo oluphuthumayo?
