SourceText: Would you like to go back to the previous messages?
text: Ngabe ufisa ukubuyela emiyalezweni yaphambilini?

SourceText: That's okay. Remember you can always type "Help" if you ever need extra support. Chat later!
text: Kulungile! Khumbula ukuthi noma nini ungabhala “Usizo” uma udinga olunye isizo. Masibuye sikhulume!

SourceText: Quick tip: It can be difficult to know how to talk to your children about something like COVID-19, especially since we are learning about it too.
text: Ithiphu esheshayo: Kungaba nzima ukwazi ukuthi ungakhuluma kanjani nezingane zakho ngezinto ezifana neCOVID-19, ikakhulukazi njengoba nathi sisafunda ngayo.

SourceText: The important thing is to be open and listen to your children. Be honest and supportive. Show them that you care.
text: Kubalulekile ukuvuleleka nokulalela izingane zakho. Yethembeka futhi ubeseke. Bakhombise ukuthi unendaba nabo.

SourceText: Quick tip: It is really hard to help our children continue learning when schools are closed or part-open. One thing that might be helpful is to try and set up a daily schedule that includes time for schoolwork and time for fun.
text: Ithiphu esheshayo: Kunzima ukusiza izingane zethu ziqhubeke nokufunda uma izikole zivaliwe  Into eyodwa engaba wusizo wukuzama ukubeka uhlelo lwansukuzonke olubandakanya isikhathi somsebenzi wesikole nesikhathi sokudlala.

SourceText: Quick tip: Caring for yourself is really important. Take five deep breaths when you feel overwhelmed. Try talking to a friend, or doing something relaxing for yourself? You deserve it!
text: Ithiphu esheshayo: Ukuzinakekela kubalulekile ngempela. Donsa umoya kakhulu kahlanu uma uzizwa inengcindezi. Zama ukukhuluma nomngani, noma wenze okuthile okuzokhulula umoya wakho? Kukufanele lokhu!

SourceText: Quick tip: All children, including those living with disabilities, need love, respect and time especially at difficult times.
text: Ithiphu esheshayo: Zonke izingane, okubalwa lezo eziphila nokukhubazeka, zidinga uthando, inhlonipho nesikhathi ikakhulukazi ezikhathini ezinzima.

SourceText: Quick tip: This is a stressful time for all of us. When a problem comes up, talk about it together! What is the problem exactly? What different solutions are there and what are the consequences of one? That way, you can find a solution that can be OK for everyone.
text: Ithiphu esheshayo: Lesi yisikhathi esinengcindezi kithina sonke. Uma kuvela inkinga, khulumani ngayo ndawonye! Iyiphi kahle hle inkinga? Yiziphi izixazululo esikhona kanti yimiphi imiphumela yesixazululo ngasinye? Ngaleyo ndlela, ungathola isixazululo esingafanela wonke umuntu.

SourceText: Quick tip: It is normal to be stressed about money. Talk to your children about how much money comes in and what you spend money on as a family each month. When everyone sees where the money goes, it is easier to agree on where you can save money together!
text: Ithiphu esheshayo: Kujwayelekile ukukhathazwa yindaba yemali. Khuluma nezingane zakho ngokuthi ingakanani imali engenayo nokuthi imali niyisebenzisa kanjani niwumndeni inyanga ngayinye. Wonke umuntu uyabona ukuthi imali iyaphi, kulula ukuvumelana ukuthi ningayonga kanjani imali ndawonye!

SourceText: Here's another tip! A daily stress-reducer can help us with parenting, and make us feel better.  Let’s start with 30 seconds of relaxation for yourself. You deserve this!
text: Nansi enye ithiphu! Yinto eyehlisa ingcindezi nsuku zonke engasisiza ngokuba ngabazali, isenze sizizwe singcono.  Masiqala ngokuthi uphumule imizuzwana engu-30. Kukufanele lokhu!

SourceText: Would you like to receive this activity now?
text: Ungathanda ukuthola ngalokhu manje?

SourceText: That's Ok! You can always type "Relax" whenever you want an activity to help you with stress.
text: Kulungile! Ngabhala u “Help” uma udinga ozokwenza ukubhekana nengcindezi.

SourceText: Quick tip: All children misbehave. One thing that can help is to praise @fields.child_nickname anytime that they do something good – however small. They may not look like they want your praise but they still really, really do.

SourceText: Quick tip: When you give your baby your full attention, you make them feel secure and loved. Try to spend at least 20 minutes a day playing with @fields.child_nickname. Switch off the television and put away phones. Make it fun!

SourceText: Parenting is really hard. But there are things we can do to make things easier. We are here to help!

SourceText: Parenting is really hard. But there are things we can do to make things easier. I am here to help!

SourceText: That's okay! The more you pay attention to what @fields.child_nickname is doing, the easier it will be to catch the bad behaviour before it gets worse and redirect it to a positive behaviour. SourceText: Sorry to hear that you are finding this challenging. If you think your child is accessing information online which is not age appropriate discuss with them why you have concerns, and why you are not comfortable. Try having your child involved in the conversation and get them to share their views. Having an open conversation is important, and children are more likely to stick to decisions if they feel that they are fair and their opinions have been heard.
text: Ngiyaxolisa ukuzwa ukuthi lokhu ukuthola kuyinselelo. Uma ungaqiniseki ngemithetho okumelwe uyibeke, ningavumelana nengane yakho eyevile eminyakeni eyishumi nambili ngokuthi nizame umthetho omusha amasonto amabili bese nixoxa ngokuthi izinto zihamba kanjani bese nishintsha umthetho uma kudingeka!

SourceText: Hi! Are you having any challenges coping when you baby is crying?
text: Sawubona! Ngabe unezinselelo ekubhekaneni nengane yakho uma ikhala?

SourceText: It is completely normal to feel overwhelmed as a parent. All parents feel this way. Try calling a family member or a friend. Sometimes just talking with someone is enough, but if you still feel overwhelmed, ask someone for help. Calling for help is a sign of strength. You can do this!
text: Kuyinto evamile ukuthi uzizwe udiniwe njengomzali. Bonke abazali bazizwa kanje. Zama ukushayela ilungu lomndeni noma umngani. Kwesinye isikhathi ukukhuluma nje nomunye umuntu kuyasiza, kodwa uma uzizwa sengathi uyehluleka, cela usizo. Ukucela usizo kuwuphawu lwamandla. Ungakwazi ukukwenza lokhu.

SourceText: Great to hear that you are able to manage this @fields.user_name. This isn't easy so praise yourself for coping!
text: Kuhle ukuzwa ukuthi uyakwazi ukubhekana no @fields.user_name. Lokhu akulula ngakho zincome ngokumelana nakho!

SourceText: It is completely normal to experience this, it can be really hard to stay calm when @fields.child_nickname'sis crying but do not give up! Try to think of something that you can do that might help you, like taking a couple deep breaths. This can help reduce stress and clear your mind.

Taking a pause will help you respond better. Check on @fields.child_nickname every 5-10 minutes.

SourceText: Parents all over the world say they worry about keeping their children safe in the community and online.
text: Abazali emhlabeni wonke bathi bakhathazeka ngokugcina izingane zabo ziphephile emphakathini.

SourceText: Would you like some tips on some simple ways to do this?
text: Uyawadinga amathiphu ezindlela ezilula zokwenza lokhu?

SourceText: That's okay! You can always type "Help" if you want to learn more about how to how to keep your child safe in the community.
text: Kulungile! Ngabhala uthi “Help” njalo uma ufuna ukufunda kabanzi ngokuthi ungayigcina kanjani ingan yakho iphephile emphakathini.

SourceText: Thanks! One helpful way is to create a map with your child or teen that identifies the safe and unsafe places in the community. Here are 3 simple steps:
text: Ngiyabonga! Enye indlela ephephile yokwenza imephu nengane yakho ekhulile ekhomba izindawo eziphephile nezingaphephile emphakathini wangakini. Nazi izinyathelo ezintathu:

SourceText: 1. Draw a map of the important places in the community
text: 1. Dweba imephu yezindawo ezibalulekile emphakathini wangakini

SourceText: 2. Identify which places are safe and unsafe
text: 2. Khomba izindawo eziphephile nezingaphephanga

SourceText: 3. Learn about where you can get support
text: 3. Funda ngokuthi ungalutholaphi usizo

SourceText: 4. Online map
text: 4. Imephu ye-inthanethi

SourceText: Type "1" to "4" to learn more about how you can do this activity with your children. Type "N" to stop this tip.
text: Bhala “1” kuya ku “4” ukufunda kabanzi ngokuthi ungawenza kanjani lo msebenzi nengane yakho. Bhala u “N” ukumisa le thiphu.

SourceText: Step 4: Online map
text: Isinyathelo 4: Imephu ye-inthanethi

SourceText: • Draw pictures of the apps and websites they use
text: * Dweba izithombe zama-app namawebusayithi abawasebenzisayo.

SourceText: • Praise your child for how good they are at using the web!
text: * Ncoma ingane yakho ngokusebenzisa kahle lawa mawebusayithi!

SourceText: • Talk about which ones might be unsafe. Why?
text: * Khulumani ngokuthi yimaphi okungenzeka akaphephile. Kungani?

SourceText: • Are there plans you could make together to make using the internet safer for your child and their friends?
text: Ngabe zikhona izinhlelo eningazenza ndawonye ukwenza ukusebenzisa i-inthanethi kuphephe enganeni yakho nabangani bayo?

SourceText: • It can really help for parents to learn about this in advance.
text: Kungasiza ngempela kubazali ukufunda ngalokhu kusenesikhathi.

SourceText: Please select another number if you want to learn more about how to create a map with your child or teen that identifies the safe and unsafe places in the community:

SourceText: When we are reminded of such situations, it is normal to feel upset or angry . It is important to find a time when you are calm, so you can think of what support you need: You may need to talk to someone.

SourceText: It is completely normal to experience this challenge, this is difficult stuff to talk about. Find a calm time. You can say that we hope these things never happen, but it’s like getting insurance – it's best to think about them and be prepared.

Zama ukuphinde uthole isikhathi sokwenza lo msebenzi futhi. Kulokhu, zama ukulalela futhi ubonise ukuthi uyayiqonda ingane ngaphambi kokusho okucabangayo.

SourceText: That is a completely normal experience, it is shocking to learn that people who are close to us and who we trust may be a danger to our children. Find someone you can talk to about this, perhaps a friend or support service, so you can get the support your need. Remember to take a pause when you are stressed.
text: Lokhu kuyinto ejwayelekile, kuyashaqisa ukuthola ukuthi abantu abasondele kithi nesibethembayo bangaba yingozi zinganeni yethu. Thola othile ongakhuluma naye ngalokhu, mhlawumbe umngane noma abahlinzeka ngokweseka, ukuze uthole usizo oludingayo. Khumbula ukuthatha ikhefu lapho ucindezelekile.

SourceText: Sorry to hear that you are finding this challenging. Our children may know things about our communities and technology that we are not aware of. When we actively involve our children in the mapping activity, they feel heard and valued, and it can be easier to come up with a plan that everyone agrees on.
text: Ngiyaxolisa ukuzwa ukuthi lokhu ukuthola kuyinselelo. Intsha yethu ingase yazi izinto esingazazi thina mayelana nemiphakathi yethu kanye nezobuchwepheshe. Lapho sihilela intsha yethu ekubekeni imithetho yendawo, izizwa ilalelwa futhi ibalulekile, futhi kungaba lula ukuza necebo elamukelwa yiwo wonke umuntu.

SourceText: It is difficult to know every detail about our communities. Involve another family member or friend in your mapping activity. You can even visit some of the services available and ask what they do. The more we know, the better we can keep our families safe!
text: Kunzima ukwazi yonke imininingwane ngemiphakathi yethu. Bandakanya elinye ilungu lomndeni noma umngane lapho ubeka imithetho yendawo. Ungavakashela nezinye zezinkonzo ezikhona futhi ubuze ukuthi zenzani. Kuba ngcono lapho kukuningi esikwaziyo ukuze sigcine imindeni yethu iphephile!

SourceText: It can be hard to find time during your day, with work, chores, and everything else. Can you think of a time this week when you can spend at least 10 minutes chatting to your child or teen about safe and unsafe areas? This is really important!
text: Akulula ukuthola isikhathi phakathi nosuku, ngenxa yomsebenzi, imisebenzi yasekhaya kanye nakho konke okunye. SourceText: It is completely normal to experience this. Try creating a safe space to talk with @fields.child_nickname when you are both calm. Listen to their thoughts about why they feel a certain place is safe, and then share your thoughts on why you feel it is not safe. Think about making a rule together that allows them to still have fun but stay safe. Our children will listen better when we speak to them calmly.

SourceText: Sometimes, our children can have very violent tantrums when they do not get their way, especially if they are used to it. Try to move @fields.child_nickname to a place where they will not hurt themselves or others. You may need to firmly hold @fields.child_nickname while ignoring their behaviour - but only do this if you can remain calm and make sure you are not hurting them! Eventually, @fields.child_nickname will calm down.
text: Ngezinye izikhathi, izingane zethu zingazibhuquza ngendlela enodlame uma zingakutholi ezikufunayo, ikakhulukazi uma sezikujwayele. SourceText: Sometimes, our children can have very violent tantrums when they do not get their way, especially if they are used to it. Try to move your child to a place where they will not hurt themselves or others. You may need to firmly hold your child while ignoring their behaviour - but only do this if you can remain calm and make sure you are not hurting them! Eventually, your child will calm down.
text: Ngezinye izikhathi, izingane zethu zingazibhuquza ngendlela enodlame uma zingakutholi ezikufunayo, ikakhulukazi uma sezikujwayele. Zama ukususa ingane yakho uyiyise endaweni lapho ingene izilimaze noma ilimaze abanye. Kungenzeka kundingeke uyibambe uyiqinise ingane yakho ngesikhathi uziba ukuziphatha kwayo - kodwa lokhu kwenze uma uzokwazi ukwehlisa umoya uqinisekise ukuthi kawuyilimazi! Maduze, ingane yakho izokwehlisa umoya.

SourceText: Hi! Were you able to have a conversation with your child or teen about COVID-19?

SourceText: It is completely normal to feel uncomfortable, confused, or even scared. Everyone feels this way at times. The WHO and UNICEF and websites and local COVID-19 hotlines are great places to find advice on how you and your family can stay safe during COVID-19.
text: Kujwayelekile ukuthi ungazizwa ungakhululekile, udidekile noma wethukile. Wonke umuntu uzizwa kanje ngesinye isikhathi. I-WHO ne-UNICEF namawebhusayithi nezinombolo eziphuthumayo zeCOVID-19 yizindawo ezisemqoka zokuthola iseluleko sokuthi ningaphepha kanjani wena nomndeni wakho ngesikhathi seCOVID-19.

SourceText: It is completely normal for children to act out or react negatively during these unprecedented times. Give them space to share how they are feeling and let them know you are there for them. You can also try distracting them with fun activities and games.
text: Kuyinto ejwayelekile ezinganeni ukuhlupha noma ukungenzi izinto ezilungile ngalesi sikhathi esingakaze sibonakale phambilini. Banikeze ithuba lokusho ukuthi bazizwa kanjani bese uyaqinisekisa ukuthi uzoba khona ubabheke. Ungazama ukubaphazamisa ngeminye imidlalo nezinto ezimnandi.

SourceText: Lovely! Take a breath just to appreciate the moment.

SourceText: Everyone has challenging days, but you do not need experience it alone. Try reaching out to family and friends for support.
text: Wonke umuntu uba nezinsuku ezingemnandi, kodwa akumele lokho ubhekane nakho uwedwa. Zama ukuya emndenini nasebanganini uyocela usizo.

SourceText: It is completely normal to feel okay. You do not need to feel great everyday.
text: Kuyinto evamile ukuthi uzizwe ungenalutho. Akudingeki ukuthi zonke izinsu uzizwe kahle.

SourceText: Life is filled with ups and downs. It is important to recognise and accept how are you feeling. Please remember to be kind to yourself.
text: Impilo inezikhathi ezimbi nezinhle. Kubalulekile ukuqonda nokwamukela indlela ozizwa ngayo. Khumbula ukuba nomusa kuwena siqu.

SourceText: Thank you for sharing! All feelings, whether they are good, bad, or okay are welcome here.
text: Siyabonga ngokwabelana nathi! Yonke imizwa, noma ngabe mihle noma mibi, noma ayinalutho yamukelekile lapha.

SourceText: We are made to feel different emotions, and learning to identify them is a great skill. Good job! You know we are here to support you.
text: Sakhiwe ngendlela yokuthi sibe nemizwa, kanti ukufunda ukuyiqonda kuyikhono elihle kakhulu. Umsebenzi omuhle! Silapha ukuze sikusekele.

SourceText: Thank you for sharing how you are feeling today. If you would like, try this relaxation activity that can help recenter and ground your emotions.
text: Siyabonga ukusitshela ukuthi uzizwa kanjani namuhla. Uthanda, zama lokhu okukhulula umzimba okungakusiza ukubuyisa nokuzinzisa imizwa yakho.

SourceText: Thank you for sharing how you are feeling. Is there anything someone can do to help you feeling better? If so, try reaching out to them, a support system is so important.
text: Siyabonga ukusitshela ukuthi uzizwa kanjani. Ngabe kukhona umuntu angakwenza ukukusiza uzizwe kangcono? Uma kunjalo, zama ukuya kuyena, kubalulekile ukuba nabantu abazokweseka.

SourceText: We have all experienced difficult days, but remember its important to experience all emotions. Try to do something that can help you feel better, like going for a walk or talking to someone you care about.
text: Sonke siyaba nezinsuku ezimbi, kodwa khumbula ukuthi kubalulekile ukuzwa yonke leyo mizwa. Zama ukwenza into ezokwenza uzizwe ungcono, njengokuhamba noma ukukhuluma nomuntu omkhonzile.

SourceText: That is excellent news. When you feel good, your family around you also feels good!
text: Lezo yizindaba ezimnandi kakhulu. Uma uzizwa kahle, nabantu abakuzungezile nabo bazizwa kahle!

SourceText: We all experience days where we just feel fine, and that is completely okay!
text: Sonke siyabhekana nezinsuku lapho sizizwa singenalutho, kanti lokho nakho kuhle kakhulu!

SourceText: You should not feel pressured to feel happy and great all the time. All feelings are valid and healthy!
text: Akumele ube nengcindezi yokufuna ukuhlala ujabule ngaso sonke isikhathi. Yonke imizwa ilungile futhi inempilo!

SourceText: Feeling okay is perfectly normal. Try asking how your family members are feeling today. This can help everyone to understand each other better.
text: Ukuzizwa ungenalutho nakho kuyinto ejwayelekile nje. Zama ukubuza amalungu omndeni wakho ukuthi azizwa kanjani namuhla. Lokhu kungasiza wonke umuntu aqondane kangcono.

SourceText: Part of keeping healthy is allowing yourself to feel all your emotions: the good, the bad, and the ones in the middle.
text: Ingxenye yokuzigcina uphilile wukuvumela ukuba uyizwe yonke imizwa yakho: emihle, emibi naleyo ephakathi nendawo.

SourceText: There are days when we just go with the flow and it is completely perfect.
text: Kunezinsuku lapho sivele siqhubeke nokuqhubekayo kanti kuyinto enhle kabi.

SourceText: It is completely normal to not feel great all the time. Parents all around the world have felt how you are feeling right now, and it is okay! You are doing great!
text: Kujwayelekile nje ukungazizwa kahle ngesinye isikhathi. Abazali emhlabeni jikelele bake bazizwa ngendlela ozizwa ngayo manje, kanti akunankinga! Wenza kahle kakhulu!

SourceText: Just like everyone else, you are allowed to have days where they are not feeling great. Be gentle and patient with yourself. Tomorrow is a new day!
text: Njengawo wonke umuntu uvumelekile ukuba nezinsuku ongekho mnandi ngazo. Ungazigqilazi futhi zinike isikhathi Kusasa kuzobe kuwusuku olusha!

SourceText: Having a bad day is not a reflection of your abilities or of you as a parent. Just showing up shows you care.
text: Ukuba nosuku olubi akukhombisi ikhono lakho noma wena njengomzali. Ukuvela nje kukhombisa ukuthi unendaba.

SourceText: We all have difficult days that make us feel upset. Remember to be kind to yourself and others during these days. How you are feeling is not a representation of your abilities!
text: Sonke sinezinsuku ezinzima ezisenza sizizwe sidiniwe. Khumbula ukuba nomusa kuwena nabanye ngalezi zinsuku. Ukuthi uzizwa kanjani akukhombisi ikhono lakho!

SourceText: We all have bad days, and we know it can sometimes be difficult to deal with your emotions. Learning how to cope with them in a posiitve way, sets you aside from others. If you have a few minutes to spare, use them to take care of yourself and focus on your breathing. Take this time to reflect on your feelings and try and redirect these emotions into something positive.
text: Sonke siba nezinsuku ezimbi, futhi siyazi ukuthi ngesinye isikhathi kungaba nzima ukubhekana nemizwa yakho. Ukufunda ukubhekana nayo ngendlela enhle, kukwenza wehluke kwabanye. Uma unemizuzwana embalwa ongayichitha, yisebenzise ukuzinakekela nokugxila ekuphfumuleni. Thatha lesi sikhathi ukubheka imizwa yakho uzame ukushintsha imizwa yakho ibe sesimweni esihle.

SourceText: Learning to identify and accept your emotions will allow you to build a stronger relationship with yourself, your family and your community. Well done!
text: Ukufunda ukukhomba nokwamukela imizwa yakho izokuvumela ukwakha ubudlelwane obuhle newena, umndeni wakho nomphakathi wakho. Wenze kahle!

SourceText: Here is a short relaxation activity for you:
text: Nakhu ongakwenza kafushane ukuziphumuza:

SourceText: Do you ever feel something so strongly that you want to run away from it? Here's a short activity that might help!
text: Ingabe kunomuzwa owuzwayo onamandla okwenza ufune ukuwubalekela? Nakhu ongakwenza kafushane okungasiza!

SourceText: This activity uses the magic power of three breaths to stay connected and relaxed.
text: Lesi senzo sisebenzisa amandla omlingo wokuphefumula kathathu ukuze uhlale uxhumekile futhi ukhululekile.

SourceText: Here's an activity to relax your body:
text: Nakhu ongakwenza ukuze uphumuze umzimba wakho:

SourceText: Here is a quick relaxation activity...
text: Nakhu ongakwenza ukuziphumuza kafushane...

SourceText: How many sounds can you hear? Listen to the sounds inside and outside the room. Count them on your fingers.
text: Mingaki imisindo okwazi ukuyizwa? Lalela imisindo engaphakathi nengaphandle kwegumbi. Yibale ngeminywe yakho.

SourceText: Try again for another ten seconds. Did you hear any new sounds? Did you hear any sounds inside your own body? Notice how you feel now.
text: Phinde uzame futhi eminye imizuzwana eyishumi. Ingabe ikhona eminye imisindo emisha oyizwile? Ingabe ikhona imisindo oyizwile engaphakathi komzimba wakho? Qaphela indlela ozizwa ngayo manje.

SourceText: Breathe in to the count of three.
text: Donsa umoya ube ubala uze ufike ku-3.

SourceText: Instead of moving away from the feeling, let’s move towards it for a moment.
text: Kunokuba ubalekele indlela ozizwa ngayo, ake sisondele kuyo okwesikhashana.

SourceText: It’s ok. Close your eyes if you feel comfortable. Take a deep breath.
text: Kulungile. Vala amehlo akho uma uzizwa ukhululekile. Donsa umoya kakhulu.

SourceText: Become curious. Where are you feeling it in your body? Is it hot or cold? Hard or soft? Tight or loose?
text: Yiba nelukuluku. Ukuzwa kuphi emzimbeni wakho? Ingabe kuyashisa noma kuyabanda? Kuqinile noma kuthambile? Kubophekile noma kukhululekile?

SourceText: Ask yourself some questions. What is it telling me? What does it need? How can I be kind to myself in this moment?
text: Zibuze imibuzo ethile. Kungitshela ini? Kudinga ini? Ngingaba kanjani nomusa kimi njengamanje?

SourceText: If your mind starts to wander, it’s normal. Just bring it back to the feeling. Keep breathing and feeling.
text: Uma umqondo wakho uthanda ukuduka, kujwayelekile. Ubuyisele kulowo muzwa onawo. Qhubeka nokuphefumula nokulalela umuzwa wakho.

SourceText: Reassure yourself. It’s ok to feel. Feeling is healing!
text: Ziqinisekise wena. Kulungile ukuba nomuzwa. Imizwa iyelapha!

SourceText: Notice your connection with the ground beneath you.
text: Qaphela ukuxhumana kwakho nomhlaba onyathele kuwo.

SourceText: What parts of your body touch the ground? What parts of your body don’t?
text: Yiziphi izitho zomzimba wakho izithinta umhlaba? Yiziphi izitho zomzimba wakho ezingawuthinti?

SourceText: Notice where it feels warm and where it feels cool.
text: Qaphela lapho kuzwakala kufudumele khona nalapho kuzwakala kubanda khona.

SourceText: Feel the ground underneath you supporting you. Let your body sink into the support of the ground.
text: Yizwa umhlabathi omi kuwo okusekelayo. Vumela umzimba wakho uzinze osizweni oluthola emhlabeni omi kuwo.

SourceText: Breathe in to the count of three. 1, 2, 3.
text: Donsa umoya ube ubala uze ufike ku-3. 1, 2, 3.

SourceText: Breath out to the count of three. 1, 2, 3.
text: Khipha umoya ube ubala uze ufike ku-3. 1, 2, 3.

SourceText: Sit comfortably and close your eyes if you can.
text: Hlala ngokunethezeka bese uvala amehlo akho uma ukwazi.

SourceText: Imagine a golden ring scanning your body from your feet to your head.
text: Cabanga indilinga yegolide ihlola umzimba wakho kusukela ezinyaweni ize iyofika ekhanda.

SourceText: Pay attention as it moves up and down your body. Are there any areas that feel tense? Numb? Painful?
text: Naka njengoba ikhuphuka iphinde yehle emzimbeni wakho. Ingabe zikhona izindawo ozizwa ziqinile? Zindikindiki? Zibuhlungu?

SourceText: Focus on those areas for a moment. Breathe in to the area and when you breathe out, try to let go of any tension or pain.
text: Gxila kulezo zindawo isikhashana. Donsa umoya uye kuleyo ndawo bese kuthi lapho ukhipha umoya, uzame ukudedela lokho kuqina noma ubuhlungu.

SourceText: Do this for a few breaths.
text: Yenza lokhu izikhathi ezimbalwa odonsa ngazo umoya.

SourceText: Open your eyes. How does your body feel now?
text: Vula amehlo akho. Umzimba wakho uzizwa kanjani manje?

SourceText: Try this next time you find yourself lying in bed unable to sleep!
text: Ungakuzama lokhu esikhathini esizayo uma uzithola ulele embhedeni ungafikelwa ubuthongo!

SourceText: Listen to the sounds.
text: Lalela imisindo esegumbini.

SourceText: Connection with the ground.
text: Ukuxhumana nephansi.

SourceText: Notice how you feel now.
text: Qaphela indlela ozizwa ngayo manje.

SourceText: How do you feel now? Do you feel any different? Deep breathing helps our whole body and mind to calm down.
text: Uzizwa kanjani? Ingabe ukhona umehluko owuzwayo? Ukudonsa kakhulu umoya kusiza wonke umzimba kanye nengqondo ukuba kuzole.

SourceText: Dealing with difficult feelings.
text: Ukubhekana nemizwa enzima.

SourceText: Body relaxation.
text: Ukukhulula umzimba.

SourceText: It’s ok to feel. Feeling is healing!
text: Kulungile ukuba nomuzwa. Imizwa iyelapha!

SourceText: Let’s use the magic power of three to stay present and relax. At the end of a tough day, thinking of three things to be grateful for can help us find the courage to try again tomorrow.
text: Masisebenzisa amandla omlingo ezinto ezintathu ukuze ube nokuthula futhi uzole. Ekupheleni kosuku olunzima, ukucabanga ngezinto ezintathu ongabonga ngazo kungakusiza uthole isibindi sokuzama futhi kusasa.

SourceText: Here's a short relaxation activity to end the day:
text: Nakhu ongakwenza kafushane ukuziphumuza:

SourceText: Let's take a moment to stop what you are doing and connect with your breath.
text: Zinike isikhathi uyeke lokho okwenzayo bese uxhumana nokuphefumula kwakho.

SourceText: What is one thing you can be grateful for right now?
text: Iyiphi into eyodwa ongabonga ngayo njengamanje?

SourceText: What is one thing that brings you happiness?
text: Iyiphi into eyodwa ekwenza ujabule?

SourceText: What is one thing that you love?
text: Iyiphi into eyodwa oyithandayo?

SourceText: They don't have to be big. Sometimes the small things in life count the most!
text: Akudingeki kube yizinto ezinkulu. Ngezinye izikhathi izinto ezincane ekuphileni yizona ezibaluleke kakhulu!

SourceText: At the end of the day, take a minute to think about the day.
text: Ekupheleni kosuku, thatha umzuzwana ucabange ngosuku lwakho.

SourceText: Think about one positive or fun thing you did.
text: Cabanga ngento eyodwa enhle noma emnandi oyenzile.

SourceText: Think of one thing you can do differently tomorrow.
text: Cabanga ngento eyodwa ongayenza ngendlela ehlukile kusasa.

SourceText: Think of one thing that you are grateful for.
text: Cabanga into eyodwa obongayo ngayo.

SourceText: Do you sometimes feel like you are getting everything wrong?  Here's a short activity that might help!
text: Ngabe ngesinye isikhathi uke uzizwe sengathi wenza yonke into ngokungekhona?  Nakhu ongakwenza kafushane okungasiza!

SourceText: The magic power of three.
text: Amandla omlingo ka-3.

SourceText: Close your eyes and think about the day. Name 1 thing that you are grateful for. Name 1 thing that you did well. Name 1 think that you love. You earned a goodnight of sleep!
text: Vala amehlo akho bese ucabanga ngosuku. Yisho into eyodwa obongayo ngayo. Yisho into eyodwa oyenze kahle. Yisho into eyodwa oyithandayo. Ukufanele ukulala uphumule!

SourceText: Take a moment to think over the day. Think of one thing you did today that you are proud of.
text: Thatha umzuzwana ucabange usuku lwakho. Cabanga into eyodwa oyenzile namuhla ongaziqhenyi ngayo.

SourceText: Wrap your arms around your body and give yourself a hug.
text: Zibambe ngezingalo zakho emzimbeni bese uyazanga.

SourceText: Think of one thing you did today that you don’t feel proud of. What can you do differently tomorrow?
text: Njengamanje cabanga into eyodwa oyenzile namuhla ongaziqhenyi ngayo.  Yini ongayenza ngokwehlukile kusasa?

SourceText: And wrap your arms around your body and give yourself a hug.
text: Zibambe ngezingalo zakho emzimbeni bese uyazanga.

SourceText: Connect with your breath.
text: Xhumana nomphefumulo wakho.

SourceText: Take a minute to think about the day.
text: Zinike umzuzu ukuze ucabange ngosuku.

SourceText: End of the day.
text: Ukuphela kosuku.

SourceText: Be kind to yourself.
text: Yiba nomusa kuwena.

SourceText: You earned a goodnight of sleep!
text: Ukufanele ukulala uphumule!

SourceText: It’s ok. You are doing your best so be kind to yourself. Get some rest and try again tomorrow!
text: Kulungile. Wenza konke okusemandleni ukuba nomusa kuwena. Ake uphumule uzobuye uzame futhi kusasa!

SourceText: Do your children ever make you feel like screaming? Give yourself a 10-second pause.
text: Ingabe izingane zakho zike zikwenze uzizwe sengathi ungahayiza? Zinike ikhefana lemizuzwana eyishumi.

SourceText: Have you only got 30 seconds? Let's take a quick pause together. It might be helpful.
text: Ngabe unemizuzwana ewu-30 kuphela? Ake sithathe ikhefu elisheshayo ndawonye. Kungaba wusizo.

SourceText: Do you sometimes feel your feelings are too much?
text: Ngabe ngesinye isikhathi uye uzwe sengathi imizwa yakho iyakweqa?

SourceText: Talk to someone.
text: Khuluma nothize.

SourceText: Talk to someone you trust. Talk to a friend. Talk to family. Talk to a plant.
text: Khuluma nomuntu omethembayo. Khuluma nomngane Khuluma nomndeni. Khuluma nesitshalo

SourceText: Get your worries off your chest and then let them go. Even if it’s just for a moment.
text: Khipha izinkinga zakho esifubeni uzidedele zihambe. Ngisho ngabe okomzuzwana.

SourceText: How do you feel now?
text: Uzizwa kanjani manje?

SourceText: A joy shared is twice the joy. A problem shared is half the problem.
text: Ukwabelana ngenjabulo kuzo injabulo kabili. Ukwabelana ngenkinga kusho uhhafu wenkinga.

SourceText: Here is something fun to help you let go of stress:
text: Nakhu okuthile okumnandi okungakusiza uqede ukucindezeleka:

SourceText: Sit down, close your eyes and listen to your breath as it goes in and out. Notice how you feel. When you are ready open your eyes again.
text: Hlala phansi, uvale amehlo akho bese ulalela ukuphefumula kwakho njengoba umoya ungena uphuma. Qaphela indlela ozizwa ngayo. Lapho usukulungele phinde uvule amehlo akho.

SourceText: Breath in and out slowly 5 times. Then try responding in a calmer way.
text: Donsa umoya uwukhiphe kancane kancane izikhathi ezingu-5. Yibe usuzama ukuphendula ngendlela ezolile.

SourceText: Choose a song that reflects what you need in this moment. Do you need a gentle song to soothe your tired soul or an upbeat song to help you shake some stress out?
text: Khetha ingoma ebonisa lokho okudingayo njengamanje. Ingabe udinga ingoma epholile ukuze iwotawote umphefumulo wakho okhathele noma ingoma enesigqi esiphezulu ezokusiza ususe ukucindezeleka?

SourceText: Make a space and move your body to the music. Remember to breathe while you move. Let your breath and the movement go together.
text: Vula isikhala bese udansela umculo. Khumbula ukuphefumula njengoba udansa. Vumela ukuphefumula nokudansa kwakho kuhambisane.

SourceText: Even a few minutes of movement can be enough to release stress and lift your mood!
text: Imizuzu embalwa yokudansa inganela ukuqeda ukucindezeleka futhi ikwenze uzizwe ungcono!

SourceText: Choose a song that reflects what you need.
text: Khetha ingoma ebonisa lokho okudingayo njengamanje.

SourceText: Five deep breaths.
text: Ukuphefumula kakhulu kahlanu.

SourceText: Listen to your breath.
text: Lalela ukuphefumula yakho

SourceText: When feelings are too much.
text: Uma imizwa isikweqa ngaphezulu.

SourceText: Millions of parents say this helps - A LOT.
text: Izigidi zabazali zithi lokhu kuyasiza - KAKHULU.

SourceText: Try this whenever you are feeling stressed and you need a break to reconnect.
text: Zama lokhu noma nini lapho uzizwa ucindezelekile futhi udinga ukuthatha ikhefu ukuze uzole.

SourceText: That's wonderful! We are happy to hear that you are feeling good.
text: Kuhle kakhulu lokho! Siyajabula ukuzwa ukuthi uzizwa kangcono.

SourceText: That's wonderful! I am happy to hear that you are feeling good.
text: Kuhle kakhulu lokho! Ngiyajabula ukuthi uzizwa kahle!

SourceText: We are sorry to hear that you are not feeling great today. Remember to take it one day at the time. Tomorrow is a new day.
text: Siyaxolisa ukuzwa ukuthi awuzizwa kahle namuhla. Khumbula ukuthatha usuku nosuku ngesikhathi. Kusasa kuzobe kuwusuku olusha!

SourceText: I am sorry to hear that you are not feeling great today. Remember to take it one day at the time. Tomorrow is a new day.
text: Siyaxolisa ukuzwa ukuthi awuzizwa kahle namuhla. Khumbula ukuthatha usuku nosuku ngesikhathi. Kusasa kuzobe kuwusuku olusha!

SourceText: Hooray! We are delighted to hear that you are doing well.
text: Halala! Ngiyajabula ukuzwa ukuthi uqhubeka kahle.

SourceText: Hooray! I am delighted to hear that you are doing well.
text: Halala! Ngiyajabula ukuzwa ukuthi uqhubeka kahle.

SourceText: Fabulous! We are so happy to hear this.
text: Kwakuhle! Siyajabula ukuzwa lokhu.

SourceText: Fabulous! I am so happy to hear this.
text: Kwakuhle! Ngiyajabula ukuzwa lokhu.

SourceText: What a great feeling! We hope that good feeling continues throughout the entire day.
text: Kwawumuzwa omnandi! Siyethemba ukuthi umuzwa omnandi uzoqhubeka usuku lonke.

SourceText: What a great feeling! I hope that good feeling continues throughout the entire day.
text: Kwawumuzwa omnandi! Ngiyethemba ukuthi umuzwa omnandi uzoqhubeka usuku lonke.

SourceText: We are glad to hear this! We are sure your family is happy to see you this way as well.
text: Siyajabula ngokuzwa lokhu. Sineqiniso umndeni wakho ujabule nawo ukukubona unje.

SourceText: I am glad to hear this! I am sure your family is happy to see you this way as well.
text: Ngiyajabula ngokuzwa lokhu. Ngineqiniso umndeni wakho ujabule nawo ukukubona unje.

SourceText: What fantastic news! We hope you continue to feel good throughout the day.
text: Izindaba ezimnandi! Siyethemba uzoqhubeka nokuzizwa kahle usuku lonke.

SourceText: What fantastic news! I hope you continue to feel good throughout the day.
text: Izindaba ezimnandi! Ngiyethemba uzoqhubeka nokuzizwa kahle usuku lonke.

SourceText: It makes us very happy to hear that you are feeling good! Take that good energy and share it with others!
text: Kuyasijabulisa kakhulu ukuzwa ukuthi uzizwa kahle! Thatha lowo mfutho omuhle uwabele nabanye!

SourceText: It makes me very happy to hear that you are feeling good! Take that good energy and share it with others!
text: Kuyangijabulisa kakhulu ukuzwa ukuthi uzizwa kahle! Thatha lowo mfutho omuhle uwabele nabanye!

SourceText: Hi @fields.user_name! Could you be spending more time with your children and less time on your phone? Put it down and do something fun together!
text: Sawubona @fields.user_name! Ngabe uchitha isikhathi esiningi nezingane zakho sibe sincane osichitha ocingweni? Ibeke phansi emuva kwalokho nenze into emnandi ndawonye!
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Hi! Could you be spending more time with your children and less time on your phone? Put it down and do something fun together!
text: Sawubona! Ngabe uchitha isikhathi esiningi nezingane zakho sibe sincane osichitha ocingweni? Ibeke phansi emuva kwalokho nenze into emnandi ndawonye!

SourceText: Would you like a suggestion for an activity to do with your children?
text: Ungawuthanda umbono ngongakwenza nezingane zakho?

SourceText: That's okay! You can always get suggestions for activities to do by typing "Help". Chat later @fields.user_name!
text: Kulungile! Noma nini ungathola imibono ngezinto ongazenza ngokubhala “Help”. Sobuye sikhulume @fields.user_name
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Hi @fields.user_name! Would you like to learn more about how to talk to your children about COVID-19?
text: Sawubona @fields.user_name! Ungathanda ukufunda kabanzi ngokuthi ungakhuluma kanjani nezingane zakho ngeCOVID-19?
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Hi! Would you like to learn more about how to talk to your children about COVID-19?
text: Sawubona! Ungathanda ukufunda kabanzi ngokuthi ungakhuluma kanjani nezingane zakho ngeCOVID-19?

SourceText: Hi @fields.user_name! Would you like to learn more about your children's development?
text: Sawubona @fields.user_name! Ungathanda ukufunda kabanzi ngokukhula kwengane yakho?
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Hi! Would you like to learn more about your children's development?
text: Sawubona! Ungathanda ukufunda kabanzi ngokukhula kwengane yakho?

SourceText: Hi @fields.user_name! Would you like to learn more about how you could support children with disabilities?
text: Sawubona @fields.user_name! Ungathanda ukufunda kabanzi ngokuthi ungayeseka kanjani ingane yakho ephila nokukhubazeka?
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Hi! Would you like to learn more about how you could support children with disabilities?
text: Sawubona! Ungathanda ukufunda kabanzi ngokuthi ungayeseka kanjani ingane yakho ephila nokukhubazeka?

SourceText: Give me more information
text: Ngipheni olunye ulwazi
note: This is a quick reply and its translation should be uniquely identified by the corresponding argument
